content: 1 In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.
content_old: 1 In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.

content: 2 Now the earth had become waste and wild, and darkness was on the face of the roaring deep,—but the Spirit of God was brooding on the face of the waters.
content_old: 2 Now the earth had become waste and wild, and darkness was on the face of the roaring deep,—but the Spirit of God was brooding on the face of the waters.

content: 3 And God said— Light､ be. And light was.
content_old: 3 And God said— Light､ be. And light was.

content: 4 And God saw the light､ that it was good,—and God divided the light from the darkness;
content_old: 4 And God saw the light､ that it was good,—and God divided the light from the darkness;

content: 5 and God called the light day , but the darkness called he night. So it was evening—and it was morning､ one day.
content_old: 5 and God called the light day , but the darkness called he night. So it was evening—and it was morning､ one day.

content: 6 And God said, Let there be an expanse in the midst of the waters,—and let it be a means of dividing､ between waters and waters.
content_old: 6 And God said, Let there be an expanse in the midst of the waters,—and let it be a means of dividing､ between waters and waters.

content: 7 And God made the expanse, and it divided between the waters that were under the expanse and the waters that were above the expanse. And it was so.
content_old: 7 And God made the expanse, and it divided between the waters that were under the expanse and the waters that were above the expanse. And it was so.

content: 8 And God called the expanse heavens. So it was evening—and it was morning､ a second day.
content_old: 8 And God called the expanse heavens. So it was evening—and it was morning､ a second day.

content: 9 And God said— Let the waters under the heavens be gathered together into one place, and let the dry-ground appear. And it was so.
content_old: 9 And God said— Let the waters under the heavens be gathered together into one place, and let the dry-ground appear. And it was so.

content: 10 And God called the dry-ground land, but the gathering together of the waters called he seas. And God saw that it was good.
content_old: 10 And God called the dry-ground land, but the gathering together of the waters called he seas. And God saw that it was good.

content: 11 And God said— Let the land put-forth vegetation—herb yielding seed, fruit-tree､ bearing fruit､ after its kind, whose seed is within it､ on the land. And it was so.
content_old: 11 And God said— Let the land put-forth vegetation—herb yielding seed, fruit-tree､ bearing fruit､ after its kind, whose seed is within it､ on the land. And it was so.

content: 12 And the land brought-forth vegetation—herb yielding seed after its kind､ and tree bearing fruit､ whose seed is within it､ after its kind. And God saw that it was good.
content_old: 12 And the land brought-forth vegetation—herb yielding seed after its kind､ and tree bearing fruit､ whose seed is within it､ after its kind. And God saw that it was good.

content: 13 So it was evening—and it was morning､ a third day.
content_old: 13 So it was evening—and it was morning､ a third day.

content: 14 And God said— Let there be luminaries in the expanse of the heavens, to divide between the day and the night,—and let them be for signs､ and for seasons, and for days and years;
content_old: 14 And God said— Let there be luminaries in the expanse of the heavens, to divide between the day and the night,—and let them be for signs､ and for seasons, and for days and years;

content: 15 yea let them be for luminaries､ in the expanse of the heavens, to give light on the earth. And it was so.
content_old: 15 yea let them be for luminaries､ in the expanse of the heavens, to give light on the earth. And it was so.

content: 16 And God made the two great luminaries,—the greater luminary to rule the day, and the lesser luminary to rule the night, also the stars.
content_old: 16 And God made the two great luminaries,—the greater luminary to rule the day, and the lesser luminary to rule the night, also the stars.

content: 17 And God set them in the expanse of the heavens,—to give light on the earth;
content_old: 17 And God set them in the expanse of the heavens,—to give light on the earth;

content: 18 and to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness. And God saw that it was good.
content_old: 18 and to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness. And God saw that it was good.

content: 19 So it was evening—and it was morning､ a fourth day.
content_old: 19 So it was evening—and it was morning､ a fourth day.

content: 20 And God said— Let the waters swarm with an abundance of living soul, and birds shall fly over the earth, over the face of the expanse of the heavens.
content_old: 20 And God said— Let the waters swarm with an abundance of living soul, and birds shall fly over the earth, over the face of the expanse of the heavens.

content: 21 And God created the great sea-monsters,—and every living soul that moveth—with which the waters swarmed after their kind､ and every winged bird—after its kind. And God saw that it was good.
content_old: 21 And God created the great sea-monsters,—and every living soul that moveth—with which the waters swarmed after their kind､ and every winged bird—after its kind. And God saw that it was good.

content: 22 And God blessed them､ saying,— Be fruitful and multiply､ and fill the waters in the seas, and let the birds multiply in the land.
content_old: 22 And God blessed them､ saying,— Be fruitful and multiply､ and fill the waters in the seas, and let the birds multiply in the land.

content: 23 So it was evening—and it was morning､ a fifth day.
content_old: 23 So it was evening—and it was morning､ a fifth day.

content: 24 And God said— Let the land bring forth living soul､ after its kind, tame-beast and creeping thing and wild-beast of the land, after its kind. And it was so.
content_old: 24 And God said— Let the land bring forth living soul､ after its kind, tame-beast and creeping thing and wild-beast of the land, after its kind. And it was so.

content: 25 And God made the wild-beast of the land､ after its kind, and the tame-beast, after its kind, and every creeping thing of the ground､ after its kind. And God saw that it was good.
content_old: 25 And God made the wild-beast of the land､ after its kind, and the tame-beast, after its kind, and every creeping thing of the ground､ after its kind. And God saw that it was good.

content: 26 And God said— Let us make man in our image､ after our likeness,—and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea and over the bird of the heavens､ and over the tame-beast—and over all the land, and over every creeping thing､ that creepeth on the land.
content_old: 26 And God said— Let us make man in our image､ after our likeness,—and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea and over the bird of the heavens､ and over the tame-beast—and over all the land, and over every creeping thing､ that creepeth on the land.

content: 27 And God created the man in his own image, In the image of God created he him,— Male and female created he them.
content_old: 27 And God created the man in his own image, In the image of God created he him,— Male and female created he them.

content: 28 And God blessed them, and God said to them— Be fruitful and multiply and fill the earth､ and subdue it,—and have dominion over the fish of the sea､ and over the bird of the heavens, and over every living thing that moveth on the land.
content_old: 28 And God blessed them, and God said to them— Be fruitful and multiply and fill the earth､ and subdue it,—and have dominion over the fish of the sea､ and over the bird of the heavens, and over every living thing that moveth on the land.

content: 29 And God said— Lo! I have given to you—every herb yielding seed which is on the face of all the land, and every tree wherein is the fruit of a tree��� yielding seed,—to you shall it be､ for food;
content_old: 29 And God said— Lo! I have given to you—every herb yielding seed which is on the face of all the land, and every tree wherein is the fruit of a tree��� yielding seed,—to you shall it be､ for food;

content: 30 and to every living thing of the land—and to every bird of the heavens､ and to every thing that moveth on the land､ wherein is a living soul, every green herb for food. And it was so.
content_old: 30 and to every living thing of the land—and to every bird of the heavens､ and to every thing that moveth on the land､ wherein is a living soul, every green herb for food. And it was so.

content: 1 Thus were finished the heavens and the earth､ and all their host.
content_old: 1 Thus were finished the heavens and the earth､ and all their host.

content: 2 Thus God finished on the seventh day his work which he had made, and and rested, on the seventh day, from all his work which he had made.
content_old: 2 Thus God finished on the seventh day his work which he had made, and and rested, on the seventh day, from all his work which he had made.

content: 3 And God blessed the seventh day, and hallowed it,—because therein rested he from all his work which God by creating had made.
content_old: 3 And God blessed the seventh day, and hallowed it,—because therein rested he from all his work which God by creating had made.

content: 4 These are the geneses of the heavens and the earth､ when they were created,—in the day when Yahweh God made earth and heavens.
content_old: 4 These are the geneses of the heavens and the earth､ when they were created,—in the day when Yahweh God made earth and heavens.

content: 5 Now no bush of the field as yet—was in the earth, and no herb of the field as yet had sprung up,—because Yahweh God had not sent rain on the earth, and man was there none to till the ground;
content_old: 5 Now no bush of the field as yet—was in the earth, and no herb of the field as yet had sprung up,—because Yahweh God had not sent rain on the earth, and man was there none to till the ground;

content: 6 but a vapour went up from the earth,—and watered all the face of the ground.
content_old: 6 but a vapour went up from the earth,—and watered all the face of the ground.

content: 7 So then Yahweh God formed man､ of the dust of the ground, and breathed in his nostrils the breath of life—and man became a living soul.
content_old: 7 So then Yahweh God formed man､ of the dust of the ground, and breathed in his nostrils the breath of life—and man became a living soul.

content: 8 And Yahweh God planted a garden in Eden､ on the east,—and put there the man whom he had formed.
content_old: 8 And Yahweh God planted a garden in Eden､ on the east,—and put there the man whom he had formed.

content: 9 And Yahweh God caused to spring up out of the ground､ every tree pleasant to the sight and good for food,—and the tree of life､ in the midst of the garden, and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
content_old: 9 And Yahweh God caused to spring up out of the ground､ every tree pleasant to the sight and good for food,—and the tree of life､ in the midst of the garden, and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.

content: 10 Now a river was coming forth out of Eden, to water the garden,—and from thence it parted, and became four heads.
content_old: 10 Now a river was coming forth out of Eden, to water the garden,—and from thence it parted, and became four heads.

content: 11 The name of the one is Pishon,—the same is that which surroundeth all the land of Havilah, where is gold;
content_old: 11 The name of the one is Pishon,—the same is that which surroundeth all the land of Havilah, where is gold;

content: 12 moreover the gold of that land is good,—there is the bdellium､ and the beryl stone.
content_old: 12 moreover the gold of that land is good,—there is the bdellium､ and the beryl stone.

content: 13 And the name of the second river is Gihon,—the same is that which surroundeth all the land of Cush.
content_old: 13 And the name of the second river is Gihon,—the same is that which surroundeth all the land of Cush.

content: 14 And the name of the third river is Hiddekel, the same is that which goeth in front of Assyria; and the fourth river is Euphrates.
content_old: 14 And the name of the third river is Hiddekel, the same is that which goeth in front of Assyria; and the fourth river is Euphrates.

content: 15 So Yahweh God took the man,—and placed him in the garden of Eden, to till it､ and to keep it.
content_old: 15 So Yahweh God took the man,—and placed him in the garden of Eden, to till it､ and to keep it.

content: 16 And Yahweh God laid command on the man､ saying,— Of every tree of the garden thou mayest eat;
content_old: 16 And Yahweh God laid command on the man､ saying,— Of every tree of the garden thou mayest eat;

content: 17 but of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil thou shalt not eat of it,—for in the day thou eatest thereof thou shalt die.
content_old: 17 but of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil thou shalt not eat of it,—for in the day thou eatest thereof thou shalt die.

content: 18 And Yahweh God said, It is not good that the man should remain alone,—I will make for him a helper､ as his counterpart.
content_old: 18 And Yahweh God said, It is not good that the man should remain alone,—I will make for him a helper､ as his counterpart.

content: 19 Now Yahweh God had formed from the ground every living thing of the field､ and every bird of the heavens, which he brought in unto the man, that he might see what he should call it,—and whatsoever the man should call it—any living soul that should be the name thereof.
content_old: 19 Now Yahweh God had formed from the ground every living thing of the field､ and every bird of the heavens, which he brought in unto the man, that he might see what he should call it,—and whatsoever the man should call it—any living soul that should be the name thereof.

content: 20 So the man gave names to all the tame-beasts､ and to the birds of the heavens, and to all the wild-beasts of the field,—but for man had there not been found a helper､ as his counterpart.
content_old: 20 So the man gave names to all the tame-beasts､ and to the birds of the heavens, and to all the wild-beasts of the field,—but for man had there not been found a helper､ as his counterpart.

content: 21 So Yahweh God caused a deep sleep to fall on the man､ and he slept,—and he took one of his ribs, and closed up flesh instead thereof.
content_old: 21 So Yahweh God caused a deep sleep to fall on the man､ and he slept,—and he took one of his ribs, and closed up flesh instead thereof.

content: 22 And Yahweh God builded the rib which he had taken from the man､ into a woman, and brought her in unto the man.
content_old: 22 And Yahweh God builded the rib which he had taken from the man､ into a woman, and brought her in unto the man.

content: 23 And the man said, This one now is bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh! This one shall be called Woman, for out of a man hath this one been taken.
content_old: 23 And the man said, This one now is bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh! This one shall be called Woman, for out of a man hath this one been taken.

content: 24 For this cause will a man leave his father､ and his mother,—and cleave unto his wife, and they shall become one flesh.
content_old: 24 For this cause will a man leave his father､ and his mother,—and cleave unto his wife, and they shall become one flesh.

content: 1 Now the serpent was more crafty than any living thing of the field which Yahweh God had made,—so he said unto the woman, Can it really be､ that God hath said, Ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?
content_old: 1 Now the serpent was more crafty than any living thing of the field which Yahweh God had made,—so he said unto the woman, Can it really be､ that God hath said, Ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?

content: 2 And the woman said unto the serpent,— Of the fruit of the trees of the garden we may eat;
content_old: 2 And the woman said unto the serpent,— Of the fruit of the trees of the garden we may eat;

content: 3 but of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden God hath said､ Ye shall not eat of it､ neither shall ye touch it,—lest ye die.
content_old: 3 but of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden God hath said､ Ye shall not eat of it､ neither shall ye touch it,—lest ye die.

content: 4 And the serpent said unto the woman,— Ye shall not die.
content_old: 4 And the serpent said unto the woman,— Ye shall not die.

content: 5 For God doth know, that in the day ye eat thereof then shall your eyes be opened,—and ye shall become like God, knowing good and evil.
content_old: 5 For God doth know, that in the day ye eat thereof then shall your eyes be opened,—and ye shall become like God, knowing good and evil.

content: 6 And when the woman saw that the tree was good for food､ and that it was desirable to the eyes､ and the tree was pleasant to make one knowing then took she of the fruit thereof､ and did eat,—and she gave to her husband also､ along with her, and he did eat.
content_old: 6 And when the woman saw that the tree was good for food､ and that it was desirable to the eyes､ and the tree was pleasant to make one knowing then took she of the fruit thereof､ and did eat,—and she gave to her husband also､ along with her, and he did eat.

content: 7 Then were opened the eyes of them both, and they knew that naked they were,—so they tacked together fig-leaves, and made for themselves girdles.
content_old: 7 Then were opened the eyes of them both, and they knew that naked they were,—so they tacked together fig-leaves, and made for themselves girdles.

content: 8 Then heard they the sound of Yahweh God､ walking to and fro in the garden､ at the breeze of the day,—so he hid himself—the man with his wife､ from the face of Yahweh God, amid the trees of the garden.
content_old: 8 Then heard they the sound of Yahweh God､ walking to and fro in the garden､ at the breeze of the day,—so he hid himself—the man with his wife､ from the face of Yahweh God, amid the trees of the garden.

content: 9 And Yahweh God called unto the man,—and said to him､ Where art thou?
content_old: 9 And Yahweh God called unto the man,—and said to him､ Where art thou?

content: 10 And he said, The sound of thee heard I in the garden,—and I was afraid､ for naked was I, so I hid myself.
content_old: 10 And he said, The sound of thee heard I in the garden,—and I was afraid､ for naked was I, so I hid myself.

content: 11 And he said, Who told thee that naked thou wast? Of the tree whereof I commanded thee not to eat hast thou eaten?
content_old: 11 And he said, Who told thee that naked thou wast? Of the tree whereof I commanded thee not to eat hast thou eaten?

content: 12 And the man said,— The woman whom thou didst put with me she gave me of the tree､ so I did eat.
content_old: 12 And the man said,— The woman whom thou didst put with me she gave me of the tree､ so I did eat.

content: 13 Then said Yahweh God to the woman､ What is this that thou hast done? And the woman said, The serpent deceived me､ so I did eat.
content_old: 13 Then said Yahweh God to the woman､ What is this that thou hast done? And the woman said, The serpent deceived me､ so I did eat.

content: 14 Then said Yahweh God unto the serpent— Because thou hast done this Accursed art thou above every tame-beast, and above every wild-beast of the field,—on thy belly shalt thou go, and dust shalt thou eat､ all the days of thy life.
content_old: 14 Then said Yahweh God unto the serpent— Because thou hast done this Accursed art thou above every tame-beast, and above every wild-beast of the field,—on thy belly shalt thou go, and dust shalt thou eat､ all the days of thy life.

content: 15 And enmity will I put between thee､ and the woman, and between thy seed､ and her seed,— He shall crush thy head, But thou shalt crush his heel.
content_old: 15 And enmity will I put between thee､ and the woman, and between thy seed､ and her seed,— He shall crush thy head, But thou shalt crush his heel.

content: 16 Unto the woman he said､ I will increase thy pain of pregnancy, In pain shalt thou bear children,— Yet unto thy husband shall be thy longing, Though he rule over thee.
content_old: 16 Unto the woman he said､ I will increase thy pain of pregnancy, In pain shalt thou bear children,— Yet unto thy husband shall be thy longing, Though he rule over thee.

content: 17 And to the man he said､ Because thou didst hearken to the voice of thy wife, and so didst eat of the tree as to which I commanded thee saying, Thou shalt not eat of it Accursed be the ground for thy sake, In pain shalt thou eat of it､ all the days of thy life;
content_old: 17 And to the man he said､ Because thou didst hearken to the voice of thy wife, and so didst eat of the tree as to which I commanded thee saying, Thou shalt not eat of it Accursed be the ground for thy sake, In pain shalt thou eat of it､ all the days of thy life;

content: 18 Thorn also and thistle shall it shoot forth to thee,—when thou hast come to eat of the herb of the field:
content_old: 18 Thorn also and thistle shall it shoot forth to thee,—when thou hast come to eat of the herb of the field:

content: 19 In the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat bread, until thou return to the ground, because therefrom wast thou taken,— For dust thou art, And unto dust shalt thou return.
content_old: 19 In the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat bread, until thou return to the ground, because therefrom wast thou taken,— For dust thou art, And unto dust shalt thou return.

content: 20 So the man called the name of his wife､ Eve,—in that she was made mother of every one living.
content_old: 20 So the man called the name of his wife､ Eve,—in that she was made mother of every one living.

content: 21 And Yahweh God made for the man—and for his wife—tunics of skin､ and clothed them.
content_old: 21 And Yahweh God made for the man—and for his wife—tunics of skin､ and clothed them.

content: 22 Then said Yahweh God— Lo! man hath become like one of us, in respect of knowing good and evil,— Now therefore､ lest he thrust forth his hand､ and take even of the tree of life, and eat､ and live to times age-abiding—
content_old: 22 Then said Yahweh God— Lo! man hath become like one of us, in respect of knowing good and evil,— Now therefore､ lest he thrust forth his hand､ and take even of the tree of life, and eat､ and live to times age-abiding—

content: 23 So Yahweh God put him forth from the garden of Eden,—to till the ground wherefrom he had been taken.
content_old: 23 So Yahweh God put him forth from the garden of Eden,—to till the ground wherefrom he had been taken.

content: 1 Now the man having come to know Eve his wife,—she conceived､ and bare Cain, and said､ I have gotten a Man, even Yahweh!
content_old: 1 Now the man having come to know Eve his wife,—she conceived､ and bare Cain, and said､ I have gotten a Man, even Yahweh!

content: 2 And she went on to bear his brother, Abel,—and Abel became a feeder of sheep, whereas Cain was a tiller of the ground.
content_old: 2 And she went on to bear his brother, Abel,—and Abel became a feeder of sheep, whereas Cain was a tiller of the ground.

content: 3 So it came to pass after certain days that Cain brought in of the fruit of the ground a present to Yahweh:
content_old: 3 So it came to pass after certain days that Cain brought in of the fruit of the ground a present to Yahweh:

content: 4 Abel also､ even he brought in､ of the firstlings of his sheep､ and of their fat,—and Yahweh approved of Abel､ and of his present;
content_old: 4 Abel also､ even he brought in､ of the firstlings of his sheep､ and of their fat,—and Yahweh approved of Abel､ and of his present;

content: 5 but of Cain and his present he approved not,—and it angered Cain greatly､ and his countenance fell.
content_old: 5 but of Cain and his present he approved not,—and it angered Cain greatly､ and his countenance fell.

content: 6 So then Yahweh said unto Cain,— Wherefore hath it angered thee, and wherefore hath thy countenance fallen?
content_old: 6 So then Yahweh said unto Cain,— Wherefore hath it angered thee, and wherefore hath thy countenance fallen?

content: 7 Shall it not､ if thou do right､ be lifted up? But if thou do not right at the entrance a sin-bearer is lying,— Unto thee moreover､ shall be his longing, though thou rule over him.
content_old: 7 Shall it not､ if thou do right､ be lifted up? But if thou do not right at the entrance a sin-bearer is lying,— Unto thee moreover､ shall be his longing, though thou rule over him.

content: 8 And Cain said unto Abel his brother Let us go into the field And it came to pass when they were in the field that Cain rose up against Abel his brother､ and slew him.
content_old: 8 And Cain said unto Abel his brother Let us go into the field And it came to pass when they were in the field that Cain rose up against Abel his brother､ and slew him.

content: 9 Then said Yahweh unto Cain､ Where is Abel thy brother? And he said､ I know not, the keeper of my brother am I?
content_old: 9 Then said Yahweh unto Cain､ Where is Abel thy brother? And he said､ I know not, the keeper of my brother am I?

content: 10 And he said､ What hast thou done? With a voice the shed-blood of thy brother is crying out to me from the ground.
content_old: 10 And he said､ What hast thou done? With a voice the shed-blood of thy brother is crying out to me from the ground.

content: 11 Now therefore､ accursed art thou,—from the ground､ which hath opened her mouth, to receive the shed-blood of thy brother at thy hand.
content_old: 11 Now therefore､ accursed art thou,—from the ground､ which hath opened her mouth, to receive the shed-blood of thy brother at thy hand.

content: 12 Though thou till the ground it shall not go on to give its vigour to thee,— A wanderer and a fugitive shalt thou be in the earth.
content_old: 12 Though thou till the ground it shall not go on to give its vigour to thee,— A wanderer and a fugitive shalt thou be in the earth.

content: 13 And Cain said unto Yahweh— Greater is my punishment than I can bear
content_old: 13 And Cain said unto Yahweh— Greater is my punishment than I can bear

content: 14 Lo! thou has driven me out､ this day､ from off the face of the ground And from thy face shall I be hid,— So shall I become a wanderer and a fugitive in the earth, And it shall come to pass whosoever findeth me will slay me.
content_old: 14 Lo! thou has driven me out､ this day､ from off the face of the ground And from thy face shall I be hid,— So shall I become a wanderer and a fugitive in the earth, And it shall come to pass whosoever findeth me will slay me.

content: 15 And Yahweh said to him— Not so! whosoever slayeth Cain seven-fold shall it be avenged. So Yahweh set､ for Cain､ a sign, that none finding him should smite him.
content_old: 15 And Yahweh said to him— Not so! whosoever slayeth Cain seven-fold shall it be avenged. So Yahweh set､ for Cain､ a sign, that none finding him should smite him.

content: 16 So Cain went forth from the presence of Yahweh,—and dwelt in the land of Nod､ eastward of Eden.
content_old: 16 So Cain went forth from the presence of Yahweh,—and dwelt in the land of Nod､ eastward of Eden.

content: 17 And Cain knew his wife, and she conceived､ and bare Enoch,—Now it happened that he was building a city, so he called the name of the city､ after the name of his son､ Enoch.
content_old: 17 And Cain knew his wife, and she conceived､ and bare Enoch,—Now it happened that he was building a city, so he called the name of the city､ after the name of his son､ Enoch.

content: 18 And there was born to Enoch､ Irad, and Irad begat Mehujael,—and Mehujael begat Methusael,—and Methusael begat Lamech.
content_old: 18 And there was born to Enoch､ Irad, and Irad begat Mehujael,—and Mehujael begat Methusael,—and Methusael begat Lamech.

content: 19 And Lamech took to himself two wives,—the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the second Zillah.
content_old: 19 And Lamech took to himself two wives,—the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the second Zillah.

content: 20 And Adah bare Jabal,—he was father of such as dwell in tents､ and have cattle;
content_old: 20 And Adah bare Jabal,—he was father of such as dwell in tents､ and have cattle;

content: 21 and the name of his brother was Jubal,—he was father of everyone handling lyre and flute.
content_old: 21 and the name of his brother was Jubal,—he was father of everyone handling lyre and flute.

content: 22 And as for Zillah she also bare Tubal-Cain, a sharpener of every cutting instrument of bronze､ and iron,—and the sister of Tubal-Cain was Naamah.
content_old: 22 And as for Zillah she also bare Tubal-Cain, a sharpener of every cutting instrument of bronze､ and iron,—and the sister of Tubal-Cain was Naamah.

content: 23 Then said Lamech to his wives､ Adah and Zillah! hear ye my voice, Ye wives of Lamech! give ear to my tale,— For a man have I slain､ in dealing my wounds, Yea a youth in smiting my blows:
content_old: 23 Then said Lamech to his wives､ Adah and Zillah! hear ye my voice, Ye wives of Lamech! give ear to my tale,— For a man have I slain､ in dealing my wounds, Yea a youth in smiting my blows:

content: 24 If sevenfold be the avenging of Cain Then of Lamech seventy and seven.
content_old: 24 If sevenfold be the avenging of Cain Then of Lamech seventy and seven.

content: 25 And Adam again knew his wife, and she bare a son､ and called his name Seth,— For God hath appointed me another seed､ instead of Abel, because Cain slew him!

content: 1 This is the record of the generations of Adam,— In the day when God created man In the likeness of God made he him;

content: 2 Male and female created he them,—and blessed them､ and called their name Adam, in the day they were created.
content_old: 2 Male and female created he them,—and blessed them､ and called their name Adam, in the day they were created.

content: 3 And Adam lived､ a hundred and thirty years, and begat a son in his likeness､ after his image,—and called his name､ Seth:
content_old: 3 And Adam lived､ a hundred and thirty years, and begat a son in his likeness､ after his image,—and called his name､ Seth:

content: 4 and the days of Adam､ after he begat Seth, were eight hundred years,—and he begat sons and daughters.
content_old: 4 and the days of Adam､ after he begat Seth, were eight hundred years,—and he begat sons and daughters.

content: 5 So all the days of Adam which he lived, were nine hundred and thirty years,—and he died.

content_old: 6 And Seth lived､ a hundred and five years,—and begat Enosh;

content: 12 And Kenan lived seventy years,—and begat Mahalalel;
content_old: 12 And Kenan lived seventy years,—and begat Mahalalel;

content: 14 and all the days of Kenan were､ nine hundred and ten years,—and he died.

content: 15 And Mahalalel lived､ sixty-five years,—and begat Jared;
content_old: 15 And Mahalalel lived､ sixty-five years,—and begat Jared;

content: 16 and Mahalalel lived､ after he begat Jared, eight hundred and thirty years,—and begat sons and daughters;

content_old: 19 and Jared lived､ after he begat Enoch, eight hundred years,—and begat sons and daughters;

content: 21 And Enoch lived､ sixty-five years,—and begat Methuselah;
content_old: 21 And Enoch lived､ sixty-five years,—and begat Methuselah;

content_old: 22 and Enoch walked with God､ after he begat Methuselah, three hundred years,—and begat sons and daughters;

content_old: 25 And Methuselah lived､ a hundred and eighty-seven years,—and begat Lamech;

content_old: 26 and Methuselah lived､ after he begat Lamech, seven hundred and eighty-two years,—and begat sons and daughters;

content: 27 and all the days of Methuselah were､ nine hundred and sixty-nine years,—and he died.

content: 29 and he called his name Noah､ saying,— This one shall give us rest from our work､ And from the grievous toil of our hands, By reason of the ground which Yahweh hath cursed.
content_old: 29 and he called his name Noah､ saying,— This one shall give us rest from our work､ And from the grievous toil of our hands, By reason of the ground which Yahweh hath cursed.

content: 1 And it came to pass when men had begun to multiply on the face of the ground and daughters had been born to them
content_old: 1 And it came to pass when men had begun to multiply on the face of the ground and daughters had been born to them

content: 2 that the sons of God saw the daughters of men that they were fair,—so they took to themselves wives of whomsoever they chose.
content_old: 2 that the sons of God saw the daughters of men that they were fair,—so they took to themselves wives of whomsoever they chose.

content: 3 And Yahweh said— My spirit shall not rule in man to times age-abiding, for that he also is flesh,— Yet his days shall be a hundred and twenty years.
content_old: 3 And Yahweh said— My spirit shall not rule in man to times age-abiding, for that he also is flesh,— Yet his days shall be a hundred and twenty years.

content: 4 The giants were in the earth in those days, and also after that , when the sons of God began to go in unto the daughters of men, and sons were born to them the same were the heroes that were from age-past times､ the men of renown.
content_old: 4 The giants were in the earth in those days, and also after that , when the sons of God began to go in unto the daughters of men, and sons were born to them the same were the heroes that were from age-past times､ the men of renown.

content: 5 Then Yahweh saw that great was the wickedness of man in the earth, and that every purpose of the devices of his heart was only wicked all the day;
content_old: 5 Then Yahweh saw that great was the wickedness of man in the earth, and that every purpose of the devices of his heart was only wicked all the day;

content: 6 and it grieved Yahweh､ that he had made man in the earth,—and he took sorrow unto his heart.
content_old: 6 and it grieved Yahweh､ that he had made man in the earth,—and he took sorrow unto his heart.

content: 7 And Yahweh said— I must wipe off man whom I created､ from off the face of the ground, from man unto beast､ unto creeping thing､ and unto the bird of the heavens,—for I am grieved that I made them.
content_old: 7 And Yahweh said— I must wipe off man whom I created､ from off the face of the ground, from man unto beast､ unto creeping thing､ and unto the bird of the heavens,—for I am grieved that I made them.

content: 8 But Noah had found favour､ in the eyes of Yahweh.
content_old: 8 But Noah had found favour､ in the eyes of Yahweh.

content: 9 These are the generations of Noah, Noah was a righteous man､ blameless in his generations,—with God did Noah walk.
content_old: 9 These are the generations of Noah, Noah was a righteous man､ blameless in his generations,—with God did Noah walk.

content: 10 And Noah begat three sons,—Shem､ Ham and Japheth.
content_old: 10 And Noah begat three sons,—Shem､ Ham and Japheth.

content: 11 And the earth corrupted itself before God,—and the earth was filled with violence.
content_old: 11 And the earth corrupted itself before God,—and the earth was filled with violence.

content: 12 And God beheld the earth､ and lo! it had corrupted itself,—surely all flesh had corrupted its way､ on the earth.
content_old: 12 And God beheld the earth､ and lo! it had corrupted itself,—surely all flesh had corrupted its way､ on the earth.

content: 13 So God said unto Noah: The end of all flesh hath come in before me, for filled is the earth with violence､ because of them,—behold me､ then､ destroying them with the earth.
content_old: 13 So God said unto Noah: The end of all flesh hath come in before me, for filled is the earth with violence､ because of them,—behold me､ then､ destroying them with the earth.

content: 14 Make for thee an ark of timbers of gopher, rooms shalt thou make with the ark,—and—thou shalt cover it､ within and without､ with pitch.
content_old: 14 Make for thee an ark of timbers of gopher, rooms shalt thou make with the ark,—and—thou shalt cover it､ within and without､ with pitch.

content: 15 And this is how thou shalt make it,—three hundred cubits the length of the ark, fifty cubits the breadth there of, and thirty cubits the height thereof.
content_old: 15 And this is how thou shalt make it,—three hundred cubits the length of the ark, fifty cubits the breadth there of, and thirty cubits the height thereof.

content: 16 A place for light shalt thou make to the ark､ and to a cubit shalt thou finish it upwards, and the opening of the ark—in the side thereof shalt thou put,—with lower､ second､ and third stories shalt thou make it.
content_old: 16 A place for light shalt thou make to the ark､ and to a cubit shalt thou finish it upwards, and the opening of the ark—in the side thereof shalt thou put,—with lower､ second､ and third stories shalt thou make it.

content: 17 And I behold me! bringing in the flood—even waters､ upon the earth, to destroy all flesh､ wherein is the spirit of life, from under the heavens,—everything that is in the earth shall cease to breathe:
content_old: 17 And I behold me! bringing in the flood—even waters､ upon the earth, to destroy all flesh､ wherein is the spirit of life, from under the heavens,—everything that is in the earth shall cease to breathe:

content: 18 therefore will I establish my covenant with thee,—and thou shalt enter into the ark, thou､ and thy sons､ and thy wife､ and thy sons’ wives with thee.
content_old: 18 therefore will I establish my covenant with thee,—and thou shalt enter into the ark, thou､ and thy sons､ and thy wife､ and thy sons’ wives with thee.

content: 19 Moreover､ of all the living creatures of all flesh—two of each shalt thou bring into the ark､ to keep alive with thee,—male and female shall they be.
content_old: 19 Moreover､ of all the living creatures of all flesh—two of each shalt thou bring into the ark､ to keep alive with thee,—male and female shall they be.

content: 20 Of the bird after its kind and of the beast after its kind, and of every creeping thing of the ground､ after its kind two of each shall come in unto thee､ for keeping alive.
content_old: 20 Of the bird after its kind and of the beast after its kind, and of every creeping thing of the ground､ after its kind two of each shall come in unto thee､ for keeping alive.

content: 21 But thou take to thee of all food that is eaten, and gather it unto thee,—and it shall be for thee and for them､ for food.
content_old: 21 But thou take to thee of all food that is eaten, and gather it unto thee,—and it shall be for thee and for them､ for food.

content: 1 And Yahweh said to Noah, Enter､ thou and all thy house､ into the ark,—for thee have I seen righteous before me､ in this generation.
content_old: 1 And Yahweh said to Noah, Enter､ thou and all thy house､ into the ark,—for thee have I seen righteous before me､ in this generation.

content: 2 Of all the clean beasts shalt thou take to thee､ by sevens､ a male and his female,—and of the beasts that are not clean, shall be two､ a male and his female.
content_old: 2 Of all the clean beasts shalt thou take to thee､ by sevens､ a male and his female,—and of the beasts that are not clean, shall be two､ a male and his female.

content: 3 Also of the bird of the heavens by sevens､ male and female,—to keep alive a seed on the face of all the earth.
content_old: 3 Also of the bird of the heavens by sevens､ male and female,—to keep alive a seed on the face of all the earth.

content: 4 For in seven days､ more I am sending rain on the earth, forty days and forty nights,—so will I wipe out all the living things which I have made, from off the face of the ground.
content_old: 4 For in seven days､ more I am sending rain on the earth, forty days and forty nights,—so will I wipe out all the living things which I have made, from off the face of the ground.

content: 5 And Noah did,—according to all that Yahweh commanded him.
content_old: 5 And Noah did,—according to all that Yahweh commanded him.

content: 6 Now Noah was six hundred years old,—when the flood came, even waters､ on the earth.
content_old: 6 Now Noah was six hundred years old,—when the flood came, even waters､ on the earth.

content: 7 So Noah entered, and his sons and his wife and his sons’ wives with him､ into the ark,—from before the waters of the flood.
content_old: 7 So Noah entered, and his sons and his wife and his sons’ wives with him､ into the ark,—from before the waters of the flood.

content: 8 Of the beasts that were clean, and of the beasts that were not clean,—and of the birds, and everything that creepeth on the ground,
content_old: 8 Of the beasts that were clean, and of the beasts that were not clean,—and of the birds, and everything that creepeth on the ground,

content: 9 two and two went they in unto Noah､ into the ark､ male and female,—as God commanded Noah.
content_old: 9 two and two went they in unto Noah､ into the ark､ male and female,—as God commanded Noah.

content: 10 And it came to pass､ in the seven days,—that the waters of the flood came on the earth.
content_old: 10 And it came to pass､ in the seven days,—that the waters of the flood came on the earth.

content: 11 In the six hundredth year, the year of the life of Noah､ in the second month､ on the seventeenth day of the month—on this day were burst open､ all the fountains of the great roaring deep, and the windows of the heavens were set open. (
content_old: 11 In the six hundredth year, the year of the life of Noah､ in the second month､ on the seventeenth day of the month—on this day were burst open､ all the fountains of the great roaring deep, and the windows of the heavens were set open. (

content: 12 And it came to pass､ that the heavy rain was on the earth,—forty days and forty nights.)
content_old: 12 And it came to pass､ that the heavy rain was on the earth,—forty days and forty nights.)

content: 13 On this selfsame day entered Noah, and Shem and Ham and Japheth､ Noah’s sons,—and Noah’s wife､ and his sons’ three wives with them､ into the ark:
content_old: 13 On this selfsame day entered Noah, and Shem and Ham and Japheth､ Noah’s sons,—and Noah’s wife､ and his sons’ three wives with them､ into the ark:

content: 14 they､ and all the wild-beasts after their kind､ and all the tame-beasts after their kind, and all the creeping things that creep on the earth､ after their kind,—and all the birds after their kind､ every bird of every wing.
content_old: 14 they､ and all the wild-beasts after their kind､ and all the tame-beasts after their kind, and all the creeping things that creep on the earth､ after their kind,—and all the birds after their kind､ every bird of every wing.

content: 15 So they entered in unto Noah､ into the ark,—two and two of all flesh, wherein was the spirit of life.
content_old: 15 So they entered in unto Noah､ into the ark,—two and two of all flesh, wherein was the spirit of life.

content: 16 And they that entered male and female of all flesh entered, as God commanded him,—and Yahweh shut him in round about.
content_old: 16 And they that entered male and female of all flesh entered, as God commanded him,—and Yahweh shut him in round about.

content: 17 And it came to pass､ that the flood was forty days on the earth,—and the waters increased､ and bare up the ark, and it was lifted high above the earth.
content_old: 17 And it came to pass､ that the flood was forty days on the earth,—and the waters increased､ and bare up the ark, and it was lifted high above the earth.

content: 18 And the waters prevailed and increased greatly､ on the earth,—and the ark went its way on the face of the waters.
content_old: 18 And the waters prevailed and increased greatly､ on the earth,—and the ark went its way on the face of the waters.

content: 19 Yea the waters prevailed very greatly､ on the earth,—so that all the high mountains became covered, that were under all the heavens:
content_old: 19 Yea the waters prevailed very greatly､ on the earth,—so that all the high mountains became covered, that were under all the heavens:

content: 20 fifteen cubits upwards prevailed the waters,—so that the mountains became covered.
content_old: 20 fifteen cubits upwards prevailed the waters,—so that the mountains became covered.

content: 21 And all flesh ceased to breathe that moved on the earth､ of birds and of tame-beasts and of wild-beasts､ and of all the swarming things that swarm on the earth,—and all mankind.
content_old: 21 And all flesh ceased to breathe that moved on the earth､ of birds and of tame-beasts and of wild-beasts､ and of all the swarming things that swarm on the earth,—and all mankind.

content: 22 All in whose nostrils was the breath of the spirit of life､ of all that were on the dry ground died.
content_old: 22 All in whose nostrils was the breath of the spirit of life､ of all that were on the dry ground died.

content: 23 Thus was wiped out all that existed on the face of the ground､ from man unto beast､ unto creeping thing and unto the bird of the heavens, thus were they wiped out from the earth,—so that there was left—only Noah and they that were with him in the ark.
content_old: 23 Thus was wiped out all that existed on the face of the ground､ from man unto beast､ unto creeping thing and unto the bird of the heavens, thus were they wiped out from the earth,—so that there was left—only Noah and they that were with him in the ark.

content: 1 And God remembered Noah, and all the wild-beasts､ and all the tame-beasts that were with him in the ark,—and God caused a wind to pass over the earth, and the waters subsided;
content_old: 1 And God remembered Noah, and all the wild-beasts､ and all the tame-beasts that were with him in the ark,—and God caused a wind to pass over the earth, and the waters subsided;

content: 2 and the fountains of the roaring-deep were shut, and the windows of the heavens,—and the heavy rain was restrained from the heavens;
content_old: 2 and the fountains of the roaring-deep were shut, and the windows of the heavens,—and the heavy rain was restrained from the heavens;

content: 3 and the waters returned from off the earth､ they went on returning,—and so the waters decreased at the end of a hundred and fifty days.
content_old: 3 and the waters returned from off the earth､ they went on returning,—and so the waters decreased at the end of a hundred and fifty days.

content: 4 And the ark rested､ in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month,—on the mountains of Ararat.
content_old: 4 And the ark rested､ in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month,—on the mountains of Ararat.

content: 5 But the waters went on decreasing, until the tenth month,—in the tenth month､ on the first of the month were seen the tops of the mountains.
content_old: 5 But the waters went on decreasing, until the tenth month,—in the tenth month､ on the first of the month were seen the tops of the mountains.

content: 6 And it came to pass at the end of forty days that Noah opened the window of the ark that he had made;
content_old: 6 And it came to pass at the end of forty days that Noah opened the window of the ark that he had made;

content: 7 and sent forth a raven,—and it kept going forth and returning, until the drying up of the waters from off the earth.
content_old: 7 and sent forth a raven,—and it kept going forth and returning, until the drying up of the waters from off the earth.

content: 8 And he sent forth a dove from him,—to see whether the waters had abated, from off the face of the ground;
content_old: 8 And he sent forth a dove from him,—to see whether the waters had abated, from off the face of the ground;

content: 9 but the dove found no resting-place for the sole of her foot､ so she returned unto him into the ark, for waters were on the face of all the earth; and he put forth his hand､ and took her, and brought her in unto him､ into the ark.
content_old: 9 but the dove found no resting-place for the sole of her foot､ so she returned unto him into the ark, for waters were on the face of all the earth; and he put forth his hand､ and took her, and brought her in unto him､ into the ark.

content: 10 Then stayed he yet seven days more,—and again sent forth the dove､ out of the ark.
content_old: 10 Then stayed he yet seven days more,—and again sent forth the dove､ out of the ark.

content: 11 And the dove came in unto him at eventide, and lo! a newly sprouted olive-leaf in her mouth,—so Noah knew that the waters had abated from off the earth.
content_old: 11 And the dove came in unto him at eventide, and lo! a newly sprouted olive-leaf in her mouth,—so Noah knew that the waters had abated from off the earth.

content: 12 And he stayed yet seven days more,—and sent forth the dove, but she returned not again unto him any more.
content_old: 12 And he stayed yet seven days more,—and sent forth the dove, but she returned not again unto him any more.

content: 13 So it came to pass in the six hundred and first year､ at the beginning､ on the first of the month that the waters had dried up from off the earth,—and Noah removed the covering of the ark, and looked､ and lo! the face of the ground was dried.
content_old: 13 So it came to pass in the six hundred and first year､ at the beginning､ on the first of the month that the waters had dried up from off the earth,—and Noah removed the covering of the ark, and looked､ and lo! the face of the ground was dried.

content: 14 And in the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month was the earth dry.
content_old: 14 And in the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month was the earth dry.

content: 15 So then､ God spake to Noah､ saying:
content_old: 15 So then､ God spake to Noah､ saying:

content: 16 Come forth､ out of the ark,—thou､ and thy wife､ and thy sons､ and thy sons’ wives､ with thee.
content_old: 16 Come forth､ out of the ark,—thou､ and thy wife､ and thy sons､ and thy sons’ wives､ with thee.

content: 17 All the living creatures that are with thee of all flesh､ among birds, and among beasts, and among all the creeping things that creep on the earth bring forth with thee,—and they shall swarm in the earth, and be fruitful and multiply､ on the earth.
content_old: 17 All the living creatures that are with thee of all flesh､ among birds, and among beasts, and among all the creeping things that creep on the earth bring forth with thee,—and they shall swarm in the earth, and be fruitful and multiply､ on the earth.

content: 18 So Noah came forth,—and his sons､ and his wife､ and his sons’ wives､ with him:
content_old: 18 So Noah came forth,—and his sons､ and his wife､ and his sons’ wives､ with him:

content: 19 All the living creatures､ all that move along, and all birds, and all that moveth along over the earth—by their families came forth out of the ark.
content_old: 19 All the living creatures､ all that move along, and all birds, and all that moveth along over the earth—by their families came forth out of the ark.

content: 20 And Noah builded an altar to Yahweh,—and took of all the clean beasts､ and of all the clean birds, and caused ascending sacrifices to go up on the altar.
content_old: 20 And Noah builded an altar to Yahweh,—and took of all the clean beasts､ and of all the clean birds, and caused ascending sacrifices to go up on the altar.

content: 21 And Yahweh smelled a satisfying odour, so Yahweh said to himself､ I will not again curse any more the ground､ for man’s sake, although the device of the heart of man be wicked from his youth,—neither will I again､ any more smite every living thing､ as I have done.
content_old: 21 And Yahweh smelled a satisfying odour, so Yahweh said to himself､ I will not again curse any more the ground､ for man’s sake, although the device of the heart of man be wicked from his youth,—neither will I again､ any more smite every living thing､ as I have done.

content: 1 So God blessed Noah and his sons,—and said to them､ Be fruitful and multiply､ and fill the earth;
content_old: 1 So God blessed Noah and his sons,—and said to them､ Be fruitful and multiply､ and fill the earth;

content: 2 and let the fear of you and the dread of you be upon every living creature of the earth, and upon every bird of the heavens,—over everything that moveth along on the ground, and over all the fishes of the sea,—into your hand have they been given.
content_old: 2 and let the fear of you and the dread of you be upon every living creature of the earth, and upon every bird of the heavens,—over everything that moveth along on the ground, and over all the fishes of the sea,—into your hand have they been given.

content: 3 As for every moving thing that hath life yours shall it be､ for food,— Like the green herb have I given you all things.
content_old: 3 As for every moving thing that hath life yours shall it be､ for food,— Like the green herb have I given you all things.

content: 4 Yet flesh with the life thereof, the blood thereof shall ye not eat;
content_old: 4 Yet flesh with the life thereof, the blood thereof shall ye not eat;

content: 5 And surely your blood､ of your lives will I require, From the hand of every living creature will I require it,—and from the hand of man､ From the hand of each one’s brother will I require the life of man:
content_old: 5 And surely your blood､ of your lives will I require, From the hand of every living creature will I require it,—and from the hand of man､ From the hand of each one’s brother will I require the life of man:

content: 6 He that sheddeth man’s blood by man shall his blood be shed,— For in the image of God made he man.
content_old: 6 He that sheddeth man’s blood by man shall his blood be shed,— For in the image of God made he man.

content: 7 Ye therefore､ be fruitful and multiply,—swarm in the earth､ and multiply therein.
content_old: 7 Ye therefore､ be fruitful and multiply,—swarm in the earth､ and multiply therein.

content: 8 And God spake unto Noah, and unto his sons with him､ saying:
content_old: 8 And God spake unto Noah, and unto his sons with him､ saying:

content: 9 I therefore､ behold me! establishing my covenant with you,—and with your seed after you;
content_old: 9 I therefore､ behold me! establishing my covenant with you,—and with your seed after you;

content: 10 and with every living soul that is with you, of birds､ of tame-beasts､ and of all wild-beasts of the earth､ that are with you,—of all coming forth out of the ark, even to all wild-beasts of the earth;
content_old: 10 and with every living soul that is with you, of birds､ of tame-beasts､ and of all wild-beasts of the earth､ that are with you,—of all coming forth out of the ark, even to all wild-beasts of the earth;

content: 11 yea I will establish my covenant with you, so that all flesh shall not be cut off any more､ by reason of the waters of a flood,—neither shall there be any more a flood､ to destroy the earth.
content_old: 11 yea I will establish my covenant with you, so that all flesh shall not be cut off any more､ by reason of the waters of a flood,—neither shall there be any more a flood､ to destroy the earth.

content: 12 And God said､ This is the sign of the covenant､ which I am granting betwixt me and you, and every living soul that is with you,—to age-abiding generations:—
content_old: 12 And God said､ This is the sign of the covenant､ which I am granting betwixt me and you, and every living soul that is with you,—to age-abiding generations:—

content: 13 My bow have I set in the cloud.—and it shall be for a sign of a covenant, betwixt me and the earth;
content_old: 13 My bow have I set in the cloud.—and it shall be for a sign of a covenant, betwixt me and the earth;

content: 14 and it shall be when I draw a veil of cloud over the earth,—and the bow in the cloud appeareth
content_old: 14 and it shall be when I draw a veil of cloud over the earth,—and the bow in the cloud appeareth

content: 15 then will I remember my covenant､ which is betwixt me and you, and every living soul､ among all flesh,—that the waters may no more become a flood, to destroy all flesh:
content_old: 15 then will I remember my covenant､ which is betwixt me and you, and every living soul､ among all flesh,—that the waters may no more become a flood, to destroy all flesh:

content: 16 so the bow shall be in the cloud,—and I will behold it､ to remember an age-abiding covenant, between God, and every living soul､ among all flesh that is on the earth.
content_old: 16 so the bow shall be in the cloud,—and I will behold it､ to remember an age-abiding covenant, between God, and every living soul､ among all flesh that is on the earth.

content: 17 And God said unto Noah,— This is the sign of the covenant､ which I have established, between me､ and all flesh that is on the earth.
content_old: 17 And God said unto Noah,— This is the sign of the covenant､ which I have established, between me､ and all flesh that is on the earth.

content: 18 And the sons of Noah who came forth out of the ark. were—Shem and Ham and Japheth,—now Ham was the father of Canaan.
content_old: 18 And the sons of Noah who came forth out of the ark. were—Shem and Ham and Japheth,—now Ham was the father of Canaan.

content: 19 These three were the sons of Noah,—and from these was all the earth overspread.
content_old: 19 These three were the sons of Noah,—and from these was all the earth overspread.

content: 20 And Noah began to be a husbandman,—so he planted a vineyard;
content_old: 20 And Noah began to be a husbandman,—so he planted a vineyard;

content: 21 and drank of the wine､ and became drunk,—and uncovered himself in the midst of his tent.
content_old: 21 and drank of the wine､ and became drunk,—and uncovered himself in the midst of his tent.

content: 22 And Ham､ the father of Canaan､ saw his father’s shame,—and told his two brethren､ outside.
content_old: 22 And Ham､ the father of Canaan､ saw his father’s shame,—and told his two brethren､ outside.

content: 23 And Shem and Japheth took a mantle､ and put it on the shoulder of them both､ and went backwards, and covered the shame of their father,—but their faces were backwards, and the shame of their father saw they not.
content_old: 23 And Shem and Japheth took a mantle､ and put it on the shoulder of them both､ and went backwards, and covered the shame of their father,—but their faces were backwards, and the shame of their father saw they not.

content: 24 And Noah awoke from his wine,—and came to know what his youngest son had done to him.
content_old: 24 And Noah awoke from his wine,—and came to know what his youngest son had done to him.

content: 25 And he said､ Accursed be Canaan,—a servant of servants shall he be to his brethren!
content_old: 25 And he said､ Accursed be Canaan,—a servant of servants shall he be to his brethren!

content: 26 And he said､ Blessed be Yahweh､ God of Shem,— And let Canaan be their servant:
content_old: 26 And he said､ Blessed be Yahweh､ God of Shem,— And let Canaan be their servant:

content: 27 God give extension to Japheth, But make his habitation in the tents of Shem,— And let Canaan be their servant.
content_old: 27 God give extension to Japheth, But make his habitation in the tents of Shem,— And let Canaan be their servant.

content: 28 And Noah lived､ after the flood,—three hundred and fifty years:
content_old: 28 And Noah lived､ after the flood,—three hundred and fifty years:

content: 1 Now these are the generations of the sons of Noah, Shem､ Ham, and Japheth,—and there were born to them sons､ after the flood.
content_old: 1 Now these are the generations of the sons of Noah, Shem､ Ham, and Japheth,—and there were born to them sons､ after the flood.

content: 2 The sons of Japheth: Gomer and Magog, and Madai､ and Javan and Tubal,—and Meshech､ and Tiras.
content_old: 2 The sons of Japheth: Gomer and Magog, and Madai､ and Javan and Tubal,—and Meshech､ and Tiras.

content: 3 And the sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz and Riphath､ and Togarmah.
content_old: 3 And the sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz and Riphath､ and Togarmah.

content: 4 And the sons of Javan: Elishah and Tarshish,—Kittim､ and Rodanim.
content_old: 4 And the sons of Javan: Elishah and Tarshish,—Kittim､ and Rodanim.

content: 5 From these were dispersed the inhabitants of the coastlands of the nations､ in their lands, each man by his tongue,—by their families､ in their nations.
content_old: 5 From these were dispersed the inhabitants of the coastlands of the nations､ in their lands, each man by his tongue,—by their families､ in their nations.

content: 6 And the sons of Ham: Cush and Mizraim､ and Phut and Canaan.
content_old: 6 And the sons of Ham: Cush and Mizraim､ and Phut and Canaan.

content: 7 And the sons of Cush: Seba､ and Havilah, and Sabtah and Raamah､ and Sabtechah,— And the sons of Raamah Sheba and Dedan.
content_old: 7 And the sons of Cush: Seba､ and Havilah, and Sabtah and Raamah､ and Sabtechah,— And the sons of Raamah Sheba and Dedan.

content: 8 And Cush begat Nimrod,—he became a hero in the earth;
content_old: 8 And Cush begat Nimrod,—he became a hero in the earth;

content: 9 he became a hero of hunting before Yahweh,—for this cause it is said, Like Nimrod､ a hero of hunting before Yahweh.
content_old: 9 he became a hero of hunting before Yahweh,—for this cause it is said, Like Nimrod､ a hero of hunting before Yahweh.

content: 10 So the beginning of his kingdom came to be Babel, and Erech､ and Accad and Calneh,—in the land of Shinar.
content_old: 10 So the beginning of his kingdom came to be Babel, and Erech､ and Accad and Calneh,—in the land of Shinar.

content: 11 From that land went forth Asshur,—and he built Nineveh, and Rehoboth-ir､ and Calah;
content_old: 11 From that land went forth Asshur,—and he built Nineveh, and Rehoboth-ir､ and Calah;

content: 12 and Resen､ between Nineveh and Calah,—the same is the great city.
content_old: 12 and Resen､ between Nineveh and Calah,—the same is the great city.

content: 13 And Mizraim begat Ludim and Anamim and Lehabim､ and Naphtuchim;
content_old: 13 And Mizraim begat Ludim and Anamim and Lehabim､ and Naphtuchim;

content: 14 and Pathrusim and Casluhim､ whence came forth Philistim and Caphtorim.
content_old: 14 and Pathrusim and Casluhim､ whence came forth Philistim and Caphtorim.

content: 15 And Canaan begat Zidon his firstborn､ and Heth;
content_old: 15 And Canaan begat Zidon his firstborn､ and Heth;

content: 16 and the Jebusite､ and the Amorite, and the Girgashite;
content_old: 16 and the Jebusite､ and the Amorite, and the Girgashite;

content: 17 and the Hivite and the Arkite､ and the Sinite;
content_old: 17 and the Hivite and the Arkite､ and the Sinite;

content: 18 and the Arvadite and the Zemarite､ and the Hamathite,—and afterwards were spread abroad the families of the Canaanite.
content_old: 18 and the Arvadite and the Zemarite､ and the Hamathite,—and afterwards were spread abroad the families of the Canaanite.

content: 19 And it came to pass､ that the boundary of the Canaanite was from Zidon, as thou enterest in towards Gerar､ unto Gaza,—as thou enterest in towards Sodom and Gomorrah and Admah and Zeboim､ as far as Lasha.
content_old: 19 And it came to pass､ that the boundary of the Canaanite was from Zidon, as thou enterest in towards Gerar､ unto Gaza,—as thou enterest in towards Sodom and Gomorrah and Admah and Zeboim､ as far as Lasha.

content: 20 These are the sons of Ham, by their families､ by their tongues,—in their lands､ in their nations.
content_old: 20 These are the sons of Ham, by their families､ by their tongues,—in their lands､ in their nations.

content: 21 Now to Shem father of all the sons of Eber, elder brother of Japheth to him also were children born.
content_old: 21 Now to Shem father of all the sons of Eber, elder brother of Japheth to him also were children born.

content: 22 The sons of Shem: Elam and Asshur,—and Arpachshad､ and Lud and Aram.
content_old: 22 The sons of Shem: Elam and Asshur,—and Arpachshad､ and Lud and Aram.

content: 23 And the sons of Aram: Uz and Hul､ and Gether and Mash.
content_old: 23 And the sons of Aram: Uz and Hul､ and Gether and Mash.

content: 24 Now Arpachshad begat Shelah,—and Shelah begat Eber.
content_old: 24 Now Arpachshad begat Shelah,—and Shelah begat Eber.

content: 25 And to Eber were born two sons,—the name of the one was Peleg, for in his days was the earth divided, and the name of his brother was Joktan.
content_old: 25 And to Eber were born two sons,—the name of the one was Peleg, for in his days was the earth divided, and the name of his brother was Joktan.

content: 26 Now Joktan begat Almodad､ and Sheleph,—and Hazarmaveth､ and Jerah;
content_old: 26 Now Joktan begat Almodad､ and Sheleph,—and Hazarmaveth､ and Jerah;

content: 27 and Hadoram and Uzal､ and Diklah;
content_old: 27 and Hadoram and Uzal､ and Diklah;

content: 28 and Obal and Abimael､ and Sheba;
content_old: 28 and Obal and Abimael､ and Sheba;

content: 29 and Ophir and Havilah､ and Jobab,—all these were sons of Joktan.
content_old: 29 and Ophir and Havilah､ and Jobab,—all these were sons of Joktan.

content: 30 And it came to pass that their dwelling was from Mesha,—as thou enterest in towards Sephar､ the mountain of the east.
content_old: 30 And it came to pass that their dwelling was from Mesha,—as thou enterest in towards Sephar､ the mountain of the east.

content: 31 These are the sons of Shem, by their families､ by their tongues,—in their lands､ by their nations.
content_old: 31 These are the sons of Shem, by their families､ by their tongues,—in their lands､ by their nations.

content: 1 So it came to pass that all the earth was of one manner of speech,—and of one stock of words.
content_old: 1 So it came to pass that all the earth was of one manner of speech,—and of one stock of words.

content: 2 And it came to pass as they brake away onwards､ that they found a plain in the land of Shinar､ and dwelt there.
content_old: 2 And it came to pass as they brake away onwards､ that they found a plain in the land of Shinar､ and dwelt there.

content: 3 Then said they､ each man to his friend, Come on! let us make bricks, and burn them thoroughly,— So the bricks served them for stone, and bitumen served them for mortar.
content_old: 3 Then said they､ each man to his friend, Come on! let us make bricks, and burn them thoroughly,— So the bricks served them for stone, and bitumen served them for mortar.

content: 4 And they said､ Come on! let us build for ourselves a city､ and a tower with its head in the heavens, so let us make for ourselves a name,—lest we be scattered abroad over the face of all the earth.
content_old: 4 And they said､ Come on! let us build for ourselves a city､ and a tower with its head in the heavens, so let us make for ourselves a name,—lest we be scattered abroad over the face of all the earth.

content: 5 And Yahweh came down, to behold the city､ and the tower,—which the sons of men had built.
content_old: 5 And Yahweh came down, to behold the city､ and the tower,—which the sons of men had built.

content: 6 Then said Yahweh: Lo! one people､ and one manner of speech have they all, this then is what they have begun to do,—now therefore､ nothing will be withholden from them､ which they may plan to do.
content_old: 6 Then said Yahweh: Lo! one people､ and one manner of speech have they all, this then is what they have begun to do,—now therefore､ nothing will be withholden from them､ which they may plan to do.

content: 7 Come on! let us go down, and there confuse their speech,—that they may not understand, each man the speech of his friend.
content_old: 7 Come on! let us go down, and there confuse their speech,—that they may not understand, each man the speech of his friend.

content: 8 So Yahweh scattered them from thence､ over the face of all the earth,—and so they left off building the city.
content_old: 8 So Yahweh scattered them from thence､ over the face of all the earth,—and so they left off building the city.

content: 9 For this cause was the name thereof called Babel ; because there did Yahweh confuse the speech of all the earth,—and from thence did Yahweh scatter them abroad, over the face of all the earth.
content_old: 9 For this cause was the name thereof called Babel ; because there did Yahweh confuse the speech of all the earth,—and from thence did Yahweh scatter them abroad, over the face of all the earth.

content: 10 These are the genealogies of Shem, Shem was a hundred years old when he begat Arpachshad, two years after the flood;
content_old: 10 These are the genealogies of Shem, Shem was a hundred years old when he begat Arpachshad, two years after the flood;

content: 11 and Shem lived､ after he begat Arpachshad, five hundred years,—and begat sons and daughters.
content_old: 11 and Shem lived､ after he begat Arpachshad, five hundred years,—and begat sons and daughters.

content: 12 And Arpachshad lived thirty-five years,—and begat Shelah;
content_old: 12 And Arpachshad lived thirty-five years,—and begat Shelah;

content: 13 and Arpachshad lived､ after he begat Shelah, four hundred and three years,—and begat sons and daughters.
content_old: 13 and Arpachshad lived､ after he begat Shelah, four hundred and three years,—and begat sons and daughters.

content: 14 And Shelah lived thirty years,—and begat Eber;
content_old: 14 And Shelah lived thirty years,—and begat Eber;

content: 15 and Shelah lived､ after he begat Eber, four hundred and three years,—and begat sons and daughters.
content_old: 15 and Shelah lived､ after he begat Eber, four hundred and three years,—and begat sons and daughters.

content: 16 And Eber lived､ thirty-four years,—and begat Peleg;
content_old: 16 And Eber lived､ thirty-four years,—and begat Peleg;

content: 17 and Eber lived､ after he begat Peleg, four hundred and thirty years,—and begat sons and daughters.
content_old: 17 and Eber lived､ after he begat Peleg, four hundred and thirty years,—and begat sons and daughters.

content: 18 And Peleg lived thirty years, and begat Reu:
content_old: 18 And Peleg lived thirty years, and begat Reu:

content: 19 and Peleg lived､ after he begat Reu, two hundred and nine years,—and begat sons and daughters.
content_old: 19 and Peleg lived､ after he begat Reu, two hundred and nine years,—and begat sons and daughters.

content: 20 And Reu lived thirty-two years,—and begat Serug;
content_old: 20 And Reu lived thirty-two years,—and begat Serug;

content: 21 and Reu lived､ after he begat Serug, two hundred and seven years,—and begat sons and daughters.
content_old: 21 and Reu lived､ after he begat Serug, two hundred and seven years,—and begat sons and daughters.

content: 22 And Serug lived thirty years,—and begat Nahor;
content_old: 22 And Serug lived thirty years,—and begat Nahor;

content: 23 and Serug lived､ after he begat Nahor, two hundred years,—and begat sons and daughters.
content_old: 23 and Serug lived､ after he begat Nahor, two hundred years,—and begat sons and daughters.

content: 24 And Nahor lived twenty-nine years,—and begat Terah;
content_old: 24 And Nahor lived twenty-nine years,—and begat Terah;

content: 25 and Nahor lived､ after he begat Terah, a hundred and nineteen years,—and begat sons and daughters.
content_old: 25 and Nahor lived､ after he begat Terah, a hundred and nineteen years,—and begat sons and daughters.

content: 26 And Terah lived seventy years,—and begat Abram, Nahor､ and Haran.
content_old: 26 And Terah lived seventy years,—and begat Abram, Nahor､ and Haran.

content: 27 These then are the generations of Terah, Terah begat Abram､ Nahor､ and Haran,—and Haran begat Lot;
content_old: 27 These then are the generations of Terah, Terah begat Abram､ Nahor､ and Haran,—and Haran begat Lot;

content: 28 and Haran died, in the presence of Terah his father,—in the land of his birth､ in Ur of the Chaldees.
content_old: 28 and Haran died, in the presence of Terah his father,—in the land of his birth､ in Ur of the Chaldees.

content: 29 And Abram and Nahor took to themselves wives; the name of Abram’s wife was Sarai; and the name of Nahor’s wife､ Milcah, daughter of Haran､ father of Milcah､ and father of Iscah.
content_old: 29 And Abram and Nahor took to themselves wives; the name of Abram’s wife was Sarai; and the name of Nahor’s wife､ Milcah, daughter of Haran､ father of Milcah､ and father of Iscah.

content: 30 And Sarai remained barren,—she had no child.
content_old: 30 And Sarai remained barren,—she had no child.

content: 31 And Terah took Abram his son､ and Lot son of Haran､ his son’s son, and Sarai his daughter-in-law, wife of Abram his son,—and came forth with them out of Ur of the Chaldees､ that they might go their way towards the land of Canaan, and they came in as far as Haran､ and dwelt there.
content_old: 31 And Terah took Abram his son､ and Lot son of Haran､ his son’s son, and Sarai his daughter-in-law, wife of Abram his son,—and came forth with them out of Ur of the Chaldees､ that they might go their way towards the land of Canaan, and they came in as far as Haran､ and dwelt there.

content: 1 And Yahweh said unto Abram: Come thou on thy way, Out of thy land and out of the place of thy birth､ and out of the house of thy father,— Unto the land that I will show thee;
content_old: 1 And Yahweh said unto Abram: Come thou on thy way, Out of thy land and out of the place of thy birth､ and out of the house of thy father,— Unto the land that I will show thee;

content: 2 That I may make thee into a great nation, And bless thee､ and make great thy name, And become thou a blessing;
content_old: 2 That I may make thee into a great nation, And bless thee､ and make great thy name, And become thou a blessing;

content: 3 That I may bless them who bless thee, But him who maketh light of thee will I curse,— So shall be blessed in thee, all the families of the ground.
content_old: 3 That I may bless them who bless thee, But him who maketh light of thee will I curse,— So shall be blessed in thee, all the families of the ground.

content: 4 And Abram came on his way, according to that which Yahweh had spoken unto him, and Lot came with him,—now Abram was seventy-five years old, when he came forth out of Haran.
content_old: 4 And Abram came on his way, according to that which Yahweh had spoken unto him, and Lot came with him,—now Abram was seventy-five years old, when he came forth out of Haran.

content: 5 And Abram took Sarai his wife､ and Lot his brother’s son､ with all the goods that they had gathered and the souls that they had gained in Haran,—and they came forth to go towards the land of Canaan, and came in to the land of Canaan.
content_old: 5 And Abram took Sarai his wife､ and Lot his brother’s son､ with all the goods that they had gathered and the souls that they had gained in Haran,—and they came forth to go towards the land of Canaan, and came in to the land of Canaan.

content: 6 And Abram passed along throughout the land, as far as the place of Shechem､ as far as the Teacher’s Terebinth, the Canaanite being then in the land.
content_old: 6 And Abram passed along throughout the land, as far as the place of Shechem､ as far as the Teacher’s Terebinth, the Canaanite being then in the land.

content: 7 And Yahweh appeared unto Abram, and said: To thy seed will I give this land,—And he built there､ an altar, unto Yahweh who appeared unto him.
content_old: 7 And Yahweh appeared unto Abram, and said: To thy seed will I give this land,—And he built there､ an altar, unto Yahweh who appeared unto him.

content: 8 And he moved on from thence towards the hill country､ on the east of Bethel､ and pitched his tent,—with Bethel on the west､ and Ai on the east, and built there an altar to Yahweh, and called on the name of Yahweh.
content_old: 8 And he moved on from thence towards the hill country､ on the east of Bethel､ and pitched his tent,—with Bethel on the west､ and Ai on the east, and built there an altar to Yahweh, and called on the name of Yahweh.

content: 9 Thus Abram brake up, again and again､ towards the South.
content_old: 9 Thus Abram brake up, again and again､ towards the South.

content: 10 And it came to pass that there was a famine､ in the land,—so Abram went down towards Egypt､ to sojourn there, because grievous was the famine in the land.
content_old: 10 And it came to pass that there was a famine､ in the land,—so Abram went down towards Egypt､ to sojourn there, because grievous was the famine in the land.

content: 11 And it came to pass when he had come near to enter into Egypt that he said unto Sarai his wife: Behold! I beseech thee､ I know that a woman fair to look on thou art:
content_old: 11 And it came to pass when he had come near to enter into Egypt that he said unto Sarai his wife: Behold! I beseech thee､ I know that a woman fair to look on thou art:

content: 12 so will it come to pass when the Egyptians behold thee that they will say His wife this! and will slay me､ while thee they preserve alive.
content_old: 12 so will it come to pass when the Egyptians behold thee that they will say His wife this! and will slay me､ while thee they preserve alive.

content: 13 Say, I beseech thee､ that my sister art thou,—to the end it may be well with me for thy sake, so shall my soul be preserved alive because of thee.
content_old: 13 Say, I beseech thee､ that my sister art thou,—to the end it may be well with me for thy sake, so shall my soul be preserved alive because of thee.

content: 14 And so it was､ when Abram entered into Egypt the Egyptians beheld the woman, that fair was she､ exceedingly.
content_old: 14 And so it was､ when Abram entered into Egypt the Egyptians beheld the woman, that fair was she､ exceedingly.

content: 15 And the princes of Pharaoh beheld her, and praised her unto Pharaoh,—so the woman was taken to the house of Pharaoh;
content_old: 15 And the princes of Pharaoh beheld her, and praised her unto Pharaoh,—so the woman was taken to the house of Pharaoh;

content: 16 and with Abram dealt he well for her sake,—so that he came to have flocks and herds､ and he-asses, and men-servants､ and maid-servants, and she-asses､ and camels.
content_old: 16 and with Abram dealt he well for her sake,—so that he came to have flocks and herds､ and he-asses, and men-servants､ and maid-servants, and she-asses､ and camels.

content: 17 And Yahweh plagued Pharaoh with great plagues､ also his house,—for the matter of Sarai､ wife of Abram.
content_old: 17 And Yahweh plagued Pharaoh with great plagues､ also his house,—for the matter of Sarai､ wife of Abram.

content: 18 And Pharaoh called out to Abram, and said: What is this thou hast done to me? Wherefore didst thou not tell me, that she was thy wife?
content_old: 18 And Pharaoh called out to Abram, and said: What is this thou hast done to me? Wherefore didst thou not tell me, that she was thy wife?

content: 19 Wherefore saidst thou､ My sister she; and so I was about to take her to me､ to wife? But､ now lo! thy wife､ take her and go thy way.
content_old: 19 Wherefore saidst thou､ My sister she; and so I was about to take her to me､ to wife? But､ now lo! thy wife､ take her and go thy way.

content: 1 So Abram came up out of Egypt､ he and his wife and all that he had､ and Lot with him､ towards the South.
content_old: 1 So Abram came up out of Egypt､ he and his wife and all that he had､ and Lot with him､ towards the South.

content: 2 Now Abram was very rich,—in cattle､ in silver､ and in gold.
content_old: 2 Now Abram was very rich,—in cattle､ in silver､ and in gold.

content: 3 And he went his way､ by his removals, from the South､ even as far as to Bethel,—as far as the place where his tent was at the beginning, between Bethel and Ai:
