content_old: 3 And he went his way､ by his removals, from the South､ even as far as to Bethel,—as far as the place where his tent was at the beginning, between Bethel and Ai:

content: 4 unto the place of the altar, which he made there at first,—and Abram called､ there､ on the name of Yahweh.
content_old: 4 unto the place of the altar, which he made there at first,—and Abram called､ there､ on the name of Yahweh.

content: 5 Now Lot also, who was going with Abram had flocks and herds､ and tents.
content_old: 5 Now Lot also, who was going with Abram had flocks and herds､ and tents.

content: 6 And the land suffered them not to dwell together,—because their substance had become great, so that they could not dwell together.
content_old: 6 And the land suffered them not to dwell together,—because their substance had become great, so that they could not dwell together.

content: 7 And there arose a strife betwixt the herdmen of Abram, and the herdmen of Lot. Now the Canaanite and the Perizzite were then dwelling in the land.
content_old: 7 And there arose a strife betwixt the herdmen of Abram, and the herdmen of Lot. Now the Canaanite and the Perizzite were then dwelling in the land.

content: 8 So then Abram said unto Lot､ Pray let not cause of strife arise betwixt me and thee, or betwixt my herdmen and thy herdmen; for brethren are we.
content_old: 8 So then Abram said unto Lot､ Pray let not cause of strife arise betwixt me and thee, or betwixt my herdmen and thy herdmen; for brethren are we.

content: 9 Is not all the land before thee? I pray thee､ separate thyself from me,—if to the left hand then I will go to the right, if to the right hand then I will go to the left.
content_old: 9 Is not all the land before thee? I pray thee､ separate thyself from me,—if to the left hand then I will go to the right, if to the right hand then I will go to the left.

content: 10 So Lot lifted up his eyes､ and beheld all the circuit of the Jordan, that the whole of it was well-watered,—before Yahweh destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, like the Garden of Yahweh､ like the land of Egypt, as thou enterest into Zoar.
content_old: 10 So Lot lifted up his eyes､ and beheld all the circuit of the Jordan, that the whole of it was well-watered,—before Yahweh destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, like the Garden of Yahweh､ like the land of Egypt, as thou enterest into Zoar.

content: 11 And Lot chose for himself all the circuit of the Jordan, so Lot brake up eastwards,—and they separated themselves, each man from his brother:
content_old: 11 And Lot chose for himself all the circuit of the Jordan, so Lot brake up eastwards,—and they separated themselves, each man from his brother:

content: 12 Abram fixed his dwelling in the land of Canaan,—but Lot fixed his dwelling among the cities of the circuit, and moved his tent as far as Sodom.
content_old: 12 Abram fixed his dwelling in the land of Canaan,—but Lot fixed his dwelling among the cities of the circuit, and moved his tent as far as Sodom.

content: 13 Now the men of Sodom were base and sinful,—against Yahweh､ exceedingly.
content_old: 13 Now the men of Sodom were base and sinful,—against Yahweh､ exceedingly.

content: 14 And Yahweh said unto Abram､ after that Lot had separated himself from him, Lift up､ I pray thee､ thine eyes､ and look, from the place where thou art,—northward and southward､ and eastward and westward;
content_old: 14 And Yahweh said unto Abram､ after that Lot had separated himself from him, Lift up､ I pray thee､ thine eyes､ and look, from the place where thou art,—northward and southward､ and eastward and westward;

content: 15 for all the land which thou art beholding—to thee will I give it, and to thy seed､ unto times age-abiding;
content_old: 15 for all the land which thou art beholding—to thee will I give it, and to thy seed､ unto times age-abiding;

content: 16 and I will make thy seed､ as the dust of the earth,—so that if a man can number the dust of the earth thy seed also may be numbered.
content_old: 16 and I will make thy seed､ as the dust of the earth,—so that if a man can number the dust of the earth thy seed also may be numbered.

content: 17 Rise! go up and down in the land, to the length thereof､ and to the breadth thereof, for to thee will I give it.
content_old: 17 Rise! go up and down in the land, to the length thereof､ and to the breadth thereof, for to thee will I give it.

content: 1 And it came to pass､ in the days of Amraphel､ king of Shinar, Arioch､ king of Ellasar,—Chedorlaomer､ king of Elam, and Tidal､ king of Goïm
content_old: 1 And it came to pass､ in the days of Amraphel､ king of Shinar, Arioch､ king of Ellasar,—Chedorlaomer､ king of Elam, and Tidal､ king of Goïm

content: 2 that they made war with Bera､ king of Sodom, and with Birsha､ king of Gomorrah,—Shinab､ king of Admah, and Shemeber､ king of Zeboïm, and the king of Bela—the same is Zoar.
content_old: 2 that they made war with Bera､ king of Sodom, and with Birsha､ king of Gomorrah,—Shinab､ king of Admah, and Shemeber､ king of Zeboïm, and the king of Bela—the same is Zoar.

content: 3 All these joined together in the valley of the open fields, the same is the Salt Sea.
content_old: 3 All these joined together in the valley of the open fields, the same is the Salt Sea.

content: 4 Twelve years had they served Chedorlaomer,—but in the thirteenth year had they rebelled;
content_old: 4 Twelve years had they served Chedorlaomer,—but in the thirteenth year had they rebelled;

content: 5 and in the fourteenth year had Chedorlaomer come in､ and the kings who were with him, so they smote the Rephaim in Ashteroth-karnaim, and the Zuzim in Ham,—and the Emim in Shaveh-kiriathaim;
content_old: 5 and in the fourteenth year had Chedorlaomer come in､ and the kings who were with him, so they smote the Rephaim in Ashteroth-karnaim, and the Zuzim in Ham,—and the Emim in Shaveh-kiriathaim;

content: 6 and the Horites in their Mount Seir,—as far as El-paran, which is by the desert.
content_old: 6 and the Horites in their Mount Seir,—as far as El-paran, which is by the desert.

content: 7 So they returned and came in unto En-mishpat､ the same is Kadish, and smote all the field of the Amalekites,—and the Amorites also､ that dwelt in Hazazon-tamar.
content_old: 7 So they returned and came in unto En-mishpat､ the same is Kadish, and smote all the field of the Amalekites,—and the Amorites also､ that dwelt in Hazazon-tamar.

content: 8 Thus then went forth the King of Sodom and the king of Gomorrah､ and the king of Admah and the king of Zeboïm, and the king of Bela､ the same is Zoar､—and set themselves in array against them for battle, in the valley of the open fields:
content_old: 8 Thus then went forth the King of Sodom and the king of Gomorrah､ and the king of Admah and the king of Zeboïm, and the king of Bela､ the same is Zoar､—and set themselves in array against them for battle, in the valley of the open fields:

content: 9 against Chedorlaomer king of Elam､ and Tidal king of Goïm, and Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar,—four kings､ against five.
content_old: 9 against Chedorlaomer king of Elam､ and Tidal king of Goïm, and Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar,—four kings､ against five.

content: 10 Now the valley of the open fields had many pits of bitumen, so the king of Sodom and Gomorrah fled､ and fell there,—while they who remained towards a mountain fled.
content_old: 10 Now the valley of the open fields had many pits of bitumen, so the king of Sodom and Gomorrah fled､ and fell there,—while they who remained towards a mountain fled.

content: 11 And they took all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah､ and all their food､ and went their way.
content_old: 11 And they took all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah､ and all their food､ and went their way.

content: 12 And they took Lot､ Abram’s brother’s son､ with his goods, and went their way,—he being a dweller in Sodom.
content_old: 12 And they took Lot､ Abram’s brother’s son､ with his goods, and went their way,—he being a dweller in Sodom.

content: 13 Then came in a fugitive､ and told Abram the Hebrew,—he having his dwelling among the oaks of Mamre the Amorite､ brother of Eshcol and brother of Aner, they also having a covenant with Abram.
content_old: 13 Then came in a fugitive､ and told Abram the Hebrew,—he having his dwelling among the oaks of Mamre the Amorite､ brother of Eshcol and brother of Aner, they also having a covenant with Abram.

content: 14 So Abram hearing that his brother had been taken captive drew forth his trained men､ born in his house､ three hundred and eighteen, and pursued as far as Dan.
content_old: 14 So Abram hearing that his brother had been taken captive drew forth his trained men､ born in his house､ three hundred and eighteen, and pursued as far as Dan.

content: 15 And he divided himself against them by night､ he､ and his servants､ and smote them,—and pursued them as far as Hobah, which was on the left of Damascus.
content_old: 15 And he divided himself against them by night､ he､ and his servants､ and smote them,—and pursued them as far as Hobah, which was on the left of Damascus.

content: 16 So he brought back all the goods,—yea Lot also his brother､ with his goods did he bring back, and the women also､ and the people.
content_old: 16 So he brought back all the goods,—yea Lot also his brother､ with his goods did he bring back, and the women also､ and the people.

content: 17 Then came forth the king of Sodom to meet him, after his return from the smiting of Chedorlaomer, and the kings who were with him,—into the vale of Shaveh､ the same was the vale of the king.
content_old: 17 Then came forth the king of Sodom to meet him, after his return from the smiting of Chedorlaomer, and the kings who were with him,—into the vale of Shaveh､ the same was the vale of the king.

content: 18 Now Melchizedek king of Salem had brought forth bread and wine,—he being priest of GOD Most High.
content_old: 18 Now Melchizedek king of Salem had brought forth bread and wine,—he being priest of GOD Most High.

content: 19 So he blessed him､ and said,— Blessed be Abram､ of GOD Most High, possessor of the heavens and earth;
content_old: 19 So he blessed him､ and said,— Blessed be Abram､ of GOD Most High, possessor of the heavens and earth;

content: 20 And blessed be GOD Most High, who hath delivered thine enemies into thy hand. So he gave unto him a tenth of all.
content_old: 20 And blessed be GOD Most High, who hath delivered thine enemies into thy hand. So he gave unto him a tenth of all.

content: 21 Then said the king of Sodom unto Abram,— Give unto me the persons, but the goods take thou for thyself.
content_old: 21 Then said the king of Sodom unto Abram,— Give unto me the persons, but the goods take thou for thyself.

content: 22 And Abram said unto the king of Sodom,— I have lifted up my hand unto Yahweh､ GOD Most High, possessor of the heavens and earth:
content_old: 22 And Abram said unto the king of Sodom,— I have lifted up my hand unto Yahweh､ GOD Most High, possessor of the heavens and earth:

content: 23 That not from a thread even unto a sandal-thong—will I take anything that is thine,— Lest thou shouldst say, I enriched Abram!
content_old: 23 That not from a thread even unto a sandal-thong—will I take anything that is thine,— Lest thou shouldst say, I enriched Abram!

content: 1 After these things came the word of Yahweh unto Abram, in a vision､ saying,— Do not fear､ Abram, I am a shield to thee, thine exceeding great reward.
content_old: 1 After these things came the word of Yahweh unto Abram, in a vision､ saying,— Do not fear､ Abram, I am a shield to thee, thine exceeding great reward.

content: 2 And Abram said､ My Lord Yahweh､ what canst thou give me､ when I am going on childless,—and the heir of my house is Eliezer of Damascus
content_old: 2 And Abram said､ My Lord Yahweh､ what canst thou give me､ when I am going on childless,—and the heir of my house is Eliezer of Damascus

content: 3 And Abram said— Lo, to me hast thou not given seed,— And lo! a son of my household is mine heir!
content_old: 3 And Abram said— Lo, to me hast thou not given seed,— And lo! a son of my household is mine heir!

content: 4 And lo! the word of Yahweh came unto him､ saying, This one shall not be thine heir; But one who cometh forth of thy body—he shall be thine heir.
content_old: 4 And lo! the word of Yahweh came unto him､ saying, This one shall not be thine heir; But one who cometh forth of thy body—he shall be thine heir.

content: 5 And he brought him forth abroad､ and said— Look steadfastly､ I pray thee､ towards the heavens, and number the stars, if thou be able to number them, And he said to him, Thus shall be thy seed.
content_old: 5 And he brought him forth abroad､ and said— Look steadfastly､ I pray thee､ towards the heavens, and number the stars, if thou be able to number them, And he said to him, Thus shall be thy seed.

content: 6 And he had faith in Yahweh,—so he reckoned it to him､ as righteousness.
content_old: 6 And he had faith in Yahweh,—so he reckoned it to him､ as righteousness.

content: 7 And he said unto him,— I am Yahweh､ who brought thee forth out of Ur of the Chaldees, to give thee this land､ to inherit it.
content_old: 7 And he said unto him,— I am Yahweh､ who brought thee forth out of Ur of the Chaldees, to give thee this land､ to inherit it.

content: 8 And he said: My Lord Yahweh, whereby can I know､ that I shall inherit it?
content_old: 8 And he said: My Lord Yahweh, whereby can I know､ that I shall inherit it?

content: 9 And he said unto him､ Take for me a heifer､ three years old, and a she-goat three years old､ and a ram three years old, and a turtle-dove､ and a young pigeon.
content_old: 9 And he said unto him､ Take for me a heifer､ three years old, and a she-goat three years old､ and a ram three years old, and a turtle-dove､ and a young pigeon.

content: 10 So he took for him all these､ and divided them in the midst, and placed each piece over against its fellow,—but the birds divided he not.
content_old: 10 So he took for him all these､ and divided them in the midst, and placed each piece over against its fellow,—but the birds divided he not.

content: 11 Then came down the birds of prey upon the carcases,—and Abram drove them away.
content_old: 11 Then came down the birds of prey upon the carcases,—and Abram drove them away.

content: 12 And it came to pass when the sun was about to go in､ and a deep sleep had fallen upon Abram lo! a terror—a great darkness was falling upon him.
content_old: 12 And it came to pass when the sun was about to go in､ and a deep sleep had fallen upon Abram lo! a terror—a great darkness was falling upon him.

content: 13 And he said to Abram— Thou must surely know that sojourners will thy seed become in a land not theirs, and shall serve them､ and they will humble them,—four hundred years;
content_old: 13 And he said to Abram— Thou must surely know that sojourners will thy seed become in a land not theirs, and shall serve them､ and they will humble them,—four hundred years;

content: 14 moreover also, the nation whom they will serve I am going to judge, and after that shall they come forth with great substance.
content_old: 14 moreover also, the nation whom they will serve I am going to judge, and after that shall they come forth with great substance.

content: 15 But thou shalt go in unto thy fathers､ in peace,—thou shalt be buried in a good old age.
content_old: 15 But thou shalt go in unto thy fathers､ in peace,—thou shalt be buried in a good old age.

content: 16 And in the fourth generation shall they return hither,—for not complete is the iniquity of the Amorites as yet.
content_old: 16 And in the fourth generation shall they return hither,—for not complete is the iniquity of the Amorites as yet.

content: 17 So it came to pass when the sun had gone in, and a thick darkness had come on that lo! there was a smoking hearth and torch of fire, which passed through between these pieces.
content_old: 17 So it came to pass when the sun had gone in, and a thick darkness had come on that lo! there was a smoking hearth and torch of fire, which passed through between these pieces.

content: 18 In that day did Yahweh solemnise with Abram a covenant､ saying,— To thy seed have I given this land, from the river of Egypt､ as far as the great river—the river Euphrates:
content_old: 18 In that day did Yahweh solemnise with Abram a covenant､ saying,— To thy seed have I given this land, from the river of Egypt､ as far as the great river—the river Euphrates:

content: 19 the Kenite､ and the Kenizzite, and the Kadmonite;
content_old: 19 the Kenite､ and the Kenizzite, and the Kadmonite;

content: 20 and the Hittite and the Perizzite､ and the Rephaim;
content_old: 20 and the Hittite and the Perizzite､ and the Rephaim;

content: 1 But Sarai､ Abram’s wife had borne him no children,—she had､ however､ an Egyptian handmaid､ whose name was Hagar.
content_old: 1 But Sarai､ Abram’s wife had borne him no children,—she had､ however､ an Egyptian handmaid､ whose name was Hagar.

content: 2 So then Sarai said unto Abram､ Behold､ I pray thee､ Yahweh hath restrained me from bearing, go in､ I pray thee､ unto my handmaid, peradventure I may be built up from her,— And Abram hearkened to the voice of Sarai.
content_old: 2 So then Sarai said unto Abram､ Behold､ I pray thee､ Yahweh hath restrained me from bearing, go in､ I pray thee､ unto my handmaid, peradventure I may be built up from her,— And Abram hearkened to the voice of Sarai.

content: 3 So Sarai､ Abram’s wife､ took Hagar the Egyptian､ her handmaid, at the end of ten years of Abram’s dwelling in the land of Canaan､ and gave her to Abram her husband､ to be to him as a wife.
content_old: 3 So Sarai､ Abram’s wife､ took Hagar the Egyptian､ her handmaid, at the end of ten years of Abram’s dwelling in the land of Canaan､ and gave her to Abram her husband､ to be to him as a wife.

content: 4 And he went in unto Hagar､ and she conceived,—and when she saw that she had conceived lightly esteemed was her lady､ in her eyes.
content_old: 4 And he went in unto Hagar､ and she conceived,—and when she saw that she had conceived lightly esteemed was her lady､ in her eyes.

content: 5 Then said Sarai unto Abram: My wrong is on thee! I gave my handmaid into thy bosom, and when she seeth that she hath conceived then am I lightly esteemed in her eyes! Yahweh judge betwixt me and her.
content_old: 5 Then said Sarai unto Abram: My wrong is on thee! I gave my handmaid into thy bosom, and when she seeth that she hath conceived then am I lightly esteemed in her eyes! Yahweh judge betwixt me and her.

content: 6 And Abram said unto Sarai�� Lo! thy handmaid is in thy hand, do to her､ what is good in thine eyes. So Sarai humbled her, and she fled from her face.
content_old: 6 And Abram said unto Sarai�� Lo! thy handmaid is in thy hand, do to her､ what is good in thine eyes. So Sarai humbled her, and she fled from her face.

content: 7 And the messenger of Yahweh found her､ by the fountain of water､ in the desert,—by the fountain in the way to Shur.
content_old: 7 And the messenger of Yahweh found her､ by the fountain of water､ in the desert,—by the fountain in the way to Shur.

content: 8 So he said— Hagar! handmaid of Sarai! Whence hast thou come､ and whither wouldst thou go? And she said: From the face of Sarai, my lady am I fleeing.
content_old: 8 So he said— Hagar! handmaid of Sarai! Whence hast thou come､ and whither wouldst thou go? And she said: From the face of Sarai, my lady am I fleeing.

content: 9 And the messenger of Yahweh said to her, Return unto thy lady,—and humble thyself under her hands.
content_old: 9 And the messenger of Yahweh said to her, Return unto thy lady,—and humble thyself under her hands.

content: 10 And the messenger of Yahweh said to her, I will greatly multiply thy seed—so that it shall not be numbered for multitude.
content_old: 10 And the messenger of Yahweh said to her, I will greatly multiply thy seed—so that it shall not be numbered for multitude.

content: 11 And the messenger of Yahweh said to her, Behold thee! with child､ and about bearing a son—and thou shalt call his name Ishmael , for Yahweh hath hearkened unto thy humiliation.
content_old: 11 And the messenger of Yahweh said to her, Behold thee! with child､ and about bearing a son—and thou shalt call his name Ishmael , for Yahweh hath hearkened unto thy humiliation.

content: 12 But he will be a wild ass of a man, his hand against every one, and every one’s hand against him—yet in presence of all his brethren shall he have his habitation.
content_old: 12 But he will be a wild ass of a man, his hand against every one, and every one’s hand against him—yet in presence of all his brethren shall he have his habitation.

content: 13 And she called the name of Yahweh､ who had spoken unto her, Thou GOD of vision! For she said､ Do I even here retain my vision after a vision?
content_old: 13 And she called the name of Yahweh､ who had spoken unto her, Thou GOD of vision! For she said､ Do I even here retain my vision after a vision?

content: 14 On this account is the well called､ The well of the life of vision,—lo! it is between Kadesh and Bered.
content_old: 14 On this account is the well called､ The well of the life of vision,—lo! it is between Kadesh and Bered.

content: 15 So Hagar bare to Abram a son,—and Abram called the name of his son､ whom Hagar bare､ Ishmael.
content_old: 15 So Hagar bare to Abram a son,—and Abram called the name of his son､ whom Hagar bare､ Ishmael.

content: 1 And it came to pass that when Abram was ninety and nine years old Yahweh appeared unto Abram, and said unto him､ I am GOD Almighty,— Walk thou before me､ and become thou blameless:
content_old: 1 And it came to pass that when Abram was ninety and nine years old Yahweh appeared unto Abram, and said unto him､ I am GOD Almighty,— Walk thou before me､ and become thou blameless:

content: 2 That I may set my covenant betwixt me and thee, And may multiply thee exceedingly.
content_old: 2 That I may set my covenant betwixt me and thee, And may multiply thee exceedingly.

content: 3 And Abram fell on his face,—and God spake with him､ saying:
content_old: 3 And Abram fell on his face,—and God spake with him､ saying:

content: 4 As for me lo! my covenant is with thee,— So shalt thou become—father of a multitude of nations;
content_old: 4 As for me lo! my covenant is with thee,— So shalt thou become—father of a multitude of nations;

content: 5 And thy name shall no more be called Abram,—but thy name shall become Abraham, for father of a multitude of nations have I appointed thee;
content_old: 5 And thy name shall no more be called Abram,—but thy name shall become Abraham, for father of a multitude of nations have I appointed thee;

content: 6 And I will make thee fruitful exceedingly, and grant thee to be nations,— Yea kings, out of thee shall come forth;
content_old: 6 And I will make thee fruitful exceedingly, and grant thee to be nations,— Yea kings, out of thee shall come forth;

content: 7 And I will confirm my covenant betwixt me and thee､ and thy seed after thee to their generations､ for an age-abiding covenant,—to become to thee a God, and to thy seed after thee;
content_old: 7 And I will confirm my covenant betwixt me and thee､ and thy seed after thee to their generations､ for an age-abiding covenant,—to become to thee a God, and to thy seed after thee;

content: 8 And I will give､ to thee and to thy seed after thee､ the land of thy sojournings—all the land of Canaan, for an age-abiding possession,— And I will be to them､ a God.
content_old: 8 And I will give､ to thee and to thy seed after thee､ the land of thy sojournings—all the land of Canaan, for an age-abiding possession,— And I will be to them､ a God.

content: 9 And God said unto Abraham, But as for thee my covenant must thou keep, thou and thy seed after thee､ to their generations:—
content_old: 9 And God said unto Abraham, But as for thee my covenant must thou keep, thou and thy seed after thee､ to their generations:—

content: 10 This is my covenant､ which ye shall keep､ betwixt me and you, and thy seed after thee,— To circumcise to you､ every male:
content_old: 10 This is my covenant､ which ye shall keep､ betwixt me and you, and thy seed after thee,— To circumcise to you､ every male:

content: 11 So shall ye be circumcised､ in the flesh of your foreskin,— So shall it become a sign of a covenant, betwixt me and you.
content_old: 11 So shall ye be circumcised､ in the flesh of your foreskin,— So shall it become a sign of a covenant, betwixt me and you.

content: 12 And he that is eight days old shall be circumcised to you､ every male to your generations,—he that is born of the house, and he that is bought with silver､ of any son of a stranger, who is not of thy seed
content_old: 12 And he that is eight days old shall be circumcised to you､ every male to your generations,—he that is born of the house, and he that is bought with silver､ of any son of a stranger, who is not of thy seed

content: 13 He must surely be circumcised, born of thy house､ or bought with thy silver,— So shall my covenant be in your flesh､ for an age-abiding covenant.
content_old: 13 He must surely be circumcised, born of thy house､ or bought with thy silver,— So shall my covenant be in your flesh､ for an age-abiding covenant.

content: 14 But as for the uncircumcised male who shall not be circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin—that person shall be cut off from among his people,— my covenant hath he made void.
content_old: 14 But as for the uncircumcised male who shall not be circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin—that person shall be cut off from among his people,— my covenant hath he made void.

content: 15 And God said unto Abraham, As for Sarai thy wife thou shalt not call her name､ Sarai,—but Sarah is her name;
content_old: 15 And God said unto Abraham, As for Sarai thy wife thou shalt not call her name､ Sarai,—but Sarah is her name;

content: 16 And I will bless her, yea moreover will give—from her—to thee､ a son,— And I will bless her､ and she shall become nations. Kings of peoples from her shall arise.
content_old: 16 And I will bless her, yea moreover will give—from her—to thee､ a son,— And I will bless her､ and she shall become nations. Kings of peoples from her shall arise.

content: 17 And Abraham fell on his face､ and laughed,—and said in his heart､ To one a hundred years old shall a child be born? And shall even Sarah, who is ninety years old､ give birth?
content_old: 17 And Abraham fell on his face､ and laughed,—and said in his heart､ To one a hundred years old shall a child be born? And shall even Sarah, who is ninety years old､ give birth?

content: 18 And Abraham said unto God,— Oh that Ishmael might live before thee!
content_old: 18 And Abraham said unto God,— Oh that Ishmael might live before thee!

content: 19 And God said— Truly Sarah thy wife is about to bear thee a son, and thou shalt call his name､ Isaac,—and I will establish my covenant with him､ as an age-abiding covenant､ to his seed after him.
content_old: 19 And God said— Truly Sarah thy wife is about to bear thee a son, and thou shalt call his name､ Isaac,—and I will establish my covenant with him､ as an age-abiding covenant､ to his seed after him.

content: 20 Yet as for Ishmael I have heard thee; lo! I have blessed him､ and will make him fruitful､ and multiply him exceedingly,—twelve princes shall he beget, and I will grant him to be a great nation;
content_old: 20 Yet as for Ishmael I have heard thee; lo! I have blessed him､ and will make him fruitful､ and multiply him exceedingly,—twelve princes shall he beget, and I will grant him to be a great nation;

content: 21 But my covenant will I establish with Isaac,—whom Sarah shall bear､ to thee､ by this set time, in the next year.
content_old: 21 But my covenant will I establish with Isaac,—whom Sarah shall bear､ to thee､ by this set time, in the next year.

content: 22 And he left off speaking with him,—and God went up from Abraham.
content_old: 22 And he left off speaking with him,—and God went up from Abraham.

content: 23 So Abraham took Ishmael his son､ and all born of his house､ and all bought with his silver—every male among the men of the house of Abraham,—and circumcised the flesh of their foreskin､ on this selfsame day, according to that which God had spoken with him.
content_old: 23 So Abraham took Ishmael his son､ and all born of his house､ and all bought with his silver—every male among the men of the house of Abraham,—and circumcised the flesh of their foreskin､ on this selfsame day, according to that which God had spoken with him.

content: 24 Now Abraham was ninety-nine years old,—when he was circumcised､ in the flesh of his foreskin.
content_old: 24 Now Abraham was ninety-nine years old,—when he was circumcised､ in the flesh of his foreskin.

content: 25 And Ishmael his son was thirteen years old, when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.
content_old: 25 And Ishmael his son was thirteen years old, when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.

content: 26 On this selfsame day was Abraham circumcised,—and Ishmael his son;
content_old: 26 On this selfsame day was Abraham circumcised,—and Ishmael his son;

content: 1 And Yahweh appeared unto him､ among the oaks of Mamre,—as he was sitting at the opening of the tent､ in the heat of the day.
content_old: 1 And Yahweh appeared unto him､ among the oaks of Mamre,—as he was sitting at the opening of the tent､ in the heat of the day.

content: 2 And he lifted up his eyes､ and looked, and lo! three men standing over against him,—so he looked､ and ran to meet them from the opening of the tent, and bowed himself to the earth;
content_old: 2 And he lifted up his eyes､ and looked, and lo! three men standing over against him,—so he looked､ and ran to meet them from the opening of the tent, and bowed himself to the earth;

content: 3 and said,— O My Lord! if､ I pray thee､ I have found favour in thine eyes do not､ I pray thee､ pass on from thy servant.
content_old: 3 and said,— O My Lord! if､ I pray thee､ I have found favour in thine eyes do not､ I pray thee､ pass on from thy servant.

content: 4 Let there be fetched､ I pray thee､ a little water, and bathe ye your feet,—and rest yourselves under the tree.
content_old: 4 Let there be fetched､ I pray thee､ a little water, and bathe ye your feet,—and rest yourselves under the tree.

content: 5 And let me fetch a morsel of bread､ and stay ye your heart､ Afterwards ye may pass on, For on this account have ye passed by､ over against your servant. And they said, Thus shalt thou do､ as thou hast spoken.
content_old: 5 And let me fetch a morsel of bread､ and stay ye your heart､ Afterwards ye may pass on, For on this account have ye passed by､ over against your servant. And they said, Thus shalt thou do､ as thou hast spoken.

content: 6 So Abraham hastened towards the tent､ unto Sarah,—and said､ Hasten thou three measures of fine meal, knead it､ and make hearth-cakes.
content_old: 6 So Abraham hastened towards the tent､ unto Sarah,—and said､ Hasten thou three measures of fine meal, knead it､ and make hearth-cakes.

content: 7 And unto the herd ran Abraham,—and took a calf､ tender and good､ and gave unto the young man, and he hastened to make it ready.
content_old: 7 And unto the herd ran Abraham,—and took a calf､ tender and good､ and gave unto the young man, and he hastened to make it ready.

content: 8 And he took butter､ and milk､ and the calf that he had made ready, and set before them,—while he was standing near them under the tree､ they did eat.
content_old: 8 And he took butter､ and milk､ and the calf that he had made ready, and set before them,—while he was standing near them under the tree､ they did eat.

content: 9 And they said unto him, As to Sarah thy wife.… And he said､ Lo! she is in the tent.
content_old: 9 And they said unto him, As to Sarah thy wife.… And he said､ Lo! she is in the tent.

content: 10 And he said､ I will surely return unto thee､ at the quickening season,—and lo! a son for Sarah thy wife. Now Sarah was hearkening at the opening of the tent､ it being behind him.
content_old: 10 And he said､ I will surely return unto thee､ at the quickening season,—and lo! a son for Sarah thy wife. Now Sarah was hearkening at the opening of the tent､ it being behind him.

content: 11 But Abraham and Sarah were old, far gone in days,—it had ceased to be with Sarah after the manner of women.
content_old: 11 But Abraham and Sarah were old, far gone in days,—it had ceased to be with Sarah after the manner of women.

content: 12 So then Sarah laughed within herself､ saying: After I am past age hath there come to me pleasure, my lord also being old?
content_old: 12 So then Sarah laughed within herself､ saying: After I am past age hath there come to me pleasure, my lord also being old?

content: 13 And Yahweh said unto Abraham,— Wherefore､ now､ did Sarah laugh saying､ Can it really and truly be that I should bear, seeing that I have become old?
content_old: 13 And Yahweh said unto Abraham,— Wherefore､ now､ did Sarah laugh saying､ Can it really and truly be that I should bear, seeing that I have become old?

content: 14 Is anything too wonderful for Yahweh? At the appointed time I will return unto thee､ at the quickening season､ and Sarah shall have a son.
content_old: 14 Is anything too wonderful for Yahweh? At the appointed time I will return unto thee､ at the quickening season､ and Sarah shall have a son.

content: 15 And Sarah denied､ saying､ I laughed not､ For she was afraid. And he said— Nay! but thou didst laugh!
content_old: 15 And Sarah denied､ saying､ I laughed not､ For she was afraid. And he said— Nay! but thou didst laugh!

content: 16 And the men rose up from thence, and looked out over the face of Sodom,—Abraham also going with them､ to set them on their way.
content_old: 16 And the men rose up from thence, and looked out over the face of Sodom,—Abraham also going with them､ to set them on their way.

content: 17 Now Yahweh had said,— Am I going to hide from Abraham what I do,
content_old: 17 Now Yahweh had said,— Am I going to hide from Abraham what I do,

content: 18 when Abraham shall surely become a great and mighty nation,—and all the nations of the earth shall be blessed in him ?
content_old: 18 when Abraham shall surely become a great and mighty nation,—and all the nations of the earth shall be blessed in him ?

content: 19 For I have become his intimate friend､ To the end that he may command his sons and his house after him, so shall they keep the way of Yahweh, by doing righteousness and justice,— To the end that Yahweh may bring in for Abraham, what he hath spoken concerning him.
content_old: 19 For I have become his intimate friend､ To the end that he may command his sons and his house after him, so shall they keep the way of Yahweh, by doing righteousness and justice,— To the end that Yahweh may bring in for Abraham, what he hath spoken concerning him.

content: 20 So Yahweh said, The outcry of Sodom and Gomorrah､ because it hath become great,— And their sin, because it hath become exceeding grievous
content_old: 20 So Yahweh said, The outcry of Sodom and Gomorrah､ because it hath become great,— And their sin, because it hath become exceeding grievous

content: 21 Let me go down､ pray､ and let me behold, whether according to their outcry which hath come in unto me they have done altogether, And if not､ I must know!
content_old: 21 Let me go down､ pray､ and let me behold, whether according to their outcry which hath come in unto me they have done altogether, And if not､ I must know!

content: 22 And the men turned from thence, and went their way､ towards Sodom,—but Yahweh was yet standing before Abraham.
content_old: 22 And the men turned from thence, and went their way､ towards Sodom,—but Yahweh was yet standing before Abraham.

content: 23 So then Abraham drew near､ and said,— Wilt thou really sweep away, the righteous､ with the lawless?
content_old: 23 So then Abraham drew near､ and said,— Wilt thou really sweep away, the righteous､ with the lawless?

content: 24 Peradventure there are fifty righteous､ in the midst of the city Wilt thou really sweep away､ and not spare the place, for the sake of the fifty righteous､ which are therein?
content_old: 24 Peradventure there are fifty righteous､ in the midst of the city Wilt thou really sweep away､ and not spare the place, for the sake of the fifty righteous､ which are therein?

content: 25 Far be it from thee! to do after this manner､ to put to death the righteous with the lawless! then should righteous and lawless be alike,— Far be it from thee! Shall the Judge of all the earth not do justice?
content_old: 25 Far be it from thee! to do after this manner､ to put to death the righteous with the lawless! then should righteous and lawless be alike,— Far be it from thee! Shall the Judge of all the earth not do justice?

content: 26 And Yahweh said, If I find in Sodom､ fifty righteous､ in the midst of the city､ then will I spare all the place for their sake.
content_old: 26 And Yahweh said, If I find in Sodom､ fifty righteous､ in the midst of the city､ then will I spare all the place for their sake.

content: 27 And Abraham responded､ and said,— Behold､ I pray thee､ I have ventured to speak unto My Lord, though I am dust and ashes:
content_old: 27 And Abraham responded､ and said,— Behold､ I pray thee､ I have ventured to speak unto My Lord, though I am dust and ashes:

content: 28 Peradventure there may lack､ of the fifty righteous､ five, Wilt thou destroy for five all the city? And he said— I will not destroy, if I find there､ forty and five.
content_old: 28 Peradventure there may lack､ of the fifty righteous､ five, Wilt thou destroy for five all the city? And he said— I will not destroy, if I find there､ forty and five.

content: 29 And he added yet once more to speak unto him､ and said, Peradventure there may be found there—forty. And he said— I will not do it, for the sake of the forty.
content_old: 29 And he added yet once more to speak unto him､ and said, Peradventure there may be found there—forty. And he said— I will not do it, for the sake of the forty.

content: 30 And he said Let it not､ I pray thee､ be vexing to My Lord, but let me speak, Peradventure there may be found there—thirty And he said､ I will not do it, if I find there—thirty.
content_old: 30 And he said Let it not､ I pray thee､ be vexing to My Lord, but let me speak, Peradventure there may be found there—thirty And he said､ I will not do it, if I find there—thirty.

content: 31 And he said､ Behold､ I pray thee､ I have ventured to speak unto My Lord, Peradventure there may be found there—twenty. And he said､ I will not destroy it, for the sake of the twenty.
content_old: 31 And he said､ Behold､ I pray thee､ I have ventured to speak unto My Lord, Peradventure there may be found there—twenty. And he said､ I will not destroy it, for the sake of the twenty.

content: 32 And he said､ Let it not､ I pray thee､ be vexing to My Lord､ but let me speak only this once, Peradventure there may be found there—ten. And he said､ I will not destroy it, for the sake of the ten!
content_old: 32 And he said､ Let it not､ I pray thee､ be vexing to My Lord､ but let me speak only this once, Peradventure there may be found there—ten. And he said､ I will not destroy it, for the sake of the ten!

content: 1 So the two messengers went in towards Sodom､ at eventide, Lot being seated in the gate of Sodom,—so Lot beheld､ and rose up to meet them, and bowed himself with his face to the earth.
content_old: 1 So the two messengers went in towards Sodom､ at eventide, Lot being seated in the gate of Sodom,—so Lot beheld､ and rose up to meet them, and bowed himself with his face to the earth.

content: 2 And he said､ Behold､ I pray you､ my lords､ turn aside､ I pray you､ into the house of your servant,—and tarry the night､ and bathe your feet, so shall ye rise early､ and go on your way. And they said､ Nay, but in the broadway will we tarry the night.
content_old: 2 And he said､ Behold､ I pray you､ my lords､ turn aside､ I pray you､ into the house of your servant,—and tarry the night､ and bathe your feet, so shall ye rise early､ and go on your way. And they said､ Nay, but in the broadway will we tarry the night.

content: 3 But he became exceeding urgent with them, so they turned aside unto him､ and entered into his house,—and he made for them a banquet, unleavened cakes also did he bake､ and they did eat.
content_old: 3 But he became exceeding urgent with them, so they turned aside unto him､ and entered into his house,—and he made for them a banquet, unleavened cakes also did he bake､ and they did eat.

content: 4 Ere yet they lay down the men of the city—the men of Sodom had come round against the house, from youth､ even unto age,—all the people from every quarter.
content_old: 4 Ere yet they lay down the men of the city—the men of Sodom had come round against the house, from youth､ even unto age,—all the people from every quarter.

content: 5 And they called unto Lot､ and said to him, Where are the men who have come in unto thee､ to-night? Bring them forth unto us, and let us know them!
content_old: 5 And they called unto Lot､ and said to him, Where are the men who have come in unto thee､ to-night? Bring them forth unto us, and let us know them!

content: 6 And Lot went forth unto them､ to the entrance; but the door closed he behind him.
content_old: 6 And Lot went forth unto them､ to the entrance; but the door closed he behind him.

content: 7 And he said,— Do not､ I pray you､ my brethren, act wickedly.
content_old: 7 And he said,— Do not､ I pray you､ my brethren, act wickedly.

content: 8 Behold､ I pray you､ I have two daughters who have not known man, I must needs､ now､ bring them forth unto you, and do ye to them as may be good in your eyes,— Only to these men ye may do nothing; for on this account have they come under the shade of my roof.
content_old: 8 Behold､ I pray you､ I have two daughters who have not known man, I must needs､ now､ bring them forth unto you, and do ye to them as may be good in your eyes,— Only to these men ye may do nothing; for on this account have they come under the shade of my roof.

content: 9 And they said､ Stand back, And they said､ This one by himself hath come in to sojourn､ and must always be acting the judge, Now will we do more wickedly to thee､ than to them. So they pressed sore upon the man—upon Lot—exceedingly､ and drew near to break open the door.
content_old: 9 And they said､ Stand back, And they said､ This one by himself hath come in to sojourn､ and must always be acting the judge, Now will we do more wickedly to thee､ than to them. So they pressed sore upon the man—upon Lot—exceedingly､ and drew near to break open the door.

content: 10 And the men thrust forth their hand, and brought Lot in unto them､ into the house—and the door they closed:
content_old: 10 And the men thrust forth their hand, and brought Lot in unto them､ into the house—and the door they closed:

content: 11 the men also who were at the entrance of the house smote they with blindness, from small even unto great, so that they wearied themselves to find the entrance.
content_old: 11 the men also who were at the entrance of the house smote they with blindness, from small even unto great, so that they wearied themselves to find the entrance.

content: 12 And the men said unto Lot, Whom besides hast thou here? Son-in-law､ and thy sons and thy daughters, and all that thou hast in the city bring thou forth out of the place;
content_old: 12 And the men said unto Lot, Whom besides hast thou here? Son-in-law､ and thy sons and thy daughters, and all that thou hast in the city bring thou forth out of the place;

content: 13 For we are about to destroy this place,—for great is the outcry of them unto the face of Yahweh, so that Yahweh hath sent us to destroy it.
content_old: 13 For we are about to destroy this place,—for great is the outcry of them unto the face of Yahweh, so that Yahweh hath sent us to destroy it.

content: 14 And Lot went forth and spake unto his sons-in-law who were about to take his two daughters､ and said､ Arise､ come forth out of this place, for Yahweh is about to destroy the city. And it came to pass､ that he was as one that laughed､ in the eyes of his sons-in-law.
content_old: 14 And Lot went forth and spake unto his sons-in-law who were about to take his two daughters､ and said､ Arise､ come forth out of this place, for Yahweh is about to destroy the city. And it came to pass､ that he was as one that laughed､ in the eyes of his sons-in-law.

content: 15 But as soon as the dawn had sprung up the messengers hastened Lot､ saying,— Arise! take thy wife､ and thy two daughters that are at hand, lest thou be swept away in the punishment of the city.
content_old: 15 But as soon as the dawn had sprung up the messengers hastened Lot､ saying,— Arise! take thy wife､ and thy two daughters that are at hand, lest thou be swept away in the punishment of the city.

content: 16 And he lingered—so the men laid hold of his hand and of the hand of his wife､ and of the hand of his two daughters, in the tenderness of Yahweh towards him,—and they brought him out､ and led him forth outside the city.
content_old: 16 And he lingered—so the men laid hold of his hand and of the hand of his wife､ and of the hand of his two daughters, in the tenderness of Yahweh towards him,—and they brought him out､ and led him forth outside the city.

content: 17 And it came to pass､ when they had brought them forth outside that they said､ Escape for thy life, Look not behind thee､ neither stand still in all the vale,— To the mountain escape thou､ lest thou be swept away.
content_old: 17 And it came to pass､ when they had brought them forth outside that they said､ Escape for thy life, Look not behind thee､ neither stand still in all the vale,— To the mountain escape thou､ lest thou be swept away.

content: 18 And Lot said unto them,— No､ I pray thee, My Lord!
content_old: 18 And Lot said unto them,— No､ I pray thee, My Lord!

content: 19 Behold､ I pray thee､ thy servant hath found favour in thine eyes, so that thou hast magnified thy lovingkindness which thou hast performed with me､ in keeping alive my soul.— But I cannot escape to the mountain, lest calamity overtake me､ so shall I die.
content_old: 19 Behold､ I pray thee､ thy servant hath found favour in thine eyes, so that thou hast magnified thy lovingkindness which thou hast performed with me､ in keeping alive my soul.— But I cannot escape to the mountain, lest calamity overtake me､ so shall I die.

content: 20 Behold､ I pray thee､ this city is near､ for fleeing thither､ And it is a little one,—let me､ I pray thee､ escape thither—is it not a little one? That my soul may live!
content_old: 20 Behold､ I pray thee､ this city is near､ for fleeing thither､ And it is a little one,—let me､ I pray thee､ escape thither—is it not a little one? That my soul may live!

content: 21 And he said unto him, Behold! I have lifted up thy countenance, even as to this thing,—so that I will not overthrow the city､ of which thou hast spoken.
content_old: 21 And he said unto him, Behold! I have lifted up thy countenance, even as to this thing,—so that I will not overthrow the city､ of which thou hast spoken.

content: 22 Haste thee､ escape thither, for I cannot do anything, until thou have come in thither. For this cause was the name of the city called Zoar.
content_old: 22 Haste thee､ escape thither, for I cannot do anything, until thou have come in thither. For this cause was the name of the city called Zoar.

content: 23 When the sun had come forth on the earth Lot had entered into Zoar.
content_old: 23 When the sun had come forth on the earth Lot had entered into Zoar.

content: 24 And Yahweh rained､ upon Sodom and upon Gomorrah､ brimstone and fire,—from Yahweh､ out of the heavens:
content_old: 24 And Yahweh rained､ upon Sodom and upon Gomorrah､ brimstone and fire,—from Yahweh､ out of the heavens:

content: 25 so he overthrew these cities, and all the circuit,—and all the inhabitants of the cities, and the produce of the ground.
content_old: 25 so he overthrew these cities, and all the circuit,—and all the inhabitants of the cities, and the produce of the ground.

content: 26 But his wife looked from behind him,—and became—a pillar of salt.
content_old: 26 But his wife looked from behind him,—and became—a pillar of salt.

content: 27 And Abraham gat up early in the morning,—unto the place､ where he had stood before Yahweh;
content_old: 27 And Abraham gat up early in the morning,—unto the place､ where he had stood before Yahweh;

content: 28 and he looked out over the face of Sodom and Gomorrah, and over all the face of the land of the circuit,—and beheld､ and lo! the smoke of the land went up, like the smoke of a furnace.
content_old: 28 and he looked out over the face of Sodom and Gomorrah, and over all the face of the land of the circuit,—and beheld､ and lo! the smoke of the land went up, like the smoke of a furnace.

content: 29 And it came to pass when God destroyed the cities of the circuit that God remembered Abraham,—and sent forth Lot out of the midst of the overthrow, when he overthrew the cities wherein Lot had dwelt.
content_old: 29 And it came to pass when God destroyed the cities of the circuit that God remembered Abraham,—and sent forth Lot out of the midst of the overthrow, when he overthrew the cities wherein Lot had dwelt.

content: 30 And Lot went up out of Zoar､ and dwelt in the mountain､ and his two daughters with him, for he feared to dwell in Zoar,—so he dwelt in a cave, he､ and his two daughters.
content_old: 30 And Lot went up out of Zoar､ and dwelt in the mountain､ and his two daughters with him, for he feared to dwell in Zoar,—so he dwelt in a cave, he､ and his two daughters.

content: 31 And the firstborn said unto the younger､ Our father is old,—and a man there is not in the earth､ to come in unto us, after the way of all the earth.
content_old: 31 And the firstborn said unto the younger､ Our father is old,—and a man there is not in the earth､ to come in unto us, after the way of all the earth.

content: 32 Come on! let us cause our father to drink wine､ and let us lie with him,—that we may keep alive from our father a seed.
content_old: 32 Come on! let us cause our father to drink wine､ and let us lie with him,—that we may keep alive from our father a seed.

content: 33 So they caused their father to drink wine､ that night,—and the firstborn went in､ and lay with her father, but he noticed not her lying down nor her rising up.
content_old: 33 So they caused their father to drink wine､ that night,—and the firstborn went in､ and lay with her father, but he noticed not her lying down nor her rising up.

content: 34 And it came to pass on the morrow, that the firstborn said unto the younger, Lo! I lay､ last night､ with my father,—let us cause him to drink wine this night also､ and go thou in—lie with him, that we may keep alive from our father a seed.
content_old: 34 And it came to pass on the morrow, that the firstborn said unto the younger, Lo! I lay､ last night､ with my father,—let us cause him to drink wine this night also､ and go thou in—lie with him, that we may keep alive from our father a seed.

content: 35 So they caused their father on that night also to drink wine,—and the younger arose､ and lay with him, but he noticed not her lying down､ nor her rising up.
content_old: 35 So they caused their father on that night also to drink wine,—and the younger arose､ and lay with him, but he noticed not her lying down､ nor her rising up.

content: 36 Thus did the two daughters of Lot conceive from their father.
content_old: 36 Thus did the two daughters of Lot conceive from their father.

content: 37 And the firstborn bare a son, and called his name Moab,—the same is the father of Moab､ unto this day.
content_old: 37 And the firstborn bare a son, and called his name Moab,—the same is the father of Moab､ unto this day.

content: 1 And Abraham brake up from thence､ towards the land of the South, and fixed his dwelling between Kadesh and Shur,—so he sojourned in Gerar.
content_old: 1 And Abraham brake up from thence､ towards the land of the South, and fixed his dwelling between Kadesh and Shur,—so he sojourned in Gerar.

content: 2 And Abraham said of Sarah his wife: My sister is she,— So Abimelech king of Gerar sent, and took Sarah.
content_old: 2 And Abraham said of Sarah his wife: My sister is she,— So Abimelech king of Gerar sent, and took Sarah.

content: 3 Then God went in unto Abimelech､ in a dream of the night,—and said to him､ Behold thee—dead! because of the woman whom thou hast taken, seeing that she is a married woman.
content_old: 3 Then God went in unto Abimelech､ in a dream of the night,—and said to him､ Behold thee—dead! because of the woman whom thou hast taken, seeing that she is a married woman.

content: 4 Now Abimelech had not come near unto her,—so he said､ O My Lord! a nation—even a righteous one wilt thou slay?
content_old: 4 Now Abimelech had not come near unto her,—so he said､ O My Lord! a nation—even a righteous one wilt thou slay?

content: 5 Had not he himself said to me､ My sister is she? and even she herself said､ My brother is he? In the integrity of my heart and in the pureness of my hand have I done this!
content_old: 5 Had not he himself said to me､ My sister is she? and even she herself said､ My brother is he? In the integrity of my heart and in the pureness of my hand have I done this!

content: 6 And God said unto him in a dream､ I also knew､ that in the integrity of thy heart thou didst this, so then even I myself withheld thee from sinning against me,—for this reason have I not suffered thee to touch her.
content_old: 6 And God said unto him in a dream､ I also knew､ that in the integrity of thy heart thou didst this, so then even I myself withheld thee from sinning against me,—for this reason have I not suffered thee to touch her.

content: 7 Now therefore､ restore the man’s wife､ for a prophet is he, that he may pray for thee､ and live thou,— But if thou art not going to restore her know､ that thou shalt die, thou—and all that are thine.
content_old: 7 Now therefore､ restore the man’s wife､ for a prophet is he, that he may pray for thee､ and live thou,— But if thou art not going to restore her know､ that thou shalt die, thou—and all that are thine.

content: 8 So Abimelech rose early in the morning､ and called all his servants, and spake all these words in their ears,—and the men feared greatly.
content_old: 8 So Abimelech rose early in the morning､ and called all his servants, and spake all these words in their ears,—and the men feared greatly.

content: 9 Then Abimelech called Abraham､ and said to him､ What hast thou done to us? and wherein had I sinned against thee, that thou shouldst have brought in over me and over my kingdom､ a sin so great? Deeds which should not be done hast thou done with me.
content_old: 9 Then Abimelech called Abraham､ and said to him､ What hast thou done to us? and wherein had I sinned against thee, that thou shouldst have brought in over me and over my kingdom､ a sin so great? Deeds which should not be done hast thou done with me.

content: 10 And Abimelech said unto Abraham,— What hadst thou seen, that thou shouldst have done this thing?
content_old: 10 And Abimelech said unto Abraham,— What hadst thou seen, that thou shouldst have done this thing?

content: 11 And Abraham said, Because I thought､ Surely there is no fear of God, in this place,—therefore will they slay me for the sake of my wife.
content_old: 11 And Abraham said, Because I thought､ Surely there is no fear of God, in this place,—therefore will they slay me for the sake of my wife.

content: 12 Moreover also in truth my sister､ daughter of my father she is, only not daughter of my mother,—so she became my wife.
content_old: 12 Moreover also in truth my sister､ daughter of my father she is, only not daughter of my mother,—so she became my wife.

content: 13 And so it came to pass when the Gods caused me to wander from my father’s house that I said to her, This is thy lovingkindness､ wherewith thou shalt deal with me,—Into whatsoever place we enter say of me､ My brother is he.
content_old: 13 And so it came to pass when the Gods caused me to wander from my father’s house that I said to her, This is thy lovingkindness､ wherewith thou shalt deal with me,—Into whatsoever place we enter say of me､ My brother is he.

content: 14 Then took Abimelech sheep and oxen､ and men-servants and maid-servants, and gave to Abraham,—and restored to him Sarah his wife.
content_old: 14 Then took Abimelech sheep and oxen､ and men-servants and maid-servants, and gave to Abraham,—and restored to him Sarah his wife.

content: 15 And Abimelech said, Lo! my land is before thee,—wherever it may seem good in thine eyes, dwell.
content_old: 15 And Abimelech said, Lo! my land is before thee,—wherever it may seem good in thine eyes, dwell.

content: 16 And to Sarah he said､ Lo! I have given a thousand of silver unto thy brother: Lo! that is for thee､ as a covering of eyes, to all who are with thee,— And so in every way hath right been done.
content_old: 16 And to Sarah he said､ Lo! I have given a thousand of silver unto thy brother: Lo! that is for thee､ as a covering of eyes, to all who are with thee,— And so in every way hath right been done.

content: 17 And Abraham prayed unto God,—and God healed Abimelech､ and his wife､ and his maid servants, so that they bare children.
content_old: 17 And Abraham prayed unto God,—and God healed Abimelech､ and his wife､ and his maid servants, so that they bare children.

content: 1 Now Yahweh visited Sarah､ as he had said,— And Yahweh did for Sarah､ as he had spoken.
content_old: 1 Now Yahweh visited Sarah､ as he had said,— And Yahweh did for Sarah､ as he had spoken.

content: 2 So Sarah conceived and bare to Abraham a son､ for his old age,—at the set time, of which God had spoken with him.
content_old: 2 So Sarah conceived and bare to Abraham a son､ for his old age,—at the set time, of which God had spoken with him.

content: 3 And Abraham called the name of his son that was born to him, whom Sarah bare to him Isaac.
content_old: 3 And Abraham called the name of his son that was born to him, whom Sarah bare to him Isaac.

content: 4 And Abraham circumcised Isaac his son, when eight days old,—as God commanded him.
content_old: 4 And Abraham circumcised Isaac his son, when eight days old,—as God commanded him.

content: 5 Now Abraham was a hundred years old,—when Isaac his son was born to him.
content_old: 5 Now Abraham was a hundred years old,—when Isaac his son was born to him.

content: 6 And Sarah said, A laughing hath God made for me,— Everyone that heareth will laugh with me!
content_old: 6 And Sarah said, A laughing hath God made for me,— Everyone that heareth will laugh with me!

content: 7 And she said— Who would have announced to Abraham, Sarah hath suckled children? yet have I borne a son､ for his old age!
content_old: 7 And she said— Who would have announced to Abraham, Sarah hath suckled children? yet have I borne a son､ for his old age!

content: 8 And the child grew､ and was weaned,—and Abraham made a great banquet, on the day of the weaning of Isaac.
content_old: 8 And the child grew､ and was weaned,—and Abraham made a great banquet, on the day of the weaning of Isaac.

content: 9 And Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian woman､ whom she had borne to Abraham､ laughing!
content_old: 9 And Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian woman､ whom she had borne to Abraham､ laughing!

content: 10 So she said to Abraham, Cast out this bondwoman and her son,—for the son of this bondwoman must not inherit with my son with Isaac.
content_old: 10 So she said to Abraham, Cast out this bondwoman and her son,—for the son of this bondwoman must not inherit with my son with Isaac.

content: 11 And the word was very grievous in the eyes of Abraham,—on account of his son.
content_old: 11 And the word was very grievous in the eyes of Abraham,—on account of his son.

content: 12 And God said unto Abraham､ Let it not be grievous in thine eyes concerning the boy and concerning thy bondwoman, In all that Sarah may say unto thee hearken to her voice,— For in Isaac shall there be called to thee—a seed.
content_old: 12 And God said unto Abraham､ Let it not be grievous in thine eyes concerning the boy and concerning thy bondwoman, In all that Sarah may say unto thee hearken to her voice,— For in Isaac shall there be called to thee—a seed.

content: 13 Yet even the son of the bondwoman will I appoint to become a nation, because thy seed he is.
content_old: 13 Yet even the son of the bondwoman will I appoint to become a nation, because thy seed he is.

content: 14 So Abraham rose up early in the morning—and took bread and a skin of water､ and gave unto Hagar,—putting them on her shoulder､ and the child､ and sent her forth,—so she went her way and wandered, in the desert of Beer-sheba.
content_old: 14 So Abraham rose up early in the morning—and took bread and a skin of water､ and gave unto Hagar,—putting them on her shoulder､ and the child､ and sent her forth,—so she went her way and wandered, in the desert of Beer-sheba.

content: 15 And the water out of the skin was spent,—so she cast the child under one of the shrubs;
content_old: 15 And the water out of the skin was spent,—so she cast the child under one of the shrubs;

content: 16 and went and sat her down over against him､ at a distance like as of such as draw the bow, for she said､ Let me not look upon the death of the child,—So she sat down over against him, and the boy lifted up his voice､ and wept.
content_old: 16 and went and sat her down over against him､ at a distance like as of such as draw the bow, for she said､ Let me not look upon the death of the child,—So she sat down over against him, and the boy lifted up his voice､ and wept.

content: 17 And God heard the voice of the boy, and a messenger of God called unto Hagar out of the heavens, and said to her､ What aileth thee､ Hagar? Do not fear, for God hath hearkened unto the voice of the boy where he is.
content_old: 17 And God heard the voice of the boy, and a messenger of God called unto Hagar out of the heavens, and said to her､ What aileth thee､ Hagar? Do not fear, for God hath hearkened unto the voice of the boy where he is.

content: 18 Arise､ lift up the boy, and hold him up with thy hand,—for a great nation will I make him.
content_old: 18 Arise､ lift up the boy, and hold him up with thy hand,—for a great nation will I make him.

content: 19 And God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water,—and went and filled the skin with water, and gave drink unto the boy.
content_old: 19 And God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water,—and went and filled the skin with water, and gave drink unto the boy.

content: 20 And it came to pass､ that God was with the boy､ and he grew,—and dwelt in the desert, and he became､ as he grew up､ an archer.
content_old: 20 And it came to pass､ that God was with the boy､ and he grew,—and dwelt in the desert, and he became､ as he grew up､ an archer.

content: 21 And he dwelt in the desert of Paran,—and his mother took him a wife out of the land of Egypt.
content_old: 21 And he dwelt in the desert of Paran,—and his mother took him a wife out of the land of Egypt.

content: 22 And it came to pass at that time, that Abimelech､ with Phicol chieftain of his host, spake unto Abraham､ saying,— God is with thee in all that thou art doing.
content_old: 22 And it came to pass at that time, that Abimelech､ with Phicol chieftain of his host, spake unto Abraham､ saying,— God is with thee in all that thou art doing.

content: 23 Now therefore､ swear to me by God､ here, that thou wilt not deal falsely by me, nor by mine offspring､ nor by my descendants,—according to the lovingkindness where with I have dealt with thee shalt thou deal with me, and with the land wherein thou hast sojourned.
content_old: 23 Now therefore､ swear to me by God､ here, that thou wilt not deal falsely by me, nor by mine offspring､ nor by my descendants,—according to the lovingkindness where with I have dealt with thee shalt thou deal with me, and with the land wherein thou hast sojourned.

content: 24 And Abraham said, I will swear.
content_old: 24 And Abraham said, I will swear.

content: 25 But Abraham reproved Abimelech,—on account of the well of water, which the servants of Abimelech had seized.
content_old: 25 But Abraham reproved Abimelech,—on account of the well of water, which the servants of Abimelech had seized.

content: 26 And Abimelech said, I know not､ who hath done this thing,—nor hast even thou ever told me, nor have even I ever heard､ save to-day.
content_old: 26 And Abimelech said, I know not､ who hath done this thing,—nor hast even thou ever told me, nor have even I ever heard､ save to-day.

content: 27 And Abraham took sheep and oxen, and I gave to Abimelech,—and they two solemnised a covenant
content_old: 27 And Abraham took sheep and oxen, and I gave to Abimelech,—and they two solemnised a covenant

content: 28 So then Abraham set seven young sheep of the flock､ by themselves.
content_old: 28 So then Abraham set seven young sheep of the flock､ by themselves.

content: 29 And Abimelech said unto Abraham, What､ then､ mean these seven young sheep here, which thou hast set by themselves?
content_old: 29 And Abimelech said unto Abraham, What､ then､ mean these seven young sheep here, which thou hast set by themselves?

content: 30 And he said, The seven young sheep shalt thou take at my hand,—that they may serve as my witness, that I digged this well.
content_old: 30 And he said, The seven young sheep shalt thou take at my hand,—that they may serve as my witness, that I digged this well.

content: 31 On this account was the name of that place called Beer-sheba ,—because there had they two sworn.
content_old: 31 On this account was the name of that place called Beer-sheba ,—because there had they two sworn.

content: 32 And when they had solemnised a covenant in Beer-sheba,—then arose Abimelech､ with Phicol chief of his host, and returned unto the land of the Philistines.
content_old: 32 And when they had solemnised a covenant in Beer-sheba,—then arose Abimelech､ with Phicol chief of his host, and returned unto the land of the Philistines.

content: 33 Then planted he a tamarisk tree in Beer-sheba,—and called there on the name of Yahweh､ the age-abiding GOD.
content_old: 33 Then planted he a tamarisk tree in Beer-sheba,—and called there on the name of Yahweh､ the age-abiding GOD.

content: 1 And it came to pass after these things that God did prove Abraham,—and he said unto him, Abraham! And he said､ Behold me!
content_old: 1 And it came to pass after these things that God did prove Abraham,—and he said unto him, Abraham! And he said､ Behold me!

content: 2 And he said— Take､ I pray thee､ thy son､ thine only one､ whom thou lovest､ even Isaac, and get thee into the land of Moriah,—and cause him to ascend there､ as an ascending-sacrifice, on one of the mountains､ which I shall name unto thee.
content_old: 2 And he said— Take､ I pray thee､ thy son､ thine only one､ whom thou lovest､ even Isaac, and get thee into the land of Moriah,—and cause him to ascend there､ as an ascending-sacrifice, on one of the mountains､ which I shall name unto thee.

content: 3 So Abraham rose early in the morning､ and saddled his ass, and took his two young men with him, and Isaac his son,—and clave the pieces of wood for an ascending-sacrifice, and mounted and went his way unto the place which God had named to him.
content_old: 3 So Abraham rose early in the morning､ and saddled his ass, and took his two young men with him, and Isaac his son,—and clave the pieces of wood for an ascending-sacrifice, and mounted and went his way unto the place which God had named to him.

content: 4 It was on the third day that Abraham lifted up his eyes, and saw the place､ afar off.
content_old: 4 It was on the third day that Abraham lifted up his eyes, and saw the place､ afar off.

content: 5 And Abraham said unto his young men— Tarry by yourselves here､ with the ass, but I and the young man must go yonder,—that we may bow ourselves down､ and return unto you.
content_old: 5 And Abraham said unto his young men— Tarry by yourselves here､ with the ass, but I and the young man must go yonder,—that we may bow ourselves down､ and return unto you.

content: 6 So Abraham took the pieces of wood for the ascending-sacrifice､ and laid them on Isaac his son, and took in his own hand､ the fire and the knife,—and they went on their way both of them､ together.
content_old: 6 So Abraham took the pieces of wood for the ascending-sacrifice､ and laid them on Isaac his son, and took in his own hand､ the fire and the knife,—and they went on their way both of them､ together.

content: 7 Then said Isaac unto Abraham his father､ then said he: My father! And he said､ Behold me､ my son,— And he said､ Behold—the fire､ and the pieces of wood,—but where is the lamb､ for an ascending-sacrifice?
content_old: 7 Then said Isaac unto Abraham his father､ then said he: My father! And he said､ Behold me､ my son,— And he said､ Behold—the fire､ and the pieces of wood,—but where is the lamb､ for an ascending-sacrifice?

content: 8 And Abraham said､ God will provide for himself the lamb､ for an ascending-sacrifice､ my son! So they went on their way both of them､ together.
content_old: 8 And Abraham said､ God will provide for himself the lamb､ for an ascending-sacrifice､ my son! So they went on their way both of them､ together.

content: 9 Then came they into tl. place which God had named to him, and Abranam built there the altar, and laid in order the pieces of wood,—and bound Isaac his son, and laid him on the altar, above the pieces of wood.
content_old: 9 Then came they into tl. place which God had named to him, and Abranam built there the altar, and laid in order the pieces of wood,—and bound Isaac his son, and laid him on the altar, above the pieces of wood.

content: 10 And Abraham put forth his hand, and took the knife,—to slay his son.
content_old: 10 And Abraham put forth his hand, and took the knife,—to slay his son.

content: 11 Then called out unto him the messenger of Yahweh､ out of the heavens, and said､ Abraham, Abraham! And he said､ Behold me!
content_old: 11 Then called out unto him the messenger of Yahweh､ out of the heavens, and said､ Abraham, Abraham! And he said､ Behold me!

content: 12 Then he said､ Do not put forth thy hand､ unto the young man, neither do to him—anything at all,—for now know I that one who reverest God thou art, when thou hast not withheld thy son､ thine only one, from me.
content_old: 12 Then he said､ Do not put forth thy hand､ unto the young man, neither do to him—anything at all,—for now know I that one who reverest God thou art, when thou hast not withheld thy son､ thine only one, from me.

content: 13 And Abraham lifted up his eyes､ and looked, and lo! a ram､ behind, caught in a thicket by his horns,—and Abraham went､ and took the ram, and caused him to ascend as an ascending-sacrifice､ instead of his son.
content_old: 13 And Abraham lifted up his eyes､ and looked, and lo! a ram､ behind, caught in a thicket by his horns,—and Abraham went､ and took the ram, and caused him to ascend as an ascending-sacrifice､ instead of his son.

content: 14 So Abraham called the name of that place､Yahweh-yireh,—as to which it is still said to-day, In the mountain of Yahweh will provision be made.
content_old: 14 So Abraham called the name of that place､Yahweh-yireh,—as to which it is still said to-day, In the mountain of Yahweh will provision be made.

content: 15 Then called out the messenger of Yahweh､ unto Abraham,—a second time､ out of the heavens;
content_old: 15 Then called out the messenger of Yahweh､ unto Abraham,—a second time､ out of the heavens;

content: 16 and said, By myself have I sworn is the oracle of Yahweh,— Because thou hast done this thing, and hast not withheld thy son､ thine only one
content_old: 16 and said, By myself have I sworn is the oracle of Yahweh,— Because thou hast done this thing, and hast not withheld thy son､ thine only one

content: 17 That I will richly bless thee､ and abundantly multiply thy seed､ as the stars of the heavens, and as the sand which is on the lip of the sea,—that thy seed may take possession of the gate of his foes:
content_old: 17 That I will richly bless thee､ and abundantly multiply thy seed､ as the stars of the heavens, and as the sand which is on the lip of the sea,—that thy seed may take possession of the gate of his foes:

content: 18 So shall all the nations of the earth bless themselves in thy seed,— Because thou didst hearken unto my voice.
content_old: 18 So shall all the nations of the earth bless themselves in thy seed,— Because thou didst hearken unto my voice.

content: 19 So Abraham returned unto his young men, and they mounted､ and went on their way together､ unto Beer-sheba,—and Abraham dwelt in Beer-sheba.
content_old: 19 So Abraham returned unto his young men, and they mounted､ and went on their way together､ unto Beer-sheba,—and Abraham dwelt in Beer-sheba.

content: 20 And it came to pass after these things that it was told Abraham､ saying,— Behold! Milcah—she also hath borne sons､ to Nahor thy brother:
content_old: 20 And it came to pass after these things that it was told Abraham､ saying,— Behold! Milcah—she also hath borne sons､ to Nahor thy brother:

content: 21 Uz his firstborn､ and Buz his brother,—and Kemuel､ father of Aram—
content_old: 21 Uz his firstborn､ and Buz his brother,—and Kemuel､ father of Aram—

content: 22 and Chesed and Hazo, and Pildash､ and Jidlaph,—and Bethuel;
content_old: 22 and Chesed and Hazo, and Pildash､ and Jidlaph,—and Bethuel;

content: 23 And Bethuel hath begotten Rebekah,—These eight hath Milcah borne to Nahor､ brother of Abraham.
content_old: 23 And Bethuel hath begotten Rebekah,—These eight hath Milcah borne to Nahor､ brother of Abraham.

content: 1 And the life of Sarah came to be, a hundred and twenty-seven years,—the years of the life of Sarah.
content_old: 1 And the life of Sarah came to be, a hundred and twenty-seven years,—the years of the life of Sarah.

content: 2 And Sarah died in Kiriath-arba､the same is Hebron､ in the land of Canaan,—and Abraham went in to wail for Sarah､ and to weep for her.
content_old: 2 And Sarah died in Kiriath-arba､the same is Hebron､ in the land of Canaan,—and Abraham went in to wail for Sarah､ and to weep for her.

content: 3 And Abraham rose up from over the face of his dead,—and spake unto the sons of Heth, saying;
content_old: 3 And Abraham rose up from over the face of his dead,—and spake unto the sons of Heth, saying;

content: 4 A sojourner and settler am I with you,— Give me a possession of a buryingplace with you, That I may bury my dead､ from before me.
content_old: 4 A sojourner and settler am I with you,— Give me a possession of a buryingplace with you, That I may bury my dead､ from before me.

content: 5 And the sons of Heth answered Abraham､ saying to him:
content_old: 5 And the sons of Heth answered Abraham､ saying to him:

content: 6 Hear us､ my lord! A prince of God art thou in our midst, In the choice of our buryingplaces bury thy dead,— Not a man from among us his burying-place will withhold from thee, from burying thy dead.
content_old: 6 Hear us､ my lord! A prince of God art thou in our midst, In the choice of our buryingplaces bury thy dead,— Not a man from among us his burying-place will withhold from thee, from burying thy dead.

content: 7 And Abraham rose up､ and bowed himself down to the people of the land､ to the sons of Heth;
content_old: 7 And Abraham rose up､ and bowed himself down to the people of the land､ to the sons of Heth;

content: 8 and spake with them､ saying,— If it is with the consent of your minds､ that I should bury my dead from before me hear me､ and intercede for me､ with Ephron son of Zohar:
content_old: 8 and spake with them､ saying,— If it is with the consent of your minds､ that I should bury my dead from before me hear me､ and intercede for me､ with Ephron son of Zohar:

content: 9 That he would give me､ the cave of Machpelah､ which pertaineth unto him, which is within the bounds of his field,— For full silver let him give it me､ in your midst､ For a possession of a buryingplace.
content_old: 9 That he would give me､ the cave of Machpelah､ which pertaineth unto him, which is within the bounds of his field,— For full silver let him give it me､ in your midst､ For a possession of a buryingplace.

content: 10 Now Ephron was sitting in the midst of the sons of Heth,—so Ephron the Hittite responded to Abraham､ in the ears of the sons of Heth, even all that were entering the gate of his city､ saying:
content_old: 10 Now Ephron was sitting in the midst of the sons of Heth,—so Ephron the Hittite responded to Abraham､ in the ears of the sons of Heth, even all that were entering the gate of his city､ saying:

content: 11 Nay､ my lord､ hear me, The field have I given to thee､ And the cave that is therein to thee have I given it,— In the eyes of the sons of my people have I given it thee､ Bury thy dead.
content_old: 11 Nay､ my lord､ hear me, The field have I given to thee､ And the cave that is therein to thee have I given it,— In the eyes of the sons of my people have I given it thee､ Bury thy dead.

content: 12 So Abraham boweth himself down, before the people of the land:
content_old: 12 So Abraham boweth himself down, before the people of the land:

content: 13 and spake unto Ephron､ in the ears of the people of the land､ saying, Only if thou wouldst hear me,—I have given the silver of the field､ Take it of me, That I may bury my dead here.
content_old: 13 and spake unto Ephron､ in the ears of the people of the land､ saying, Only if thou wouldst hear me,—I have given the silver of the field､ Take it of me, That I may bury my dead here.

content: 14 And Ephron responded to Abraham､ saying to him,
content_old: 14 And Ephron responded to Abraham､ saying to him,

content: 15 My lord､ hear me,— Land worth four hundred shekels of silver—betwixt me and thee what is that? And thy dead､ bury thou.
content_old: 15 My lord､ hear me,— Land worth four hundred shekels of silver—betwixt me and thee what is that? And thy dead､ bury thou.

content: 16 And Abraham hearkened unto Ephron, and Abraham weighed out to Ephron the silver of which he had spoken in the ears of the sons of Heth,—four hundred shekels of silver, current with the merchant.
content_old: 16 And Abraham hearkened unto Ephron, and Abraham weighed out to Ephron the silver of which he had spoken in the ears of the sons of Heth,—four hundred shekels of silver, current with the merchant.

content: 17 So was confirmed the field of Ephron､ which is in Machpelah, which is before Mamre,—the field､ and the cave which is therein, and all the timber which was in the field—which was in all the boundary thereof round about
content_old: 17 So was confirmed the field of Ephron､ which is in Machpelah, which is before Mamre,—the field､ and the cave which is therein, and all the timber which was in the field—which was in all the boundary thereof round about

content: 18 to Abraham as a purchase､ in the eyes of the sons of Heth,—with all who were entering the gate of his city.
content_old: 18 to Abraham as a purchase､ in the eyes of the sons of Heth,—with all who were entering the gate of his city.
