content: 19 And after this did Abraham bury Sarah his wife､ within the cave of the field of Machpelah､ over against Mamre､the same is Hebron,—in the land of Canaan.
content_old: 19 And after this did Abraham bury Sarah his wife､ within the cave of the field of Machpelah､ over against Mamre､the same is Hebron,—in the land of Canaan.

content: 1 Now Abraham was old, far gone in days,—and Yahweh had blessed Abraham､ in all things.
content_old: 1 Now Abraham was old, far gone in days,—and Yahweh had blessed Abraham､ in all things.

content: 2 So Abraham said unto his servant､ elder of his house, ruler of all that he had,—
content_old: 2 So Abraham said unto his servant､ elder of his house, ruler of all that he had,—

content: 3 Place､ I pray thee､ thy hand under my thigh; that I may put thee on oath, by Yahweh God of the heavens､ and God of the earth,— That thou wilt not take a wife for my son, from among the daughters of the Canaanites､ in the midst of whom I am dwelling:
content_old: 3 Place､ I pray thee､ thy hand under my thigh; that I may put thee on oath, by Yahweh God of the heavens､ and God of the earth,— That thou wilt not take a wife for my son, from among the daughters of the Canaanites､ in the midst of whom I am dwelling:

content: 4 but unto my own land and unto my own kindred wilt go,— So shalt thou take a wife､ for my son—for Isaac.
content_old: 4 but unto my own land and unto my own kindred wilt go,— So shalt thou take a wife､ for my son—for Isaac.

content: 5 And the servant said unto him, Peradventure the woman may not be willing to follow me into this land,— May I take back thy son, into the land from whence thou camest?
content_old: 5 And the servant said unto him, Peradventure the woman may not be willing to follow me into this land,— May I take back thy son, into the land from whence thou camest?

content: 6 And Abraham said unto him,— Beware, that thou do not take back my son thither!
content_old: 6 And Abraham said unto him,— Beware, that thou do not take back my son thither!

content: 7 Yahweh､ God of the heavens､ and God of the earth, who took me out of the house of my father､ and out of the land of my kindred, and who spake to me､ and who sware to me､ saying, To thy seed will I give this land he will send his messenger､ before thee, so shalt thou take a wife for my son､ from thence.
content_old: 7 Yahweh､ God of the heavens､ and God of the earth, who took me out of the house of my father､ and out of the land of my kindred, and who spake to me､ and who sware to me､ saying, To thy seed will I give this land he will send his messenger､ before thee, so shalt thou take a wife for my son､ from thence.

content: 8 But if unwilling be the woman to follow thee then shalt thou be clear､ from this mine oath,— Only my son shalt thou not take back thither!
content_old: 8 But if unwilling be the woman to follow thee then shalt thou be clear､ from this mine oath,— Only my son shalt thou not take back thither!

content: 9 So the servant placed his hand, under the thigh of Abraham､ his lord,—and sware to him, over this thing.
content_old: 9 So the servant placed his hand, under the thigh of Abraham､ his lord,—and sware to him, over this thing.

content: 10 Then took the servant ten camels､ from among the camels of his lord, and went his way,—all the goods of his master being in his hand,—so he mounted､ and went his way unto Mesopotamia, unto the city of Nahor.
content_old: 10 Then took the servant ten camels､ from among the camels of his lord, and went his way,—all the goods of his master being in his hand,—so he mounted､ and went his way unto Mesopotamia, unto the city of Nahor.

content: 11 And he made the camels kneel down outside the city､ against the well of water,—at the time of evening, at the time of the coming forth of the women that drew water.
content_old: 11 And he made the camels kneel down outside the city､ against the well of water,—at the time of evening, at the time of the coming forth of the women that drew water.

content: 12 Then he said. O Yahweh､ God of my lord Abraham! I pray thee､ cause it to fall out before me today,—that thou deal in lovingkindness､ with my lord Abraham.
content_old: 12 Then he said. O Yahweh､ God of my lord Abraham! I pray thee､ cause it to fall out before me today,—that thou deal in lovingkindness､ with my lord Abraham.

content: 13 Here am I stationed by the fountain of water,—and the daughters of the men of the city are coming forth to draw water:
content_old: 13 Here am I stationed by the fountain of water,—and the daughters of the men of the city are coming forth to draw water:

content: 14 so it shall come to pass that the young woman unto whom I shall say､ Let down､ pray､ thy pitcher､ that I may drink, and she shall say､ Drink, and to thy camels also will I give to drink that her hast thou appointed for thy servant､ for Isaac, And hereby shall I get to know, that thou hast dealt in lovingkindness with my lord!
content_old: 14 so it shall come to pass that the young woman unto whom I shall say､ Let down､ pray､ thy pitcher､ that I may drink, and she shall say､ Drink, and to thy camels also will I give to drink that her hast thou appointed for thy servant､ for Isaac, And hereby shall I get to know, that thou hast dealt in lovingkindness with my lord!

content: 15 And it came to pass ere yet he had done speaking that lo! Rebekah was coming forth､ who had been born to Bethuel son of Milcah, wife of Nahor､ brother of Abraham,—with her pitcher upon her shoulder.
content_old: 15 And it came to pass ere yet he had done speaking that lo! Rebekah was coming forth､ who had been born to Bethuel son of Milcah, wife of Nahor､ brother of Abraham,—with her pitcher upon her shoulder.

content: 16 Now the young woman was of very pleasing appearance, a virgin whom no man had known,—and she went down unto the fountain, and filled her pitcher､ and came up.
content_old: 16 Now the young woman was of very pleasing appearance, a virgin whom no man had known,—and she went down unto the fountain, and filled her pitcher､ and came up.

content: 17 And the servant ran to meet her,—and said, I pray thee､ let me drink a little water､ out of thy pitcher,
content_old: 17 And the servant ran to meet her,—and said, I pray thee､ let me drink a little water､ out of thy pitcher,

content: 18 And she said､ Drink､ my lord,— And she hastened､ and lowered her pitcher on her hand､ and let him drink.
content_old: 18 And she said､ Drink､ my lord,— And she hastened､ and lowered her pitcher on her hand､ and let him drink.

content: 19 And when she had done giving him drink,—she said､ For thy camels also will I draw, until they have done drinking.
content_old: 19 And when she had done giving him drink,—she said､ For thy camels also will I draw, until they have done drinking.

content: 20 So she hastened､ and emptied her pitcher into the drinking-trough, and ran again unto the well､ to draw,—and she drew for all his camels.
content_old: 20 So she hastened､ and emptied her pitcher into the drinking-trough, and ran again unto the well､ to draw,—and she drew for all his camels.

content: 21 Now the man was eagerly watching her,—keeping silence､ to see—whether Yahweh had prospered his way､ or not.
content_old: 21 Now the man was eagerly watching her,—keeping silence､ to see—whether Yahweh had prospered his way､ or not.

content: 22 And it came to pass when the camels had done drinking that the man took a ring of gold, half a shekel its weight,—and two bracelets､ for her hands, ten of gold their weight;
content_old: 22 And it came to pass when the camels had done drinking that the man took a ring of gold, half a shekel its weight,—and two bracelets､ for her hands, ten of gold their weight;

content: 23 and said､ Whose daughter art thou? I pray thee､ tell me. Is there､ in the house of thy father､ a place for us to tarry the night?
content_old: 23 and said､ Whose daughter art thou? I pray thee､ tell me. Is there､ in the house of thy father､ a place for us to tarry the night?

content: 24 And she said unto him, Daughter of Bethuel am I—Bethuel son of Milcah､ whom she bare to Nahor.
content_old: 24 And she said unto him, Daughter of Bethuel am I—Bethuel son of Milcah､ whom she bare to Nahor.

content: 25 And she said unto him, Both straw and fodder in plenty have we,—also a place､ to tarry the night.
content_old: 25 And she said unto him, Both straw and fodder in plenty have we,—also a place､ to tarry the night.

content: 26 Then the man bowed his head, and bent himself down unto Yahweh;
content_old: 26 Then the man bowed his head, and bent himself down unto Yahweh;

content: 27 and said､ Blessed be Yahweh､ God of my lord Abraham, who hath not withdrawn his loving-kindness and his faithfulness､ from my lord,— I—being in the way, Yahweh led me unto the house of the brethren of my lord!
content_old: 27 and said､ Blessed be Yahweh､ God of my lord Abraham, who hath not withdrawn his loving-kindness and his faithfulness､ from my lord,— I—being in the way, Yahweh led me unto the house of the brethren of my lord!

content: 28 And the young woman ran, and told the household of her mother,—according to these words.
content_old: 28 And the young woman ran, and told the household of her mother,—according to these words.

content: 29 Now Rebekah had a brother､ whose name was Laban,—so Laban ran unto the man､ outside､ unto the fountain.
content_old: 29 Now Rebekah had a brother､ whose name was Laban,—so Laban ran unto the man､ outside､ unto the fountain.

content: 30 And it came to pass, when he saw the ring､ and the bracelets on the hands of his sister, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister saying, Thus did the man speak unto me that he came unto the man, and lo! he was standing by the camels､ near the fountain;
content_old: 30 And it came to pass, when he saw the ring､ and the bracelets on the hands of his sister, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister saying, Thus did the man speak unto me that he came unto the man, and lo! he was standing by the camels､ near the fountain;

content: 31 and he said, Come in, thou blessed of Yahweh,— Wherefore shouldst thou stand outside, when I have made ready the house､ and a place for the camels?
content_old: 31 and he said, Come in, thou blessed of Yahweh,— Wherefore shouldst thou stand outside, when I have made ready the house､ and a place for the camels?

content: 32 So the man came in towards the house, and ungirded the camels,—and there was given him straw and fodder for the camels, and water for bathing his own feet､ and the feet of the men who were with him;
content_old: 32 So the man came in towards the house, and ungirded the camels,—and there was given him straw and fodder for the camels, and water for bathing his own feet､ and the feet of the men who were with him;

content: 33 and food was set before him to eat, But he said､ I cannot eat､ until I have spoken my words. And he said— Speak!
content_old: 33 and food was set before him to eat, But he said､ I cannot eat､ until I have spoken my words. And he said— Speak!

content: 34 Then said he,— Servant of Abraham am I.
content_old: 34 Then said he,— Servant of Abraham am I.

content: 35 Now Yahweh having blessed my lord exceedingly､ and made him great,—and given him flocks and herds､ and silver and gold, and men-servants and maid-servants, and camels､ and asses
content_old: 35 Now Yahweh having blessed my lord exceedingly､ and made him great,—and given him flocks and herds､ and silver and gold, and men-servants and maid-servants, and camels､ and asses

content: 36 then did Sarah､ wife of my lord､ bear a son to my lord, after she had become old,—so he gave to him all that he had;
content_old: 36 then did Sarah､ wife of my lord､ bear a son to my lord, after she had become old,—so he gave to him all that he had;

content: 37 And my lord put me on oath､ saying,— Thou shalt not take a wife for my son, of the daughters of the Canaanites､ in whose land I am dwelling;
content_old: 37 And my lord put me on oath､ saying,— Thou shalt not take a wife for my son, of the daughters of the Canaanites､ in whose land I am dwelling;

content: 38 but unto the house of my father shalt thou go､ and unto my family,—and take a wife for my son.
content_old: 38 but unto the house of my father shalt thou go､ and unto my family,—and take a wife for my son.

content: 39 So I said unto my lord,— Peradventure the woman will not follow me.
content_old: 39 So I said unto my lord,— Peradventure the woman will not follow me.

content: 40 And he said unto me,— Yahweh､ before whom I have walked to and fro will send his messenger with thee､ so shall he prosper thy way, and thou shalt take a wife for my son out of my kindred､ and out of the house of my father.
content_old: 40 And he said unto me,— Yahweh､ before whom I have walked to and fro will send his messenger with thee､ so shall he prosper thy way, and thou shalt take a wife for my son out of my kindred､ and out of the house of my father.

content: 41 Then shalt thou clear thyself from mine oath, for thou shalt go in unto my kindred,—and if they will not grant her unto thee then shalt thou be clear from mine oath.
content_old: 41 Then shalt thou clear thyself from mine oath, for thou shalt go in unto my kindred,—and if they will not grant her unto thee then shalt thou be clear from mine oath.

content: 42 So I came in to-day､ unto the fountain,—and I said､ O Yahweh､ God of my lord Abraham! if､ I pray thee､ thou art prospering my way whereon I am going
content_old: 42 So I came in to-day､ unto the fountain,—and I said､ O Yahweh､ God of my lord Abraham! if､ I pray thee､ thou art prospering my way whereon I am going

content: 43 here am I stationed by the fountain of water,—so then it shall come to pass that the maiden that is coming forth to draw, and I shall say unto her､ Let me drink､ I pray thee､ a little water out of thy pitcher;
content_old: 43 here am I stationed by the fountain of water,—so then it shall come to pass that the maiden that is coming forth to draw, and I shall say unto her､ Let me drink､ I pray thee､ a little water out of thy pitcher;

content: 44 and she shall say unto me､ Both thou drink, and for thy camels also will I draw the same shall be the woman whom Yahweh hath appointed for the son of my lord.
content_old: 44 and she shall say unto me､ Both thou drink, and for thy camels also will I draw the same shall be the woman whom Yahweh hath appointed for the son of my lord.

content: 45 Ere yet I could make an end of speaking unto mine own heart lo! then Rebekah coming forth､ with her pitcher on her shoulder, and she went down to the fountain､ and drew—and I said unto her､ Let me drink､ I pray thee!
content_old: 45 Ere yet I could make an end of speaking unto mine own heart lo! then Rebekah coming forth､ with her pitcher on her shoulder, and she went down to the fountain､ and drew—and I said unto her､ Let me drink､ I pray thee!

content: 46 So she hastened､ and lowered her pitcher from off her, and said､ Drink! and to thy camels also will I give to drink,— So I drank and the camels also she let drink.
content_old: 46 So she hastened､ and lowered her pitcher from off her, and said､ Drink! and to thy camels also will I give to drink,— So I drank and the camels also she let drink.

content: 47 Then I asked her､ and said､ Whose daughter art thou? And she said､ Daughter of Bethuel､ son of Nahor, whom Milcah bare to him,— Then put I the ring upon her nose, and the bracelets upon her bands;
content_old: 47 Then I asked her､ and said､ Whose daughter art thou? And she said､ Daughter of Bethuel､ son of Nahor, whom Milcah bare to him,— Then put I the ring upon her nose, and the bracelets upon her bands;

content: 48 and bowed my head and bent myself down､ unto Yahweh,—and I blessed Yahweh､ God of my lord Abraham, who had led me､ in a way of faithfulness, to take the daughter of the brother of my lord､ for his son.
content_old: 48 and bowed my head and bent myself down､ unto Yahweh,—and I blessed Yahweh､ God of my lord Abraham, who had led me､ in a way of faithfulness, to take the daughter of the brother of my lord､ for his son.

content: 49 Now therefore if ye are dealing in loving-kindness and faithfulness with my lord tell me,—and if not tell me, that I may turn unto the right hand､ or unto the left.
content_old: 49 Now therefore if ye are dealing in loving-kindness and faithfulness with my lord tell me,—and if not tell me, that I may turn unto the right hand､ or unto the left.

content: 50 Then answered Laban and Bethuel､ and said, From Yahweh hath come forth the word,—we cannot speak unto thee､ ill or well.
content_old: 50 Then answered Laban and Bethuel､ and said, From Yahweh hath come forth the word,—we cannot speak unto thee､ ill or well.

content: 51 Lo! Rebekah is before thee､ Take her and go thy way,— And let her become wife unto the son of thy lord, as Yahweh hath spoken.
content_old: 51 Lo! Rebekah is before thee､ Take her and go thy way,— And let her become wife unto the son of thy lord, as Yahweh hath spoken.

content: 52 And it came to pass､when Abraham’s servant heard their words､ that he bowed himself down towards the earth unto Yahweh.
content_old: 52 And it came to pass､when Abraham’s servant heard their words､ that he bowed himself down towards the earth unto Yahweh.

content: 53 Then the servant brought forth jewels of silver and jewels of gold､ and raiment, and gave unto Rebekah,—and precious things gave he to her brother､ and to her mother.
content_old: 53 Then the servant brought forth jewels of silver and jewels of gold､ and raiment, and gave unto Rebekah,—and precious things gave he to her brother､ and to her mother.

content: 54 And they did eat and drink､he､ and the men who were with him, and they tarried the night,—and when they arose in the morning, he said､ Let me go unto my lord!
content_old: 54 And they did eat and drink､he､ and the men who were with him, and they tarried the night,—and when they arose in the morning, he said､ Let me go unto my lord!

content: 55 Then said her brother and her mother, Let the young woman remain with us some days､ or rather ten,— After that she shall go.
content_old: 55 Then said her brother and her mother, Let the young woman remain with us some days､ or rather ten,— After that she shall go.

content: 56 And he said unto them､ Do not hinder me, when Yahweh hath prospered my journey,— Let me go, that I may take my journey unto my lord!
content_old: 56 And he said unto them､ Do not hinder me, when Yahweh hath prospered my journey,— Let me go, that I may take my journey unto my lord!

content: 57 Then said they､ We must call the young woman､ and ask at her mouth.
content_old: 57 Then said they､ We must call the young woman､ and ask at her mouth.

content: 58 So they called Rebekah､ and said unto her, Wilt thou go with this man? And she said､ I will go.
content_old: 58 So they called Rebekah､ and said unto her, Wilt thou go with this man? And she said､ I will go.

content: 59 So they let go Rebekah their sister､ and her nurse, and Abraham’s servant､ and his men.
content_old: 59 So they let go Rebekah their sister､ and her nurse, and Abraham’s servant､ and his men.

content: 60 And they blessed Rebekah､ and said to her, Our sister! become thou thousands of ten thousands,— And let thy seed take possession of the gate of them that hate them!
content_old: 60 And they blessed Rebekah､ and said to her, Our sister! become thou thousands of ten thousands,— And let thy seed take possession of the gate of them that hate them!

content: 61 Then mounted Rebekah and her young woman､ and they rode upon the camels, and followed the man,—so the servant took Rebekah､ and went his way.
content_old: 61 Then mounted Rebekah and her young woman､ and they rode upon the camels, and followed the man,—so the servant took Rebekah､ and went his way.

content: 62 Now Isaac had come in at the entrance, of Beer-lahai-roi,—for he was dwelling in the land of the South:
content_old: 62 Now Isaac had come in at the entrance, of Beer-lahai-roi,—for he was dwelling in the land of the South:

content: 63 and Isaac came forth to meditate in the field､ at the approach of evening,—so he lifted up his eyes､ and looked, and lo! camels coming in.
content_old: 63 and Isaac came forth to meditate in the field､ at the approach of evening,—so he lifted up his eyes､ and looked, and lo! camels coming in.

content: 64 And Rebekah lifted up her eyes, and saw Isaac,—so she alighted with haste from off the camel;
content_old: 64 And Rebekah lifted up her eyes, and saw Isaac,—so she alighted with haste from off the camel;

content: 65 and said unto the servant､ Who is this man that is walking in the field､ to meet us? And the servant said､ That is my lord. So she took the veil､ and covered herself.
content_old: 65 and said unto the servant､ Who is this man that is walking in the field､ to meet us? And the servant said､ That is my lord. So she took the veil､ and covered herself.

content: 66 And the servant recounted to Isaac,—all the things which he had done.
content_old: 66 And the servant recounted to Isaac,—all the things which he had done.

content: 1 And Abraham took another wife､ and her name was Keturah;
content_old: 1 And Abraham took another wife､ and her name was Keturah;

content: 2 and she bare to him Zimran､ and Yokshan, and Medan､ and Midian,—and Ishbak､ and Shuah.
content_old: 2 and she bare to him Zimran､ and Yokshan, and Medan､ and Midian,—and Ishbak､ and Shuah.

content: 3 And Yokshan begat Sheba and Dedan,—and the sons of Dedan were Asshurim and Letushim､ and Leummim.
content_old: 3 And Yokshan begat Sheba and Dedan,—and the sons of Dedan were Asshurim and Letushim､ and Leummim.

content: 4 And the sons of Midian Ephah and Epher､ and Hanoch, and Abida､ and Eldaah,—all these were the sons of Keturah.
content_old: 4 And the sons of Midian Ephah and Epher､ and Hanoch, and Abida､ and Eldaah,—all these were the sons of Keturah.

content: 5 And Abraham gave all that he had to Isaac;
content_old: 5 And Abraham gave all that he had to Isaac;

content: 6 but to the sons of the concubines whom Abraham had Abraham gave gifts,—and then sent them away from Isaac his son､ while he himself yet lived, eastward､ unto the land of the east.
content_old: 6 but to the sons of the concubines whom Abraham had Abraham gave gifts,—and then sent them away from Isaac his son､ while he himself yet lived, eastward､ unto the land of the east.

content: 7 Now these are the days of the years of the life of Abraham､ which he lived,—a hundred and seventy-five years.
content_old: 7 Now these are the days of the years of the life of Abraham､ which he lived,—a hundred and seventy-five years.

content: 8 So Abraham breathed his last､ and died､ in a fine old age､ old and satisfied.— and was gathered unto his people､
content_old: 8 So Abraham breathed his last､ and died､ in a fine old age､ old and satisfied.— and was gathered unto his people､

content: 9 And Isaac and Ishmael his sons buried him, in the cave of Machpelah,—in the field of Ephron son of Zohar the Hittite, which is over against Mamre;
content_old: 9 And Isaac and Ishmael his sons buried him, in the cave of Machpelah,—in the field of Ephron son of Zohar the Hittite, which is over against Mamre;

content: 10 the field which Abraham purchased of the sons of Heth,—there was buried Abraham､ with Sarah his wife.
content_old: 10 the field which Abraham purchased of the sons of Heth,—there was buried Abraham､ with Sarah his wife.

content: 11 And it came to pass after the death of Abraham that God blessed Isaac his son,—and Isaac dwelt by Beer-lahai-roi.
content_old: 11 And it came to pass after the death of Abraham that God blessed Isaac his son,—and Isaac dwelt by Beer-lahai-roi.

content: 12 Now these are the generations of Ishmael､ son of Abraham,—whom Hagar the Egyptian woman､ the handmaid of Sarah､ bare to Abraham;
content_old: 12 Now these are the generations of Ishmael､ son of Abraham,—whom Hagar the Egyptian woman､ the handmaid of Sarah､ bare to Abraham;

content: 13 and these are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names､ after their generations,—the firstborn of Ishmael Nebaioth, and Kedar and Adbeel､ and Mibsam;
content_old: 13 and these are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names､ after their generations,—the firstborn of Ishmael Nebaioth, and Kedar and Adbeel､ and Mibsam;

content: 14 and Mishma､ and Dumah, and Massa;
content_old: 14 and Mishma､ and Dumah, and Massa;

content: 15 Hadad､ and Tema, Jetur､ Naphish, and Kedemah:
content_old: 15 Hadad､ and Tema, Jetur､ Naphish, and Kedemah:

content: 16 these same are the sons of Ishmael､ and these their names, by their villages､ and by their encampments,—twelve princes､ after their tribes.
content_old: 16 these same are the sons of Ishmael､ and these their names, by their villages､ and by their encampments,—twelve princes､ after their tribes.

content: 17 And these are the years of the life of Ishmael, a hundred and thirty-seven years,—and he breathed his last and died, and was gathered unto his people.
content_old: 17 And these are the years of the life of Ishmael, a hundred and thirty-seven years,—and he breathed his last and died, and was gathered unto his people.

content: 18 And they stretched their habitations､ from Havilah as far as to Shur､ which is over against Egypt, as thou goest in towards Assyria,—over against all his brethren he settled down.
content_old: 18 And they stretched their habitations､ from Havilah as far as to Shur､ which is over against Egypt, as thou goest in towards Assyria,—over against all his brethren he settled down.

content: 19 And these are the generations of Isaac, son of Abraham,—Abraham begat Isaac;
content_old: 19 And these are the generations of Isaac, son of Abraham,—Abraham begat Isaac;

content: 20 and it came to pass､ that Isaac was forty years old, when he took Rebekah､ daughter of Bethuel the Syrian, of the Plain of Syria,—sister of Laban the Syrian､ to himself to wife.
content_old: 20 and it came to pass､ that Isaac was forty years old, when he took Rebekah､ daughter of Bethuel the Syrian, of the Plain of Syria,—sister of Laban the Syrian､ to himself to wife.

content: 21 So then Isaac made entreaty unto Yahweh､ in behalf of his wife, for she was barren,—and Yahweh suffered himself to be entreated by him, and Rebekah his wife conceived.
content_old: 21 So then Isaac made entreaty unto Yahweh､ in behalf of his wife, for she was barren,—and Yahweh suffered himself to be entreated by him, and Rebekah his wife conceived.

content: 22 And the sons within her struggled together, so she said— If so wherefore now am I thus? And she went to seek Yahweh.
content_old: 22 And the sons within her struggled together, so she said— If so wherefore now am I thus? And she went to seek Yahweh.

content: 23 And Yahweh said to her､ Two nations are in thy womb, And two races from thy body shall be parted,— And one race shall be stronger than the other race, And the elder shall serve the younger.
content_old: 23 And Yahweh said to her､ Two nations are in thy womb, And two races from thy body shall be parted,— And one race shall be stronger than the other race, And the elder shall serve the younger.

content: 24 Then were fulfilled her days to bring forth,—and lo! twins in her womb.
content_old: 24 Then were fulfilled her days to bring forth,—and lo! twins in her womb.

content: 25 And the first came forth red, all over､ as a mantle of hair,—so they called his name､ Esau.
content_old: 25 And the first came forth red, all over､ as a mantle of hair,—so they called his name､ Esau.

content: 26 And after that came forth his brother､ with his hand fast hold of the heel of Esau, so they called his name､ Jacob,—Now Isaac was sixty years old､ when she bare them.
content_old: 26 And after that came forth his brother､ with his hand fast hold of the heel of Esau, so they called his name､ Jacob,—Now Isaac was sixty years old､ when she bare them.

content: 27 And when the youths grew up it came to pass that Esau was a man skilled in game､ a man of the field,—but Jacob was a ready man, dwelling in tents.
content_old: 27 And when the youths grew up it came to pass that Esau was a man skilled in game､ a man of the field,—but Jacob was a ready man, dwelling in tents.

content: 28 And IsaaclovedEsau､ because of the game he put in his mouth,—but Rebekah was a lover of Jacob.
content_old: 28 And IsaaclovedEsau､ because of the game he put in his mouth,—but Rebekah was a lover of Jacob.

content: 29 And Jacob had boiled pottage,—when Esau came in from the field､he being famished.
content_old: 29 And Jacob had boiled pottage,—when Esau came in from the field､he being famished.

content: 30 So Esau said unto Jacob､ Do let me devour some of the red—this red, for famished I am. For this cause was his name called Edom,
content_old: 30 So Esau said unto Jacob､ Do let me devour some of the red—this red, for famished I am. For this cause was his name called Edom,

content: 31 And Jacob said,— Come sell､ just now､ thy birthright､ unto me.
content_old: 31 And Jacob said,— Come sell､ just now､ thy birthright､ unto me.

content: 32 And Esau said, Here am I､ on the point of dying,—where-fore､ then､ should I have a birthright?
content_old: 32 And Esau said, Here am I､ on the point of dying,—where-fore､ then､ should I have a birthright?

content: 33 And Jacob said､ Come swear to me､ just now! And he sware to him,—and sold his birthright､ to Jacob.
content_old: 33 And Jacob said､ Come swear to me､ just now! And he sware to him,—and sold his birthright､ to Jacob.

content: 1 And there came to be a famine in the land, besides the first famine､ which happened in the days of Abraham,—so Isaac went his way unto Abimelech､ king of the Philistines､ towards Gerar;
content_old: 1 And there came to be a famine in the land, besides the first famine､ which happened in the days of Abraham,—so Isaac went his way unto Abimelech､ king of the Philistines､ towards Gerar;

content: 2 and Yahweh appeared unto him, and said､ Do not go down towards Egypt,— Make thy habitation in the land､ which I may name unto thee:
content_old: 2 and Yahweh appeared unto him, and said､ Do not go down towards Egypt,— Make thy habitation in the land､ which I may name unto thee:

content: 3 Sojourn in this land, that I may be with thee､ and bless thee,—for to thee､ and to thy seed will I give all these lands, So will I establish the oath which I sware to Abraham､ thy father;
content_old: 3 Sojourn in this land, that I may be with thee､ and bless thee,—for to thee､ and to thy seed will I give all these lands, So will I establish the oath which I sware to Abraham､ thy father;

content: 4 and will multiply thy seed as the stars of the heavens, and will give to thy seed, all these lands,— And all the nations of the earth shall bless themselves in thy seed:
content_old: 4 and will multiply thy seed as the stars of the heavens, and will give to thy seed, all these lands,— And all the nations of the earth shall bless themselves in thy seed:

content: 5 Because that Abraham hearkened unto my voice,—and so kept my charge, my commandments､ my statutes and my laws.
content_old: 5 Because that Abraham hearkened unto my voice,—and so kept my charge, my commandments､ my statutes and my laws.

content: 6 So Isaac dwelt in Gerar.
content_old: 6 So Isaac dwelt in Gerar.

content: 7 Then asked the men of the place､ as to his wife, and he said､ My sister is she,— For he feared to say My wife, lest said he the men of the place should slay me､ on account of Rebekah, for fair to look on she is.
content_old: 7 Then asked the men of the place､ as to his wife, and he said､ My sister is she,— For he feared to say My wife, lest said he the men of the place should slay me､ on account of Rebekah, for fair to look on she is.

content: 8 And it came to pass when the days had lengthened out to him there, that Abimelech､ king of the Philistines､ looked out through the lattice of a window,—and he beheld､ and lo! Isaac—laughing with Rebekah his wife.
content_old: 8 And it came to pass when the days had lengthened out to him there, that Abimelech､ king of the Philistines､ looked out through the lattice of a window,—and he beheld､ and lo! Isaac—laughing with Rebekah his wife.

content: 9 So Abimelech called for Isaac､ and said, But lo! she is thy wife! How､ then､ saidst thou､ She is my sister? And Isaac said unto him, Because I said､ Lest I die on her account.
content_old: 9 So Abimelech called for Isaac､ and said, But lo! she is thy wife! How､ then､ saidst thou､ She is my sister? And Isaac said unto him, Because I said､ Lest I die on her account.

content: 10 Then said Abimelech, What is this thou hast done to us? A little more and one of the people might have lien with thy wife, so shouldst thou have brought upon us guilt .
content_old: 10 Then said Abimelech, What is this thou hast done to us? A little more and one of the people might have lien with thy wife, so shouldst thou have brought upon us guilt .

content: 11 And Abimelech commanded all the people､ saying,— He that toucheth this man or his wife shall surely be put to death.
content_old: 11 And Abimelech commanded all the people､ saying,— He that toucheth this man or his wife shall surely be put to death.

content: 12 And Isaac sowed in that land, and found､ in the same year､ a hundredfold,—seeing that Yahweh had blessed him.
content_old: 12 And Isaac sowed in that land, and found､ in the same year､ a hundredfold,—seeing that Yahweh had blessed him.

content: 13 So the man waxed great,—and went on and on waxing great､ until that he had waxed exceeding great.
content_old: 13 So the man waxed great,—and went on and on waxing great､ until that he had waxed exceeding great.

content: 14 So he came to have possessions of flocks､ and possessions of herds, and a large body of servants,—and the Philistines envied him.
content_old: 14 So he came to have possessions of flocks､ and possessions of herds, and a large body of servants,—and the Philistines envied him.

content: 15 And as for all the wells､ which the servants of his father digged, in the days of Abraham his father the Philistines stopped them up, and filled them with dust.
content_old: 15 And as for all the wells､ which the servants of his father digged, in the days of Abraham his father the Philistines stopped them up, and filled them with dust.

content: 16 And Abimelech said unto Isaac,— Get thee from us, for thou hast become far mightier than we.
content_old: 16 And Abimelech said unto Isaac,— Get thee from us, for thou hast become far mightier than we.

content: 17 So Isaac went from thence,—and encamped in the valley of Gerar､ and dwelt there.
content_old: 17 So Isaac went from thence,—and encamped in the valley of Gerar､ and dwelt there.

content: 18 And Isaac again digged the wells of water which they had digged in the days of Abraham his father､ and which the Philistines stopped up after the death of Abraham,—and he called their names, after the names which his father called them.
content_old: 18 And Isaac again digged the wells of water which they had digged in the days of Abraham his father､ and which the Philistines stopped up after the death of Abraham,—and he called their names, after the names which his father called them.

content: 19 And Isaac’s servants digged in the valley,—and found､ there､ a well of living water.
content_old: 19 And Isaac’s servants digged in the valley,—and found､ there､ a well of living water.

content: 20 And the herdmen of Gerar disputed with the herdmen of Isaac､ saying, Ours is the water! So he called the name of the well､ Esek, be-because they had stirred up a quarrel with him.
content_old: 20 And the herdmen of Gerar disputed with the herdmen of Isaac､ saying, Ours is the water! So he called the name of the well､ Esek, be-because they had stirred up a quarrel with him.

content: 21 And they digged another well, and they disputed over that also,—so he called the name thereof､ Sitnah.
content_old: 21 And they digged another well, and they disputed over that also,—so he called the name thereof､ Sitnah.

content: 22 And he moved on from thence､ and digged another well, and they disputed not for it,—so he called the name thereof､ Rehoboth, and said､ For now hath Yahweh made room for us､ and we shall be fruitful in the land.
content_old: 22 And he moved on from thence､ and digged another well, and they disputed not for it,—so he called the name thereof､ Rehoboth, and said､ For now hath Yahweh made room for us､ and we shall be fruitful in the land.

content: 23 And he went up from thence､ to Beer-sheba.
content_old: 23 And he went up from thence､ to Beer-sheba.

content: 24 And Yahweh appeared unto him the same night, and said､ I am the God of Abraham thy father,—Do not fear､ for with thee am I, And I will bless thee､ and multiply thy seed, For the sake of Abraham my servant.
content_old: 24 And Yahweh appeared unto him the same night, and said､ I am the God of Abraham thy father,—Do not fear､ for with thee am I, And I will bless thee､ and multiply thy seed, For the sake of Abraham my servant.

content: 25 So he builded there an altar､ and called on the name of Yahweh, and spread out there､ his tent,—and the servants of Isaac cut out there､ a well.
content_old: 25 So he builded there an altar､ and called on the name of Yahweh, and spread out there､ his tent,—and the servants of Isaac cut out there､ a well.

content: 26 And Abimelech came unto him from Gerar,—with Ahuzzath his friend, and Phicol､ commander of his host.
content_old: 26 And Abimelech came unto him from Gerar,—with Ahuzzath his friend, and Phicol､ commander of his host.

content: 27 And Isaac said unto them, Wherefore have ye come in unto me,—seeing that ye hated me, and sent me away from you?
content_old: 27 And Isaac said unto them, Wherefore have ye come in unto me,—seeing that ye hated me, and sent me away from you?

content: 28 And they said: We saw plainly that Yahweh was with thee, so we said､ Let there be､ we pray thee､ an oath betwixt us both､ betwixt us and thee,—and let us solemnise a covenant with thee:—
content_old: 28 And they said: We saw plainly that Yahweh was with thee, so we said､ Let there be､ we pray thee､ an oath betwixt us both､ betwixt us and thee,—and let us solemnise a covenant with thee:—

content: 29 That thou wilt not do wrong by us､ according as we touched not thee, and according as we did by thee nothing but good, and then sent thee away in peace, thee who now art blessed of Yahweh!
content_old: 29 That thou wilt not do wrong by us､ according as we touched not thee, and according as we did by thee nothing but good, and then sent thee away in peace, thee who now art blessed of Yahweh!

content: 30 So he made for them a banquet, and they did eat and drink,—
content_old: 30 So he made for them a banquet, and they did eat and drink,—

content: 31 and rose up early in the morning, and took an oath､ each man to his brother,—so Isaac let them go, and they departed from him､ in peace.
content_old: 31 and rose up early in the morning, and took an oath､ each man to his brother,—so Isaac let them go, and they departed from him､ in peace.

content: 32 And it came to pass､ on the same day､ that the servants of Isaac came in, and told him concerning the well､ which they had digged,—and said to him､ We have found water!
content_old: 32 And it came to pass､ on the same day､ that the servants of Isaac came in, and told him concerning the well､ which they had digged,—and said to him､ We have found water!

content: 33 So he called it､ Shibah. For this cause hath the name of the city been Beer-sheb､ a unto this day.
content_old: 33 So he called it､ Shibah. For this cause hath the name of the city been Beer-sheb､ a unto this day.

content: 34 And when Esau was forty years old he took to wife Judith, daughter of Beeri､ the Hittite; and Basemath, daughter of Elon､ the Hittite;
content_old: 34 And when Esau was forty years old he took to wife Judith, daughter of Beeri､ the Hittite; and Basemath, daughter of Elon､ the Hittite;

content: 1 And it came to pass that Isaac was old, and his eyes became too dim to see, so he called Esau his elder son､ and said unto him— My son! And he said unto him､ Behold me!
content_old: 1 And it came to pass that Isaac was old, and his eyes became too dim to see, so he called Esau his elder son､ and said unto him— My son! And he said unto him､ Behold me!

content: 2 And he said､ Behold､ I pray thee､ I am old,—I know not the day of my death.
content_old: 2 And he said､ Behold､ I pray thee､ I am old,—I know not the day of my death.

content: 3 Now therefore､ take､ I pray thee､ thy weapons, thy quiver and thy bow, and go out to the field, and catch for me game;
content_old: 3 Now therefore､ take､ I pray thee､ thy weapons, thy quiver and thy bow, and go out to the field, and catch for me game;

content: 4 and make for me dainty meats､ such as I love､ and bring in to me､ that I may eat,— To the end my soul may bless thee､ ere yet I die!
content_old: 4 and make for me dainty meats､ such as I love､ and bring in to me､ that I may eat,— To the end my soul may bless thee､ ere yet I die!

content: 5 Now Rebekah was hearkening, when Isaac spake unto Esau his son,—and Esau went his way to the field, to catch game､ to bring in.
content_old: 5 Now Rebekah was hearkening, when Isaac spake unto Esau his son,—and Esau went his way to the field, to catch game､ to bring in.

content: 6 Rebekah therefore､ spake unto Jacob her son､ saying,— Lo! I heard thy father, speaking unto Esau thy brother､ saying:
content_old: 6 Rebekah therefore､ spake unto Jacob her son､ saying,— Lo! I heard thy father, speaking unto Esau thy brother､ saying:

content: 7 Bring in for me game､ and make for me dainty meats､ that I may eat; and let me bless thee in the presence of Yahweh､ before my death.
content_old: 7 Bring in for me game､ and make for me dainty meats､ that I may eat; and let me bless thee in the presence of Yahweh､ before my death.

content: 8 Now therefore､ my son､ hearken unto my voice,—in that which I am commanding thee:
content_old: 8 Now therefore､ my son､ hearken unto my voice,—in that which I am commanding thee:

content: 9 Go､ I pray thee､ unto the flock, and fetch me from thence､ two kids of the goats､ fine ones,—that I may make of them dainty meats for thy father､ such as he loveth;
content_old: 9 Go､ I pray thee､ unto the flock, and fetch me from thence､ two kids of the goats､ fine ones,—that I may make of them dainty meats for thy father､ such as he loveth;

content: 10 Then shalt thou take them in unto thy father､ and he shall eat,— To the end he may bless thee､ before his death.
content_old: 10 Then shalt thou take them in unto thy father､ and he shall eat,— To the end he may bless thee､ before his death.

content: 11 And Jacob said unto Rebekah his mother,— Lo! Esau my brother is a hairy man, whereas I am a smooth man:
content_old: 11 And Jacob said unto Rebekah his mother,— Lo! Esau my brother is a hairy man, whereas I am a smooth man:

content: 12 perad-venture my father might feel me, then should I be in his eyes､ as one that mocketh,—and should bring upon myself a reproach､ and not a blessing!
content_old: 12 perad-venture my father might feel me, then should I be in his eyes､ as one that mocketh,—and should bring upon myself a reproach､ and not a blessing!

content: 13 And his mother said to him, Upon me be thy reproach､ my son,—only hearken unto my voice､ and go fetch them for me.
content_old: 13 And his mother said to him, Upon me be thy reproach､ my son,—only hearken unto my voice､ and go fetch them for me.

content: 14 So he went､ and fetched them, and brought them in to his mother,—and his mother made dainty meats, such as his father loved.
content_old: 14 So he went､ and fetched them, and brought them in to his mother,—and his mother made dainty meats, such as his father loved.

content: 15 Then took Rebekah the garments of Esau her elder son､ the costly ones, which were with her､ in the house,—and put them on Jacob､ her younger son;
content_old: 15 Then took Rebekah the garments of Esau her elder son､ the costly ones, which were with her､ in the house,—and put them on Jacob､ her younger son;

content: 16 and the skins of the kids of the goats put she upon his hands,—and on the smooth part of his neck;
content_old: 16 and the skins of the kids of the goats put she upon his hands,—and on the smooth part of his neck;

content: 17 then placed she the dainty meats and the bread､ which she had made ready,—in the hand of Jacob her son.
content_old: 17 then placed she the dainty meats and the bread､ which she had made ready,—in the hand of Jacob her son.

content: 18 So he went in unto his father､ and said— My father! And he said､ Behold me! who art thou､ my son?
content_old: 18 So he went in unto his father､ and said— My father! And he said､ Behold me! who art thou､ my son?

content: 19 And Jacob said unto his father､ I am Esau thy firstborn, I have made ready､ as thou didst bid me. Rise､ I pray thee､ sit up､ and eat thou of my game, To the end thy soul may bless me.
content_old: 19 And Jacob said unto his father､ I am Esau thy firstborn, I have made ready､ as thou didst bid me. Rise､ I pray thee､ sit up､ and eat thou of my game, To the end thy soul may bless me.

content: 20 Then said Isaac unto his son, How is it thou hast been so quick in finding､ my son? And he said､ Because Yahweh thy God caused it so to fall out before me.
content_old: 20 Then said Isaac unto his son, How is it thou hast been so quick in finding､ my son? And he said､ Because Yahweh thy God caused it so to fall out before me.

content: 21 Then said Isaac unto Jacob､ Come near､ I pray thee､ that I may feel thee､ my son,—whether thou thyself art my son Esau､ or not.
content_old: 21 Then said Isaac unto Jacob､ Come near､ I pray thee､ that I may feel thee､ my son,—whether thou thyself art my son Esau､ or not.

content: 22 So Jacob came near unto Isaac his father､ and he felt him; then said he､ The voice is the voice of Jacob; But the hands are the hands of Esau.
content_old: 22 So Jacob came near unto Isaac his father､ and he felt him; then said he､ The voice is the voice of Jacob; But the hands are the hands of Esau.

content: 23 So he did not find him out, because his hands were like the hands of Esau his brother hairy,—so he blessed him.
content_old: 23 So he did not find him out, because his hands were like the hands of Esau his brother hairy,—so he blessed him.

content: 24 And he said, Thou thyself art my son Esau? And he said､ I am!
content_old: 24 And he said, Thou thyself art my son Esau? And he said､ I am!

content: 25 So he said､ Bring it near to me､ that I may eat of the game of my son, To the end my soul may bless thee. And he brought it near to him､ and he did eat, and he brought in to him wine､ and he drank.
content_old: 25 So he said､ Bring it near to me､ that I may eat of the game of my son, To the end my soul may bless thee. And he brought it near to him､ and he did eat, and he brought in to him wine､ and he drank.

content: 26 Then Isaac his father said unto him,— Come thou near､ I pray thee､ and kiss me､ my son.
content_old: 26 Then Isaac his father said unto him,— Come thou near､ I pray thee､ and kiss me､ my son.

content: 27 So he came near､ and kissed him, and he smelled the smell of his garments､ and blessed him,—and said､ See! the smell of my son, As the smell of a field, which Yahweh hath blessed;
content_old: 27 So he came near､ and kissed him, and he smelled the smell of his garments､ and blessed him,—and said､ See! the smell of my son, As the smell of a field, which Yahweh hath blessed;

content: 28 Then､ may God give thee of the dew of the heavens, And of the fatness of the earth,— And abundance of corn､ and new wine:
content_old: 28 Then､ may God give thee of the dew of the heavens, And of the fatness of the earth,— And abundance of corn､ and new wine:

content: 29 Let peoples serve thee､ And races bow down to thee, Become thou lord to thy brethren, And let the sons of thy mother bow down to thee,— He that curseth thee be accursed! And he that blesseth thee be blessed!
content_old: 29 Let peoples serve thee､ And races bow down to thee, Become thou lord to thy brethren, And let the sons of thy mother bow down to thee,— He that curseth thee be accursed! And he that blesseth thee be blessed!

content: 30 And it came to pass as soon as Isaac had made an end of blessing Jacob—yea it came to pass when Jacob had only just gone forth from the presence of Isaac his father that Esau his brothercame in from his hunting.
content_old: 30 And it came to pass as soon as Isaac had made an end of blessing Jacob—yea it came to pass when Jacob had only just gone forth from the presence of Isaac his father that Esau his brothercame in from his hunting.

content: 31 Then he too made dainty meats, and brought in to his father,—and Said to his father､ Let my father rise､ that he may eat of the game of his son, To the end thy soul may bless me!
content_old: 31 Then he too made dainty meats, and brought in to his father,—and Said to his father､ Let my father rise､ that he may eat of the game of his son, To the end thy soul may bless me!

content: 32 And Isaac his father said to him､ Who art thou? And he said, Iam thy son､ thy firstborn, Esau.
content_old: 32 And Isaac his father said to him､ Who art thou? And he said, Iam thy son､ thy firstborn, Esau.

content: 33 Then did Isaac tremble with an exceeding great trembling, and said､ Who then was it that caught game and brought in to me､ and I did eat of all ere yet thou didst come in､ and I blessed him? Yea､ blessed shall he remain!
content_old: 33 Then did Isaac tremble with an exceeding great trembling, and said､ Who then was it that caught game and brought in to me､ and I did eat of all ere yet thou didst come in､ and I blessed him? Yea､ blessed shall he remain!

content: 34 When Esau heard the words of his father then cried he out with an outcry loud and bitter､ exceedingly,—and said to his father, Bless even me also､ O my father!
content_old: 34 When Esau heard the words of his father then cried he out with an outcry loud and bitter､ exceedingly,—and said to his father, Bless even me also､ O my father!

content: 35 Then he said, Thy brother came in､ with deceit,—and took away thy blessing.
content_old: 35 Then he said, Thy brother came in､ with deceit,—and took away thy blessing.

content: 36 And he said､ Is it because his name is called Jacob that he hath tricked me､ now twice? My birthright he took away, And lo! now he hath taken away my blessing! And he said､ Hast thou not reserved､ for me､ a blessing?
content_old: 36 And he said､ Is it because his name is called Jacob that he hath tricked me､ now twice? My birthright he took away, And lo! now he hath taken away my blessing! And he said､ Hast thou not reserved､ for me､ a blessing?

content: 37 Then answered Isaac､ and said to Esau､— Lo! a lord have I appointed him unto thee, And all his brethren ḥave I given to him as servants, And with corn and new wine have I sustained him,— And for thee—now what can I do, my son?
content_old: 37 Then answered Isaac､ and said to Esau､— Lo! a lord have I appointed him unto thee, And all his brethren ḥave I given to him as servants, And with corn and new wine have I sustained him,— And for thee—now what can I do, my son?

content: 38 And Esau said unto his father､ But one blessing hast thou､ O my father? Bless me also､ O my father! And Esau lifted up his voice､ and wept.
content_old: 38 And Esau said unto his father､ But one blessing hast thou､ O my father? Bless me also､ O my father! And Esau lifted up his voice､ and wept.

content: 39 Then answered Isaac his father､ and said unto him,— Lo! of the fat parts of the earth shall be thy dwelling, And of the dew of the heavens､ above;
content_old: 39 Then answered Isaac his father､ and said unto him,— Lo! of the fat parts of the earth shall be thy dwelling, And of the dew of the heavens､ above;

content: 40 And on thy sword shalt thou live, And thy brother shalt thou serve: But it shall come to pass when thou shalt rove at large Then shalt thou break his yoke from off thy neck.
content_old: 40 And on thy sword shalt thou live, And thy brother shalt thou serve: But it shall come to pass when thou shalt rove at large Then shalt thou break his yoke from off thy neck.

content: 41 And Esau lay in wait for Jacob, on account of the blessing wherewith his father had blessed him,—and Esau said in his heart､ The days of mourning for my father draw near, when I can slay Jacob my brother.
content_old: 41 And Esau lay in wait for Jacob, on account of the blessing wherewith his father had blessed him,—and Esau said in his heart､ The days of mourning for my father draw near, when I can slay Jacob my brother.

content: 42 Then were told to Rebekah, the words of Esau､ her elder son,—so she sent and called for Jacob､ her younger son, and said unto him— Lo! Esau thy brother is consoling himself as touching thee､ to slay thee.
content_old: 42 Then were told to Rebekah, the words of Esau､ her elder son,—so she sent and called for Jacob､ her younger son, and said unto him— Lo! Esau thy brother is consoling himself as touching thee､ to slay thee.

content: 43 Now therefore､ my son､ hearken to my voice,—and rise､ flee thou to Laban my brother､ to Haran;
content_old: 43 Now therefore､ my son､ hearken to my voice,—and rise､ flee thou to Laban my brother､ to Haran;

content: 44 And thou shalt dwell with him a few days,—until that the wrath of thy brother turn away:
content_old: 44 And thou shalt dwell with him a few days,—until that the wrath of thy brother turn away:

content: 45 until the turning away of the anger of thy brother from thee､ and he forget what thou hast done to him, and I send and fetch thee from thence. Wherefore should I lose you both in one day?
content_old: 45 until the turning away of the anger of thy brother from thee､ and he forget what thou hast done to him, and I send and fetch thee from thence. Wherefore should I lose you both in one day?

content: 1 Then Isaac called Jacob､ and blessed him,—and commanded him､ and said to him, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.
content_old: 1 Then Isaac called Jacob､ and blessed him,—and commanded him､ and said to him, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.

content: 2 Rise､ go thy way to Padan-aram to the house of Bethuel､ thy mother’s father,—and take thee from thence a wife, of the daughters of Laban､ thy mother’s brother.
content_old: 2 Rise､ go thy way to Padan-aram to the house of Bethuel､ thy mother’s father,—and take thee from thence a wife, of the daughters of Laban､ thy mother’s brother.

content: 3 And GOD Almighty bless thee, and make thee fruitful､ and multiply thee,—so shalt thou become a multitude of peoples.
content_old: 3 And GOD Almighty bless thee, and make thee fruitful､ and multiply thee,—so shalt thou become a multitude of peoples.

content: 4 And may he give thee the blessing of Abraham, to thee､ and to thy seed with thee,—that thou mayest possess the land of thy sojournings, which God gave to Abraham.
content_old: 4 And may he give thee the blessing of Abraham, to thee､ and to thy seed with thee,—that thou mayest possess the land of thy sojournings, which God gave to Abraham.

content: 5 So Isaac sent away Jacob, and he took his journey to Padan-aram,—unto Laban son of Bethuel､ the Syrian, brother of Rebekah､ mother of Jacob and Esau.
content_old: 5 So Isaac sent away Jacob, and he took his journey to Padan-aram,—unto Laban son of Bethuel､ the Syrian, brother of Rebekah､ mother of Jacob and Esau.

content: 6 And Esau beheld that Isaac when he blessed Jacob, and sent him to Padan-aram､ to take to himself from thence､ a wife that in blessing him he laid command upon him､ saying. Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan;
content_old: 6 And Esau beheld that Isaac when he blessed Jacob, and sent him to Padan-aram､ to take to himself from thence､ a wife that in blessing him he laid command upon him､ saying. Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan;

content: 7 And that Jacob hearkened unto his father､ and unto his mother,—and took his journey to Padan-aram.
content_old: 7 And that Jacob hearkened unto his father､ and unto his mother,—and took his journey to Padan-aram.

content: 8 So then Esau beheld that displeasing were the daughters of Caanan,—in the eyes of Isaac his father:
content_old: 8 So then Esau beheld that displeasing were the daughters of Caanan,—in the eyes of Isaac his father:

content: 9 Esau therefore went unto Ishmael,—and took Mahalath daughter of Ishmael､ son of Abraham､ sister of Nebaioth､ to himself to wife, in addition to the wives that he had.
content_old: 9 Esau therefore went unto Ishmael,—and took Mahalath daughter of Ishmael､ son of Abraham､ sister of Nebaioth､ to himself to wife, in addition to the wives that he had.

content: 10 So Jacob went forth､ from Beer-sheba,—and journeyed towards Haran.
content_old: 10 So Jacob went forth､ from Beer-sheba,—and journeyed towards Haran.

content: 11 And he lighted on a place､ and tarried the night there､ because the sun had gone in,—and he took of the stones of the place, and put for his pillow,—and lay down in that place.
content_old: 11 And he lighted on a place､ and tarried the night there､ because the sun had gone in,—and he took of the stones of the place, and put for his pillow,—and lay down in that place.

content: 12 And he dreamed､ and lo! a stairway planted earthwards, with its top reaching towards the heavens,—and lo! messengers of God ascending and descending thereon;
content_old: 12 And he dreamed､ and lo! a stairway planted earthwards, with its top reaching towards the heavens,—and lo! messengers of God ascending and descending thereon;

content: 13 and lo! Yahweh standing by him,—and he said, I am Yahweh､ God of Abraham thy father and God of Isaac,— The land whereon thou art lying to thee will I give it､ and to thy seed;
content_old: 13 and lo! Yahweh standing by him,—and he said, I am Yahweh､ God of Abraham thy father and God of Isaac,— The land whereon thou art lying to thee will I give it､ and to thy seed;

content: 14 And thy seed shall become､ as the dust of the earth, and thou shalt break forth westward and eastward､ and northward and southward,— And all the families of the ground shall be blessed in thee､ and in thy seed.
content_old: 14 And thy seed shall become､ as the dust of the earth, and thou shalt break forth westward and eastward､ and northward and southward,— And all the families of the ground shall be blessed in thee､ and in thy seed.

content: 15 Lo! then､ I am with thee､ so will I keep thee in every place whithersoever thou mayest go, and will bring thee back unto this soil,— For I will not forsake thee until I have done that of which I have spoken to thee.
content_old: 15 Lo! then､ I am with thee､ so will I keep thee in every place whithersoever thou mayest go, and will bring thee back unto this soil,— For I will not forsake thee until I have done that of which I have spoken to thee.

content: 16 And Jacob awoke from his sleep, and said､ Surely Yahweh was in this place, And I knew it not.
content_old: 16 And Jacob awoke from his sleep, and said､ Surely Yahweh was in this place, And I knew it not.

content: 17 And he feared､ and said, How fearful is this place! None other this､ than the house of God! Nor this than the gate of the heavens!
content_old: 17 And he feared､ and said, How fearful is this place! None other this､ than the house of God! Nor this than the gate of the heavens!

content: 18 So Jacob rose early in the morning､ and took the stone which he had put for his pillow, and put it for a pillar,—and poured out oil upon the top thereof;
content_old: 18 So Jacob rose early in the morning､ and took the stone which he had put for his pillow, and put it for a pillar,—and poured out oil upon the top thereof;

content: 19 and called the name of that place—Beth-el,—nevertheless Luz was the name of the city､ aforetime.
content_old: 19 and called the name of that place—Beth-el,—nevertheless Luz was the name of the city､ aforetime.

content: 20 And Jacob vowed a vow, saying,— If God will be with me､ and will keep me in this way whereon I am going, and give me bread to eat､ and raiment to put on;
content_old: 20 And Jacob vowed a vow, saying,— If God will be with me､ and will keep me in this way whereon I am going, and give me bread to eat､ and raiment to put on;

content: 21 and I come back in prosperity unto the house of my father Then will Yahweh prove to be my God,—
content_old: 21 and I come back in prosperity unto the house of my father Then will Yahweh prove to be my God,—

content: 1 Then Jacob lifted up his feet,—and went his way towards the land of the sons of the East.
content_old: 1 Then Jacob lifted up his feet,—and went his way towards the land of the sons of the East.

content: 2 And he looked, and lo! a well in the field､ and lo! there three flocks of sheep､ lying down near it, for out of that well do they water the flocks,—but the stone is great､ on the mouth of the well:
content_old: 2 And he looked, and lo! a well in the field､ and lo! there three flocks of sheep､ lying down near it, for out of that well do they water the flocks,—but the stone is great､ on the mouth of the well:

content: 3 so they gather together thither all the flocks､ and roll away the stone from off the mouth of the well, and water the sheep,—and put back the stone upon the mouth of the well､ to its place.
content_old: 3 so they gather together thither all the flocks､ and roll away the stone from off the mouth of the well, and water the sheep,—and put back the stone upon the mouth of the well､ to its place.

content: 4 And Jacob said to them､ My brethren, whence are ye? And they said: From Haran are we.
content_old: 4 And Jacob said to them､ My brethren, whence are ye? And they said: From Haran are we.

content: 5 And he said to them, Know ye Laban､ son of Nahor? And they said､ We know him.
content_old: 5 And he said to them, Know ye Laban､ son of Nahor? And they said､ We know him.

content: 6 And he said to them､ Is it well with him? And they said､ Well, but lo! Rachel his daughter coming in with the sheep.
content_old: 6 And he said to them､ Is it well with him? And they said､ Well, but lo! Rachel his daughter coming in with the sheep.

content: 7 And he said— Lo! the day is yet high, it is not time for gathering together the cattle,—water the sheep､ and go feed.
content_old: 7 And he said— Lo! the day is yet high, it is not time for gathering together the cattle,—water the sheep､ and go feed.

content: 8 And they said､ We cannot, until that all the flocks are gathered together, and they roll away the stone､ from off the mouth of the well,—and then can we water the sheep.
content_old: 8 And they said､ We cannot, until that all the flocks are gathered together, and they roll away the stone､ from off the mouth of the well,—and then can we water the sheep.

content: 9 While yet he was speaking with them Rachel had come in with the sheep which belonged to her father, for a shepherdess was she.
content_old: 9 While yet he was speaking with them Rachel had come in with the sheep which belonged to her father, for a shepherdess was she.

content: 10 And it came to pass when Jacob saw Rachel daughter of Laban､ his mother’s brother, and the sheep of Laban､ his mother’s brother that Jacob went near､ and rolled away the stone from off the mouth of the well, and watered the sheep of Laban､ his mother’s brother.
content_old: 10 And it came to pass when Jacob saw Rachel daughter of Laban､ his mother’s brother, and the sheep of Laban､ his mother’s brother that Jacob went near､ and rolled away the stone from off the mouth of the well, and watered the sheep of Laban､ his mother’s brother.

content: 11 And Jacob kissed Rachel,—and lifted up his voice､ and wept.
content_old: 11 And Jacob kissed Rachel,—and lifted up his voice､ and wept.

content: 12 And when Jacob told Rachel､ that he was her father’s brother and that he was Rebekah’s son then ran she､ and told her father.
content_old: 12 And when Jacob told Rachel､ that he was her father’s brother and that he was Rebekah’s son then ran she､ and told her father.

content: 13 And it came to pass when Laban heard the tidings of Jacob his sister’s son that he ran to meet him､ and embraced him､ and fondly kissed him, and brought him into his house,—when he recounted to Laban all these things.
content_old: 13 And it came to pass when Laban heard the tidings of Jacob his sister’s son that he ran to meet him､ and embraced him､ and fondly kissed him, and brought him into his house,—when he recounted to Laban all these things.

content: 14 And Laban said to him, Surely my bone and my flesh art thou. So he abode with him a month of days.
content_old: 14 And Laban said to him, Surely my bone and my flesh art thou. So he abode with him a month of days.

content: 15 Then said Laban to Jacob, Is it because my brother thou art, that thou shouldst serve me for naught? Come､ tell me! What shall be thy wages?
content_old: 15 Then said Laban to Jacob, Is it because my brother thou art, that thou shouldst serve me for naught? Come､ tell me! What shall be thy wages?

content: 16 Now Laban had two daughters,—the name of the elder Leah, and the name of the youngeŕ Rachel.
content_old: 16 Now Laban had two daughters,—the name of the elder Leah, and the name of the youngeŕ Rachel.

content: 17 But the eyes of Leah were weak,—whereas Rachel was comely in form､ and comely in countenance.
content_old: 17 But the eyes of Leah were weak,—whereas Rachel was comely in form､ and comely in countenance.

content: 18 So Jacob loved Rachel,—and he said､ I will serve thee seven years, for Rachel thy younger daughter.
content_old: 18 So Jacob loved Rachel,—and he said､ I will serve thee seven years, for Rachel thy younger daughter.

content: 19 And Laban said､ Better that I give her to thee, than that I should give her to another man,— Abide with me!
content_old: 19 And Laban said､ Better that I give her to thee, than that I should give her to another man,— Abide with me!

content: 20 So Jacob served for Rachel—seven years,—and they became､ in his eyes､ as single days, for his love to her.
content_old: 20 So Jacob served for Rachel—seven years,—and they became､ in his eyes､ as single days, for his love to her.

content: 21 Then said Jacob unto Laban: Come give me my wife, for fulfilled are my days,—that I may go in unto her.
content_old: 21 Then said Jacob unto Laban: Come give me my wife, for fulfilled are my days,—that I may go in unto her.

content: 22 So Laban gathered together all the men of the place､ and made a banquet.
content_old: 22 So Laban gathered together all the men of the place､ and made a banquet.

content: 23 And it came to pass､ in the evening that he took Leah his daughter､ and brought her in unto him,—and he went in unto her.
content_old: 23 And it came to pass､ in the evening that he took Leah his daughter､ and brought her in unto him,—and he went in unto her.

content: 24 And Laban gave her Zilpah､ his handmaid, unto Leah his daughter､ as handmaid.
content_old: 24 And Laban gave her Zilpah､ his handmaid, unto Leah his daughter､ as handmaid.

content: 25 And it came to pass in the morning, that lo! it was Leah,—and he said unto Laban､ What is this thou hast done to me? Was it not for Rachel I served with thee? Wherefore､ then､ hast thou deceived me?
content_old: 25 And it came to pass in the morning, that lo! it was Leah,—and he said unto Laban､ What is this thou hast done to me? Was it not for Rachel I served with thee? Wherefore､ then､ hast thou deceived me?

content: 26 And Laban said; It must not be done so､ in our place,—to give the later-born before the firstborn.
content_old: 26 And Laban said; It must not be done so､ in our place,—to give the later-born before the firstborn.

content: 27 Fulfil the week of this one,—then must we give thee the other one also､ for the service wherewith thou shalt serve with me yet seven years more.
content_old: 27 Fulfil the week of this one,—then must we give thee the other one also､ for the service wherewith thou shalt serve with me yet seven years more.

content: 28 And Jacob did so, and fulfilled the week of this one,—and he gave him Rachel his daughter—to him to wife.
content_old: 28 And Jacob did so, and fulfilled the week of this one,—and he gave him Rachel his daughter—to him to wife.

content: 29 And Laban gave､ to Rachel his daughter Bilhah､ his handmaid,—to be hers､ as a handmaid.
content_old: 29 And Laban gave､ to Rachel his daughter Bilhah､ his handmaid,—to be hers､ as a handmaid.

content: 30 So he went in unto Rachel also, and loved Rachel also more than Leah,—and he served with him yet seven years more.
content_old: 30 So he went in unto Rachel also, and loved Rachel also more than Leah,—and he served with him yet seven years more.

content: 31 And when Yahweh saw that Leah was hated he granted her to bear children,—whereas Rachel was barren.
content_old: 31 And when Yahweh saw that Leah was hated he granted her to bear children,—whereas Rachel was barren.

content: 32 So Leah conceived､ and hare a son, and called his name､ Reuben,—for she said､ Because Yahweh hath looked upon my humiliation, For now will my husband love me.
content_old: 32 So Leah conceived､ and hare a son, and called his name､ Reuben,—for she said､ Because Yahweh hath looked upon my humiliation, For now will my husband love me.

content: 33 And she conceived again､ and bare a son, and said､ Because Yahweh heard that I was hated he gave me this one also. So she called his name Simeon .
content_old: 33 And she conceived again､ and bare a son, and said､ Because Yahweh heard that I was hated he gave me this one also. So she called his name Simeon .

content: 34 And she conceived again､ and bare a son, and said､ Now—this time will my husband be bound unto me, For I have borne him three sons,— For this cause called she his name Levi.
content_old: 34 And she conceived again､ and bare a son, and said､ Now—this time will my husband be bound unto me, For I have borne him three sons,— For this cause called she his name Levi.

content: 1 And Rachel saw she had borne no children unto Jacob, so Rachel became envious of her sister,—and said unto Jacob､ Come! give me children, or else I die.
content_old: 1 And Rachel saw she had borne no children unto Jacob, so Rachel became envious of her sister,—and said unto Jacob､ Come! give me children, or else I die.

content: 2 Then kindled the anger of Jacob with Rachel,—and he said､ Am I in the place of God who hath withheld from thee the fruit of the womb?
content_old: 2 Then kindled the anger of Jacob with Rachel,—and he said､ Am I in the place of God who hath withheld from thee the fruit of the womb?

content: 3 And she said､ Lo! my handmaid､ Bilhah､ Go in unto her,—that she may bear upon my knees, so that I also may be builded up by her!
content_old: 3 And she said､ Lo! my handmaid､ Bilhah､ Go in unto her,—that she may bear upon my knees, so that I also may be builded up by her!

content: 4 And she gave him Bilhah her handmaid､ to wife,—and Jacob went in unto her;
content_old: 4 And she gave him Bilhah her handmaid､ to wife,—and Jacob went in unto her;

content: 5 and Bilhah conceived, and bare unto Jacob a son;
content_old: 5 and Bilhah conceived, and bare unto Jacob a son;

content: 6 and Rachel said､ God hath vindicated me. Moreover also he hath hearkened unto my voice, and hath given me a son. For this cause called she his name Dan.
content_old: 6 and Rachel said､ God hath vindicated me. Moreover also he hath hearkened unto my voice, and hath given me a son. For this cause called she his name Dan.

content: 7 And Bilhah､ Rachel’s handmaid､ conceived again, and bare a second son to Jacob.
content_old: 7 And Bilhah､ Rachel’s handmaid､ conceived again, and bare a second son to Jacob.

content: 8 Then said Rachel､ With wrestlings of God have I wrestled with my sister､ Yea I have prevailed. So she called his name Naphtali.
content_old: 8 Then said Rachel､ With wrestlings of God have I wrestled with my sister､ Yea I have prevailed. So she called his name Naphtali.

content: 9 Then saw Leah, that she had left off bearing,—so she took Zilpah､ her handmaid, and gave her to Jacob､ to wife.
content_old: 9 Then saw Leah, that she had left off bearing,—so she took Zilpah､ her handmaid, and gave her to Jacob､ to wife.

content: 10 And Zilpah, Leah’s handmaid, bare to Jacob a son:
content_old: 10 And Zilpah, Leah’s handmaid, bare to Jacob a son:

content: 11 and Leah said､ Victory hath come! So she called his name Gad.
content_old: 11 and Leah said､ Victory hath come! So she called his name Gad.

content: 12 And Zilpah､ Leah’s handmaid､ bare a second son to Jacob;
content_old: 12 And Zilpah､ Leah’s handmaid､ bare a second son to Jacob;

content: 13 and Leah said, For my happiness surely happy have daughters pronounced me. So she called his name Asher.
content_old: 13 and Leah said, For my happiness surely happy have daughters pronounced me. So she called his name Asher.

content: 14 Then went Reuben､ in the days of the wheat harvest､ and found mandrakes､ in the field, and brought them in unto Leah his mother,—and Rachel said unto Leah, Pray give me, some of the mandrakes of thy son!
content_old: 14 Then went Reuben､ in the days of the wheat harvest､ and found mandrakes､ in the field, and brought them in unto Leah his mother,—and Rachel said unto Leah, Pray give me, some of the mandrakes of thy son!

content: 15 And she said to her､ Is it a small thing that thou hast taken away my husband? And wouldst thou take away even the mandrakes of my son? Then said Rachel､ Therefore shall he lie with thee to-night, for the mandrakes of thy son.
content_old: 15 And she said to her､ Is it a small thing that thou hast taken away my husband? And wouldst thou take away even the mandrakes of my son? Then said Rachel､ Therefore shall he lie with thee to-night, for the mandrakes of thy son.

content: 16 And Jacob came in from the field､ in the evening, so Leah went out to meet him､ and said: Unto me shalt thou come in, for I have hired thee, even with the mandrakes of my son. And he lay with her that night.
content_old: 16 And Jacob came in from the field､ in the evening, so Leah went out to meet him､ and said: Unto me shalt thou come in, for I have hired thee, even with the mandrakes of my son. And he lay with her that night.

content: 17 And God hearkened unto Leah,—and she conceived､ and bare to Jacob a fifth son.
content_old: 17 And God hearkened unto Leah,—and she conceived､ and bare to Jacob a fifth son.

content: 18 Then said Leah､ God hath given my hire, in that I gave my handmaid to my husband. So she called his name Issachar.
content_old: 18 Then said Leah､ God hath given my hire, in that I gave my handmaid to my husband. So she called his name Issachar.

content: 19 And Leah conceived again､ and bare a sixth son to Jacob.
content_old: 19 And Leah conceived again､ and bare a sixth son to Jacob.

content: 20 Then said Leah､ God hath dowered me､ even me with a handsome dowry, Now will my husband dwell with me, for I have borne him six sons. So she called his name Zebulon.
content_old: 20 Then said Leah､ God hath dowered me､ even me with a handsome dowry, Now will my husband dwell with me, for I have borne him six sons. So she called his name Zebulon.

content: 21 And afterwards she bare a daughter,—so she called her name Dinah.
content_old: 21 And afterwards she bare a daughter,—so she called her name Dinah.

content: 22 Then God remembered Rachel,—and God hearkened unto her, and granted her to bear.
content_old: 22 Then God remembered Rachel,—and God hearkened unto her, and granted her to bear.

content: 23 So she conceived and bare a son,—and said､ God hath taken away my reproach;
content_old: 23 So she conceived and bare a son,—and said､ God hath taken away my reproach;

content: 24 So she called his name Joseph､ saying､ Yahweh is adding unto me another son.
content_old: 24 So she called his name Joseph､ saying､ Yahweh is adding unto me another son.

content: 25 And it came to pass when Rachel had borne Joseph,—that Jacob said unto Laban, Let me go､ that I may take my journey, unto my place､ and to my land.
content_old: 25 And it came to pass when Rachel had borne Joseph,—that Jacob said unto Laban, Let me go､ that I may take my journey, unto my place､ and to my land.

content: 26 Come, give me my wives and my children､ for whom I have served thee､ and let me take my journey,—for thou knowest my service､ wherewith I have served thee.
content_old: 26 Come, give me my wives and my children､ for whom I have served thee､ and let me take my journey,—for thou knowest my service､ wherewith I have served thee.

content: 27 And Laban said unto him, If, I pray thee, I have found favour in thine eyes … I have divined that Yahweh hath blessed me for thy sake.
content_old: 27 And Laban said unto him, If, I pray thee, I have found favour in thine eyes … I have divined that Yahweh hath blessed me for thy sake.

content: 28 And he said,— Come, fix thy wages for me､ that I may give it!
content_old: 28 And he said,— Come, fix thy wages for me､ that I may give it!

content: 29 And he said unto him, Thou knowest how I have served thee,—and how thy cattle have fared with me.
content_old: 29 And he said unto him, Thou knowest how I have served thee,—and how thy cattle have fared with me.

content: 30 For it was little that thou hadst—before I came､ and then it brake forth into a multitude, and Yahweh blessed thee at my every step. Now therefore､ when am I also to do something for my own house?
content_old: 30 For it was little that thou hadst—before I came､ and then it brake forth into a multitude, and Yahweh blessed thee at my every step. Now therefore､ when am I also to do something for my own house?

content: 31 And he said､ What shall I give thee? And Jacob said: Thou shalt give me nothing at all, lf thou wilt do for me this thing I will return､ I will shepherd thy flock､ I will keep it:
content_old: 31 And he said､ What shall I give thee? And Jacob said: Thou shalt give me nothing at all, lf thou wilt do for me this thing I will return､ I will shepherd thy flock､ I will keep it:

content: 32 Let me pass through all thy flock to-day､ removing from thence—every young one that is speckled and spotted､ and every young one that is dark-coloured､ among the young sheep, and spotted and speckled among the goats and they shall be my wages.
content_old: 32 Let me pass through all thy flock to-day､ removing from thence—every young one that is speckled and spotted､ and every young one that is dark-coloured､ among the young sheep, and spotted and speckled among the goats and they shall be my wages.

content: 33 And my righteousness shall answer for me､ on a future day, when thou shalt come in respecting my hire that is before thee,—Every one that is not speckled and spotted among the goats､ and dark-coloured among the young sheep stolen shall it be accounted, if found with me.
content_old: 33 And my righteousness shall answer for me､ on a future day, when thou shalt come in respecting my hire that is before thee,—Every one that is not speckled and spotted among the goats､ and dark-coloured among the young sheep stolen shall it be accounted, if found with me.

content: 34 Then said Laban､ Lo! would it might be according to thy word!
content_old: 34 Then said Laban､ Lo! would it might be according to thy word!
