content: 35 So he removed､ on that day､ the he-goats that were striped and spotted､ and all the she-goats that were speckled and spotted, every one that had white in it, and every dark-coloured one among the young sheep,—and delivered them into the hand of his sons;
content_old: 35 So he removed､ on that day､ the he-goats that were striped and spotted､ and all the she-goats that were speckled and spotted, every one that had white in it, and every dark-coloured one among the young sheep,—and delivered them into the hand of his sons;

content: 36 then put he a journey of three days between himself and Jacob,—but Jacob himself continued tending the flocks of Laban that were left.
content_old: 36 then put he a journey of three days between himself and Jacob,—but Jacob himself continued tending the flocks of Laban that were left.

content: 37 So then Jacob took him rods of young storax､ and hazel and maple,—and peeled in them white stripes, laying bare the white､ which was on the rods.
content_old: 37 So then Jacob took him rods of young storax､ and hazel and maple,—and peeled in them white stripes, laying bare the white､ which was on the rods.

content: 38 And he set the rods which he had peeled, in the channels､ in the troughs of water,—where the flocks came in to drink､ straight before the flocks, and the females of the flock used to be in heat when they came in to drink;
content_old: 38 And he set the rods which he had peeled, in the channels､ in the troughs of water,—where the flocks came in to drink､ straight before the flocks, and the females of the flock used to be in heat when they came in to drink;

content: 39 and the males of the flock were in heat before the rods,—so the flocks brought forth ring-straked､ speckled､ and spotted.
content_old: 39 and the males of the flock were in heat before the rods,—so the flocks brought forth ring-straked､ speckled､ and spotted.

content: 40 The rams also did Jacob separate, and then set the faces of the flocks towards the ring-straked and all the dark-coloured､ among the flocks of Laban,—and he put his own droves by themselves, and put them not with the flocks of Laban.
content_old: 40 The rams also did Jacob separate, and then set the faces of the flocks towards the ring-straked and all the dark-coloured､ among the flocks of Laban,—and he put his own droves by themselves, and put them not with the flocks of Laban.

content: 41 So it came to pass whensoever the stronger of the flocks were in heat that Jacob set the rods before the eyes of the flocks､ in the channels,—that the females might be in heat among the rods;
content_old: 41 So it came to pass whensoever the stronger of the flocks were in heat that Jacob set the rods before the eyes of the flocks､ in the channels,—that the females might be in heat among the rods;

content: 42 but when the flocks were late in bearing he did not set them,—and so the late-born were Laban’s, but the strong ones Jacob’s.
content_old: 42 but when the flocks were late in bearing he did not set them,—and so the late-born were Laban’s, but the strong ones Jacob’s.

content: 1 Then heard he the words of the sons of Laban､ saying, Jacob hath taken away all that belonged to our father; Yea out of what belonged to our father hath he made all this wealth.
content_old: 1 Then heard he the words of the sons of Laban､ saying, Jacob hath taken away all that belonged to our father; Yea out of what belonged to our father hath he made all this wealth.

content: 2 And Jacob looked upon the face of Laban,—and lo! it was not with him as aforetime.
content_old: 2 And Jacob looked upon the face of Laban,—and lo! it was not with him as aforetime.

content: 3 Then said Yahweh unto Jacob, Return unto the land of thy fathers､ and to thy kindred,—that I may be with thee.
content_old: 3 Then said Yahweh unto Jacob, Return unto the land of thy fathers､ and to thy kindred,—that I may be with thee.

content: 4 So Jacob sent, and called for Rachel and for Leah,—to the field､ unto his flock;
content_old: 4 So Jacob sent, and called for Rachel and for Leah,—to the field､ unto his flock;

content: 5 and said to them､ Beholding am I the face of your father, that it is not towards me as aforetime,—nevertheless the God of my father hath been with me;
content_old: 5 and said to them､ Beholding am I the face of your father, that it is not towards me as aforetime,—nevertheless the God of my father hath been with me;

content: 6 and ye know that with all my vigour have I served your father.
content_old: 6 and ye know that with all my vigour have I served your father.

content: 7 But your father hath deceived me, and hath changed my wages ten times,—yet God hath not suffered him to deal harmfully with me.
content_old: 7 But your father hath deceived me, and hath changed my wages ten times,—yet God hath not suffered him to deal harmfully with me.

content: 8 If thus he saith､ The speckled shall be thy wages then do all the flock bring forth speckled,— But if thus he saith､ The ring-straked shall be thy wages then do all the flock bring forth ring-straked.
content_old: 8 If thus he saith､ The speckled shall be thy wages then do all the flock bring forth speckled,— But if thus he saith､ The ring-straked shall be thy wages then do all the flock bring forth ring-straked.

content: 9 So hath God stripped away the herds of your father､ and given them to me.
content_old: 9 So hath God stripped away the herds of your father､ and given them to me.

content: 10 And it came to pass in the season when the flock were in heat then lifted I mine eyes､ and beheld in a dream,—and lo! the he-goats that were leaping upon the flock were ring-straked､ speckled､ and dappled.
content_old: 10 And it came to pass in the season when the flock were in heat then lifted I mine eyes､ and beheld in a dream,—and lo! the he-goats that were leaping upon the flock were ring-straked､ speckled､ and dappled.

content: 11 And the messenger of God said unto me in a dream､ Jacob! and I said, Behold me!
content_old: 11 And the messenger of God said unto me in a dream､ Jacob! and I said, Behold me!

content: 12 Then he said､ Lift､ I pray thee､ thine eyes and behold､ All the he-goats that are leaping upon the flock are ring-straked､ speckled､ and dappled,—for I have seen all that Laban has been doing to thee.
content_old: 12 Then he said､ Lift､ I pray thee､ thine eyes and behold､ All the he-goats that are leaping upon the flock are ring-straked､ speckled､ and dappled,—for I have seen all that Laban has been doing to thee.

content: 13 I am the GOD of Beth-el, where thou didst anoint a pillar, where thou didst vow to me a vow,—Now rise, go forth out of this land, and return unto the land of thy kindred.
content_old: 13 I am the GOD of Beth-el, where thou didst anoint a pillar, where thou didst vow to me a vow,—Now rise, go forth out of this land, and return unto the land of thy kindred.

content: 14 Then responded Rachel and Leah, and said to him,— Have we any longer a portion or an inheritance､ in the house of our father?
content_old: 14 Then responded Rachel and Leah, and said to him,— Have we any longer a portion or an inheritance､ in the house of our father?

content: 15 Are we not accounted aliens to him､ seeing that having sold us he hath then gone on devouring our silver?
content_old: 15 Are we not accounted aliens to him､ seeing that having sold us he hath then gone on devouring our silver?

content: 16 Surely all the riches which God hath stripped off from our father unto us it belongeth､ and unto our sons,— Now､ therefore､ whatsoever God hath said unto thee do.
content_old: 16 Surely all the riches which God hath stripped off from our father unto us it belongeth､ and unto our sons,— Now､ therefore､ whatsoever God hath said unto thee do.

content: 17 So Jacob arose,—and mounted his sons and his wives on the camels;
content_old: 17 So Jacob arose,—and mounted his sons and his wives on the camels;

content: 18 and drave away all his herds､ and all his goods which he had gathered, the gains he had gained, which he had gathered in Padan-aram; that he might go in unto Isaac his father､ unto the land of Canaan.
content_old: 18 and drave away all his herds､ and all his goods which he had gathered, the gains he had gained, which he had gathered in Padan-aram; that he might go in unto Isaac his father､ unto the land of Canaan.

content: 19 Now Laban had gone, to shear his sheep,—so Rachel stole the household gods that belonged to her father.
content_old: 19 Now Laban had gone, to shear his sheep,—so Rachel stole the household gods that belonged to her father.

content: 20 Thus Jacob stole away unawares to Laban､ the Syrian,—in that he had not told him that he was about to flee.
content_old: 20 Thus Jacob stole away unawares to Laban､ the Syrian,—in that he had not told him that he was about to flee.

content: 21 So he fled､ he—and all that he had, and he arose､ and passed over the River,—and set his face towards the mountain of Gilead.
content_old: 21 So he fled､ he—and all that he had, and he arose､ and passed over the River,—and set his face towards the mountain of Gilead.

content: 22 And it was told Laban､ on the third day,���that Jacob had fled.
content_old: 22 And it was told Laban､ on the third day,���that Jacob had fled.

content: 23 So he took his brethren with him, and pursued after him､ a journey of seven days,—and overtook him in the mountain of Gilead.
content_old: 23 So he took his brethren with him, and pursued after him､ a journey of seven days,—and overtook him in the mountain of Gilead.

content: 24 And God went in unto Laban the Syrian､ in a dream of the night,—and said to him､ Take heed to thyself､ that thou speak not with Jacob､ either good or bad.
content_old: 24 And God went in unto Laban the Syrian､ in a dream of the night,—and said to him､ Take heed to thyself､ that thou speak not with Jacob､ either good or bad.

content: 25 So then Laban came up with Jacob,—Jacob having pitched his tent in the mountain, Laban also､ with his brethren､ pitched in the mountain of Gilead.
content_old: 25 So then Laban came up with Jacob,—Jacob having pitched his tent in the mountain, Laban also､ with his brethren､ pitched in the mountain of Gilead.

content: 26 Then said Laban to Jacob, What hadst thou done, that thou shouldst steal away unawares to me,—and shouldst carry off my daughters, as captives of the sword?
content_old: 26 Then said Laban to Jacob, What hadst thou done, that thou shouldst steal away unawares to me,—and shouldst carry off my daughters, as captives of the sword?

content: 27 Wherefore didst thou secretly flee, and rob me,—and didst not tell me, that I might send thee away with rejoicing and with songs, with timbrel and with lyre;
content_old: 27 Wherefore didst thou secretly flee, and rob me,—and didst not tell me, that I might send thee away with rejoicing and with songs, with timbrel and with lyre;

content: 28 and didst not suffer me to kiss my sons and my daughters? Now hast thou done foolishly.
content_old: 28 and didst not suffer me to kiss my sons and my daughters? Now hast thou done foolishly.

content: 29 It is in the power of my hand to deal with thee for harm,—but the God of your father last night spake unto me, saying､ Take heed to thyself that thou speak not with Jacob､ either good or bad.
content_old: 29 It is in the power of my hand to deal with thee for harm,—but the God of your father last night spake unto me, saying､ Take heed to thyself that thou speak not with Jacob､ either good or bad.

content: 30 But now, though thou didst even take thy journey because thou didst sorely long for the house of thy father, wherefore didst thou steal away my gods?
content_old: 30 But now, though thou didst even take thy journey because thou didst sorely long for the house of thy father, wherefore didst thou steal away my gods?

content: 31 And Jacob answered and said unto Laban,— Because I was afraid, for I said､ Lest thou take by force thy daughters from me!
content_old: 31 And Jacob answered and said unto Laban,— Because I was afraid, for I said､ Lest thou take by force thy daughters from me!

content: 32 He with whom thou find thy gods shall not live! Before our brethren note thou for thyself what is with me､ and take what is thine. Neither did Jacob know that Rachel had stolen them.
content_old: 32 He with whom thou find thy gods shall not live! Before our brethren note thou for thyself what is with me､ and take what is thine. Neither did Jacob know that Rachel had stolen them.

content: 33 Then entered Laban into the tent of Jacob and into the tent of Leah and into the tent of the two handmaids､ and found nothing,—then went he forth out of the tent of Leah, and entered into the tent of Rachel.
content_old: 33 Then entered Laban into the tent of Jacob and into the tent of Leah and into the tent of the two handmaids､ and found nothing,—then went he forth out of the tent of Leah, and entered into the tent of Rachel.

content: 34 Now Rachel had taken the household gods and put them in the basket-saddle of the camel､ and taken her seat upon them. And Laban felt about throughout all the tent､ and found them not.
content_old: 34 Now Rachel had taken the household gods and put them in the basket-saddle of the camel､ and taken her seat upon them. And Laban felt about throughout all the tent､ and found them not.

content: 35 And she said unto her father､ Let it not be vexing in the eyes of my lord､ that I cannot rise up at thy presence, for the way of women is upon me. So he made search, but found not the household gods.
content_old: 35 And she said unto her father､ Let it not be vexing in the eyes of my lord､ that I cannot rise up at thy presence, for the way of women is upon me. So he made search, but found not the household gods.

content: 36 And it was vexing to Jacob､ and he contended with Laban,—and Jacob responded､ and said to Laban, What was my trespass､ what my sin, that thou shouldst have come burning after me?
content_old: 36 And it was vexing to Jacob､ and he contended with Laban,—and Jacob responded､ and said to Laban, What was my trespass､ what my sin, that thou shouldst have come burning after me?

content: 37 Now that thou hast felt about among all my goods what hast thou found of the goods of thine own house? Set it out here, right before my brethren and thy brethren,—that they may give sentence betwixt us two.
content_old: 37 Now that thou hast felt about among all my goods what hast thou found of the goods of thine own house? Set it out here, right before my brethren and thy brethren,—that they may give sentence betwixt us two.

content: 38 This twenty years’ time have I been with thee— Thy ewes and thy she-goats have not cast their young,— And the rams of thy flock have I not eaten,
content_old: 38 This twenty years’ time have I been with thee— Thy ewes and thy she-goats have not cast their young,— And the rams of thy flock have I not eaten,

content: 39 The torn have I not brought in unto thee— I bare the loss, At my hand didst thou require it,—Stolen by day､ or stolen by night.
content_old: 39 The torn have I not brought in unto thee— I bare the loss, At my hand didst thou require it,—Stolen by day､ or stolen by night.

content: 40 Thus have I been— By day drought hath consumed me, And frost by night,— So that my sleep fled away from mine eyes.
content_old: 40 Thus have I been— By day drought hath consumed me, And frost by night,— So that my sleep fled away from mine eyes.

content: 41 This hath been my lot twenty years､ in thy house,— I served thee fourteen years､ for thy two daughters, And six years､ for thy sheep— And thou didst change my wages ten times:—
content_old: 41 This hath been my lot twenty years､ in thy house,— I served thee fourteen years､ for thy two daughters, And six years､ for thy sheep— And thou didst change my wages ten times:—

content: 42 But that the God of my father— The God of Abraham､ and the Dread of Isaac— Proved to be mine Surely even now empty hadst thou let me go? My humiliation and the wearying toil of my hands God had seen､ And therefore gave sentence last night!
content_old: 42 But that the God of my father— The God of Abraham､ and the Dread of Isaac— Proved to be mine Surely even now empty hadst thou let me go? My humiliation and the wearying toil of my hands God had seen､ And therefore gave sentence last night!

content: 43 Then responded Laban and said unto Jacob— The daughters are my daughters､ And the sons are my sons､ And the sheep are my sheep, And all that thou beholdest To me doth it belong! But to my daughters what can I do to these､ this day, Or to their sons､ whom they have borne?
content_old: 43 Then responded Laban and said unto Jacob— The daughters are my daughters､ And the sons are my sons､ And the sheep are my sheep, And all that thou beholdest To me doth it belong! But to my daughters what can I do to these､ this day, Or to their sons､ whom they have borne?

content: 44 Now therefore､ come on! Let us solemnise a covenant I and thou,—So shall it be a witness betwixt me and thee.
content_old: 44 Now therefore､ come on! Let us solemnise a covenant I and thou,—So shall it be a witness betwixt me and thee.

content: 45 So Jacob took a stone,—and set it up as a pillar.
content_old: 45 So Jacob took a stone,—and set it up as a pillar.

content: 46 Then said Jacob to his brethren— Gather stones. And they took stones､ and made a heap,—and they did eat there､ by the heap.
content_old: 46 Then said Jacob to his brethren— Gather stones. And they took stones､ and made a heap,—and they did eat there､ by the heap.

content: 47 And Laban called it､ Jegar-sahadutha,—but Jacob called it､ Galeed.
content_old: 47 And Laban called it､ Jegar-sahadutha,—but Jacob called it､ Galeed.

content: 48 Then said Laban: This heap be witness､ betwixt me and thee､ to-day. For this cause is the name thereof called､ Galeed;
content_old: 48 Then said Laban: This heap be witness､ betwixt me and thee､ to-day. For this cause is the name thereof called､ Galeed;

content: 49 also The Watch Tower, as to which it is said, Yahweh watch betwixt me and thee, when we are parted one from another.
content_old: 49 also The Watch Tower, as to which it is said, Yahweh watch betwixt me and thee, when we are parted one from another.

content: 50 If thou oppress my daughters, or if thou take wives besides my daughters—there may be no man with us—see! God be witness betwixt me and thee!
content_old: 50 If thou oppress my daughters, or if thou take wives besides my daughters—there may be no man with us—see! God be witness betwixt me and thee!

content: 51 And Laban said to Jacob— Behold this heap､ and behold this pillar､ which I have set betwixt me and thee:
content_old: 51 And Laban said to Jacob— Behold this heap､ and behold this pillar､ which I have set betwixt me and thee:

content: 52 A witness be this heap､ and a witness the pillar,— That I am not to pass､ unto thee､ over this heap, And thou art not to pass､ unto me､ over this heap and this pillar for harm.
content_old: 52 A witness be this heap､ and a witness the pillar,— That I am not to pass､ unto thee､ over this heap, And thou art not to pass､ unto me､ over this heap and this pillar for harm.

content: 53 The Gods of Abraham and the Gods of Nahor judge betwixt us—the Gods of their fathers. And Jacob sware by the Dread of his father Isaac;
content_old: 53 The Gods of Abraham and the Gods of Nahor judge betwixt us—the Gods of their fathers. And Jacob sware by the Dread of his father Isaac;

content: 54 and Jacob offered sacrifice in the mountain, and called on his brethren to eat bread. So they did eat bread, and tarried the night in the mountain.
content_old: 54 and Jacob offered sacrifice in the mountain, and called on his brethren to eat bread. So they did eat bread, and tarried the night in the mountain.

content: 1 When Jacob had gone on his way there met him､ messengers of God.
content_old: 1 When Jacob had gone on his way there met him､ messengers of God.

content: 2 And Jacob said､ when he saw them, The camp of God is this! So he called the name of that place､ Mahanaim.
content_old: 2 And Jacob said､ when he saw them, The camp of God is this! So he called the name of that place､ Mahanaim.

content: 3 Then did Jacob send messengers before him, unto Esau his brother,—to the land of Seir､ the field of Edom.
content_old: 3 Then did Jacob send messengers before him, unto Esau his brother,—to the land of Seir､ the field of Edom.

content: 4 And he commanded them､ saying, Thus shall ye say to my lord､ to Esau, Thus saith thy servant Jacob, With Laban have I sojourned, and tarried until now:
content_old: 4 And he commanded them､ saying, Thus shall ye say to my lord､ to Esau, Thus saith thy servant Jacob, With Laban have I sojourned, and tarried until now:

content: 5 And I have oxen and asses､ flocks and men-servants and maid-servants, So I must needs send to tell my lord, that I might find favour in thine eyes.
content_old: 5 And I have oxen and asses､ flocks and men-servants and maid-servants, So I must needs send to tell my lord, that I might find favour in thine eyes.

content: 6 And the messengers returned unto Jacob､ saying,— We came in unto thy brother､ unto Esau, moreover also he is on his way to meet thee, and four hundred men with him.
content_old: 6 And the messengers returned unto Jacob､ saying,— We came in unto thy brother､ unto Esau, moreover also he is on his way to meet thee, and four hundred men with him.

content: 7 Then was Jacob greatly afraid, and in distress. So he divided the people that were with him､ and the flocks and the herds and the camels､ into two camps.
content_old: 7 Then was Jacob greatly afraid, and in distress. So he divided the people that were with him､ and the flocks and the herds and the camels､ into two camps.

content: 8 And he said, Should Esau come upon the one camp､ and smite it yet shall the camp that is left escape.
content_old: 8 And he said, Should Esau come upon the one camp､ and smite it yet shall the camp that is left escape.

content: 9 And Jacob said, God of my father Abraham, and God of my father Isaac,—Yahweh､ who wast saying unto me,— Return to thy land and to thy kindred､ that I may deal well with thee;—
content_old: 9 And Jacob said, God of my father Abraham, and God of my father Isaac,—Yahweh､ who wast saying unto me,— Return to thy land and to thy kindred､ that I may deal well with thee;—

content: 10 I am too small for all the lovingkindnesses､ and for all the faithfulness, which thou hast done unto thy servant,— For with my staff passed I over this Jordan, But now have I become two camps.
content_old: 10 I am too small for all the lovingkindnesses､ and for all the faithfulness, which thou hast done unto thy servant,— For with my staff passed I over this Jordan, But now have I become two camps.

content: 11 Deliver me､ I pray thee､ out of the hand of my brother､ out of the hand of Esau,—for I am afraid of him, lest he come in and smite—mother､ as well as sons!
content_old: 11 Deliver me､ I pray thee､ out of the hand of my brother､ out of the hand of Esau,—for I am afraid of him, lest he come in and smite—mother､ as well as sons!

content: 12 But thou thyself saidst,— I will deal well with thee,— So will I make thy seed as the sand of the sea, which is not to be counted､ for multitude.
content_old: 12 But thou thyself saidst,— I will deal well with thee,— So will I make thy seed as the sand of the sea, which is not to be counted､ for multitude.

content: 13 And he tarried there that night, and took of that which came to his hand､ a present for Esau his brother:—
content_old: 13 And he tarried there that night, and took of that which came to his hand､ a present for Esau his brother:—

content: 14 She-goats, two hundred;
content_old: 14 She-goats, two hundred;

content: their colts, thirty; Cows, forty;
content_old: their colts, thirty; Cows, forty;

content: And he-goats, twenty;
content_old: And he-goats, twenty;

content: And bulls, ten;
content_old: And bulls, ten;

content: Ewes, two hundred;
content_old: Ewes, two hundred;

content: She-asses, twenty;
content_old: She-asses, twenty;

content: And rams, twenty;
content_old: And rams, twenty;

content: And young he-asses, ten.
content_old: And young he-asses, ten.

content: 15 Milch camels, with
content_old: 15 Milch camels, with

content: 16 And he gave them into the hand of his servants, each drove by itself,—and said unto his servants— Pass over before me, and a breathing-space shall ye put betwixt drove and drove.
content_old: 16 And he gave them into the hand of his servants, each drove by itself,—and said unto his servants— Pass over before me, and a breathing-space shall ye put betwixt drove and drove.

content: 17 And he commanded the first one､ saying: When Esau my brother shall fall in with thee, and shall ask thee, saying, Whose art thou? and whither wouldst thou go? and to whom belong these before thee?
content_old: 17 And he commanded the first one､ saying: When Esau my brother shall fall in with thee, and shall ask thee, saying, Whose art thou? and whither wouldst thou go? and to whom belong these before thee?

content: 18 then shalt thou say､ To thy servant Jacob: It is a present sent to my lord, to Esau; And behold he himself also is behind us.
content_old: 18 then shalt thou say､ To thy servant Jacob: It is a present sent to my lord, to Esau; And behold he himself also is behind us.

content: 19 And he commanded the second also､ and the third､ yea all that were going on behind the droves, saying,— According to this word shall ye speak unto Esau, when ye find him.
content_old: 19 And he commanded the second also､ and the third､ yea all that were going on behind the droves, saying,— According to this word shall ye speak unto Esau, when ye find him.

content: 20 Then shall ye say, Also, lo! thy servant Jacob is behind us. For he said: I must pacify him with the present that goeth on before me, And after that will I see his face: Peradventure he will accept me.
content_old: 20 Then shall ye say, Also, lo! thy servant Jacob is behind us. For he said: I must pacify him with the present that goeth on before me, And after that will I see his face: Peradventure he will accept me.

content: 21 So the present passed over before him,—whereas he himself tarried that night in the camp.
content_old: 21 So the present passed over before him,—whereas he himself tarried that night in the camp.

content: 22 And he arose in that night､ and took his two wives､ and his two handmaids, and his eleven sons,—and passed over the ford of Jabbok.
content_old: 22 And he arose in that night､ and took his two wives､ and his two handmaids, and his eleven sons,—and passed over the ford of Jabbok.

content: 23 So he took them, and sent them over the brook,—and sent over that which he had.
content_old: 23 So he took them, and sent them over the brook,—and sent over that which he had.

content: 24 And Jacob was left alone,—and there wrestled a man with him, until the uprisings of the dawn.
content_old: 24 And Jacob was left alone,—and there wrestled a man with him, until the uprisings of the dawn.

content: 25 And when he saw that he prevailed not against him he touched the hollow of his thigh,—and the hollow of Jacob’s thigh was put out of joint, as he wrestled with him.
content_old: 25 And when he saw that he prevailed not against him he touched the hollow of his thigh,—and the hollow of Jacob’s thigh was put out of joint, as he wrestled with him.

content: 26 Then said he— Let me go, for uprisen hath the dawn. And he said: I will not let thee go,—except thou have blessed me.
content_old: 26 Then said he— Let me go, for uprisen hath the dawn. And he said: I will not let thee go,—except thou have blessed me.

content: 27 Then he said unto him— What is thy name? And he said— Jacob.
content_old: 27 Then he said unto him— What is thy name? And he said— Jacob.

content: 28 Then he said— Not Jacob shall thy name be called any more, but Israel,— For thou hast contended with God and with men､ and hast prevailed.
content_old: 28 Then he said— Not Jacob shall thy name be called any more, but Israel,— For thou hast contended with God and with men､ and hast prevailed.

content: 29 Then asked Jacob and said, Do､ I pray thee､ tell me thy name! And he said— Wherefore now､ shouldest thou ask for my name? And he blessed him there.
content_old: 29 Then asked Jacob and said, Do､ I pray thee､ tell me thy name! And he said— Wherefore now､ shouldest thou ask for my name? And he blessed him there.

content: 30 So Jacob called the name of the place Peniel; For I saw God､ face to face; and my soul was delivered.
content_old: 30 So Jacob called the name of the place Peniel; For I saw God､ face to face; and my soul was delivered.

content: 31 And the sun rose on him as soon as he had passed over Penuel,—he､ moreover､ was halting upon his thigh.
content_old: 31 And the sun rose on him as soon as he had passed over Penuel,—he､ moreover､ was halting upon his thigh.

content: 1 Then Jacob lifted up his eyes､ and looked, and lo! Esau coming in,—and with him four hundred men. So he divided the children—unto Leah､ and unto Rachel, and unto the two handmaids;
content_old: 1 Then Jacob lifted up his eyes､ and looked, and lo! Esau coming in,—and with him four hundred men. So he divided the children—unto Leah､ and unto Rachel, and unto the two handmaids;

content: 2 and put the handmaids and their children first,—and Leah and her children next, and Rachel and Joseph next;
content_old: 2 and put the handmaids and their children first,—and Leah and her children next, and Rachel and Joseph next;

content: 3 but he himself passed over before them, and bowed himself to the earth seven times､ until he had come near unto his brother.
content_old: 3 but he himself passed over before them, and bowed himself to the earth seven times､ until he had come near unto his brother.

content: 4 Then ran Esau to meet him､ and embraced him, and fell on his neck,—and they wept.
content_old: 4 Then ran Esau to meet him､ and embraced him, and fell on his neck,—and they wept.

content: 5 Then lifted he up his eyes､ and beheld the women and the children, and said､ What are these to thee? And he said— The children wherewith God hath favoured thy servant.
content_old: 5 Then lifted he up his eyes､ and beheld the women and the children, and said､ What are these to thee? And he said— The children wherewith God hath favoured thy servant.

content: 6 Then came near the handmaids, they—and their children,—and bowed themselves.
content_old: 6 Then came near the handmaids, they—and their children,—and bowed themselves.

content: 7 Then came near Leah also､ with her children,—and they bowed themselves. And afterwards came near Joseph with Rachel, and they bowed themselves.
content_old: 7 Then came near Leah also､ with her children,—and they bowed themselves. And afterwards came near Joseph with Rachel, and they bowed themselves.

content: 8 Then said he, What to thee is all this camp､ which I have fallen in with? And he said,— To find favour､ in the eyes of my lord.
content_old: 8 Then said he, What to thee is all this camp､ which I have fallen in with? And he said,— To find favour､ in the eyes of my lord.

content: 9 Then said Esau､ I have an abundance,—my brother, be thine what thou hast!
content_old: 9 Then said Esau､ I have an abundance,—my brother, be thine what thou hast!

content: 10 Then said Jacob､ Nay､ I pray thee､if､ I pray thee､ I have found favour in thine eyes then thou wilt take my present at my hand,— For on this account hath my seeing thy face been like seeing the face of God､ in that thou wast well-pleased with me.
content_old: 10 Then said Jacob､ Nay､ I pray thee､if､ I pray thee､ I have found favour in thine eyes then thou wilt take my present at my hand,— For on this account hath my seeing thy face been like seeing the face of God､ in that thou wast well-pleased with me.

content: 11 Take､ I pray thee､ my blessing which hath been brought in to thee,—because God hath shewed me favour､ and because I have everything. So he was urgent with him､ and he took it.
content_old: 11 Take､ I pray thee､ my blessing which hath been brought in to thee,—because God hath shewed me favour､ and because I have everything. So he was urgent with him､ and he took it.

content: 12 Then he said､ Let us break up and go,—and let me go on before thee.
content_old: 12 Then he said､ Let us break up and go,—and let me go on before thee.

content: 13 And he said unto him､ My lord is taking note､ that the children are tender,—and the flocks and the herds are giving suck with me,—and should I overdrive them a single day then would all the flocks die.
content_old: 13 And he said unto him､ My lord is taking note､ that the children are tender,—and the flocks and the herds are giving suck with me,—and should I overdrive them a single day then would all the flocks die.

content: 14 Let my lord､ I pray thee､ pass over before his servant,—and let me lead on in my own easy way､ at the pace of the cattle that are before me､ and at the pace of the children, until that I come in unto my lord､ towards Seir.
content_old: 14 Let my lord､ I pray thee､ pass over before his servant,—and let me lead on in my own easy way､ at the pace of the cattle that are before me､ and at the pace of the children, until that I come in unto my lord､ towards Seir.

content: 15 Then said Esau: Let me leave､ I pray thee､ along with thee, some of the people who are with me! And he said— Why so? let me find favour in the eyes of my lord!
content_old: 15 Then said Esau: Let me leave､ I pray thee､ along with thee, some of the people who are with me! And he said— Why so? let me find favour in the eyes of my lord!

content: 16 So Esau returned､ that day､ to his journey towards Mount Seir.
content_old: 16 So Esau returned､ that day､ to his journey towards Mount Seir.

content: 17 But Jacob brake up towards Succoth, and built for himself a house,—for his cattle made he places of shelter, for which cause the name of the place was called､ Succoth.
content_old: 17 But Jacob brake up towards Succoth, and built for himself a house,—for his cattle made he places of shelter, for which cause the name of the place was called､ Succoth.

content: 18 And Jacob came in peace to the city of Shechem､ which is in the land of Canaan,—when he came in from Padan-aram,—and he encamped before the city.
content_old: 18 And Jacob came in peace to the city of Shechem､ which is in the land of Canaan,—when he came in from Padan-aram,—and he encamped before the city.

content: 19 And he bought the portion of the field､ where he had spread out his tent, at the hand of the sons of Hamor､ father of Shechem,—for a hundred kesitahs.
content_old: 19 And he bought the portion of the field､ where he had spread out his tent, at the hand of the sons of Hamor､ father of Shechem,—for a hundred kesitahs.

content: 1 Then went forth Dinah､ the daughter of Leah, whom she had borne to Jacob,—to see the daughters of the land.
content_old: 1 Then went forth Dinah､ the daughter of Leah, whom she had borne to Jacob,—to see the daughters of the land.

content: 2 And Shechem､ son of Hamor the Hivite､ prince of the land､ saw her,—so he took her､ and lay with her､ and humbled her.
content_old: 2 And Shechem､ son of Hamor the Hivite､ prince of the land､ saw her,—so he took her､ and lay with her､ and humbled her.

content: 3 And his soul clave unto Dinah､ daughter of Jacob,—and he loved the young woman, and spake to the heart of the young woman.
content_old: 3 And his soul clave unto Dinah､ daughter of Jacob,—and he loved the young woman, and spake to the heart of the young woman.

content: 4 Then spake Shechem unto Hamor his father､ saying,— Take me this girl､ to wife!
content_old: 4 Then spake Shechem unto Hamor his father､ saying,— Take me this girl､ to wife!

content: 5 Now Jacob had heard that he had defiled Dinah his daughter, but his sons happened to be with his cattle､ in the field,—so Jacob kept quiet､ until they came in.
content_old: 5 Now Jacob had heard that he had defiled Dinah his daughter, but his sons happened to be with his cattle､ in the field,—so Jacob kept quiet､ until they came in.

content: 6 Then came forth Hamor､ father of Shechem､ unto Jacob,—to speak with him.
content_old: 6 Then came forth Hamor､ father of Shechem､ unto Jacob,—to speak with him.

content: 7 Now the sons of Jacob came in from the field､ as soon as they heard, and the men were grieved､ and it was vexing to them exceedingly,—for a disgraceful deed had he done with Israel､ in lying with Jacob’s daughter, seeing that so it should not be done.
content_old: 7 Now the sons of Jacob came in from the field､ as soon as they heard, and the men were grieved､ and it was vexing to them exceedingly,—for a disgraceful deed had he done with Israel､ in lying with Jacob’s daughter, seeing that so it should not be done.

content: 8 So then Hamor spake with them､ saying— As for Shechem my son his soul hath become attached to your daughter,—I pray you give her to him､ to wife.
content_old: 8 So then Hamor spake with them､ saying— As for Shechem my son his soul hath become attached to your daughter,—I pray you give her to him､ to wife.

content: 9 And exchange ye daughters with us in marriage,—your daughters shall ye give to us, and our daughters shall ye take to you.
content_old: 9 And exchange ye daughters with us in marriage,—your daughters shall ye give to us, and our daughters shall ye take to you.

content: 10 And with us shall ye dwell,—and the land shall be before you, tarry､ and go through it, and get possessions therein.
content_old: 10 And with us shall ye dwell,—and the land shall be before you, tarry､ and go through it, and get possessions therein.

content: 11 Then said Shechem unto her father､ and unto her brethren, Let me find favour in your eyes,—and whatsoever ye may say unto me will I give:
content_old: 11 Then said Shechem unto her father､ and unto her brethren, Let me find favour in your eyes,—and whatsoever ye may say unto me will I give:

content: 12 Heap on me､ exceedingly､ dowry and gift, and I will give､ just as ye may say unto me,—but give me the young woman､ to wife.
content_old: 12 Heap on me､ exceedingly､ dowry and gift, and I will give､ just as ye may say unto me,—but give me the young woman､ to wife.

content: 13 And the sons of Jacob answered Shechem､ and Hamor his father､ deceitfully, and spake (because he had defiled Dinah their sister)—
content_old: 13 And the sons of Jacob answered Shechem､ and Hamor his father､ deceitfully, and spake (because he had defiled Dinah their sister)—

content: 14 and said unto them— We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to a man that is uncircumcised,—for a reproach it would be to us.
content_old: 14 and said unto them— We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to a man that is uncircumcised,—for a reproach it would be to us.

content: 15 Only herein can we consent to you,—If ye will become like us, by circumcising to you every male
content_old: 15 Only herein can we consent to you,—If ye will become like us, by circumcising to you every male

content: 16 then will we give our daughters to you, and your daughters will we take to us,—and we will dwell with you, and become one people.
content_old: 16 then will we give our daughters to you, and your daughters will we take to us,—and we will dwell with you, and become one people.

content: 17 But if ye will not hearken unto us､ to be circumcised then will we take our daughter､ and be gone.
content_old: 17 But if ye will not hearken unto us､ to be circumcised then will we take our daughter､ and be gone.

content: 18 And their words looked fair､ in the eyes of Hamor,—and in the eyes of Shechem､ Hamor’s son;
content_old: 18 And their words looked fair､ in the eyes of Hamor,—and in the eyes of Shechem､ Hamor’s son;

content: 19 and the young man deferred not to do the thing, because he had delight in Jacob’s daughter,—he moreover being more honourable than all the house of his father.
content_old: 19 and the young man deferred not to do the thing, because he had delight in Jacob’s daughter,—he moreover being more honourable than all the house of his father.

content: 20 So Hamor entered､ with Shechem his son､ into the gate of their city,—and they spake unto the men of their city､ saying:
content_old: 20 So Hamor entered､ with Shechem his son､ into the gate of their city,—and they spake unto the men of their city､ saying:

content: 21 As for these men in peace they are with us—let them therefore dwell in the land､ and go through it, for the land, lo! it is roomy on both hands､ before them,—their daughters let us take to us for wives, and our daughters let us give to them.
content_old: 21 As for these men in peace they are with us—let them therefore dwell in the land､ and go through it, for the land, lo! it is roomy on both hands､ before them,—their daughters let us take to us for wives, and our daughters let us give to them.

content: 22 Only herein will the men consent to us､ to dwell with us, to become one people,— If we circumcise to us every male, even as they are circumcised.
content_old: 22 Only herein will the men consent to us､ to dwell with us, to become one people,— If we circumcise to us every male, even as they are circumcised.

content: 23 Their herds､ and their substance､ and all their beasts shall they not be ours? Only we must consent to them, that they may dwell with us.
content_old: 23 Their herds､ and their substance､ and all their beasts shall they not be ours? Only we must consent to them, that they may dwell with us.

content: 24 And they hearkened unto Hamor､ and unto Shechem his son, even all that were going forth out of the gate of his city,—and every male was circumcised, all that were going forth out of the gate of his city.
content_old: 24 And they hearkened unto Hamor､ and unto Shechem his son, even all that were going forth out of the gate of his city,—and every male was circumcised, all that were going forth out of the gate of his city.

content: 25 And it came to pass on the third day､ when they were in pain､ that two of the sons of Jacob､ Simeon and Levi､ Dinah’s brothers､ took each man his sword, and came in upon the city､ boldly,—and slew every male;
content_old: 25 And it came to pass on the third day､ when they were in pain､ that two of the sons of Jacob､ Simeon and Levi､ Dinah’s brothers､ took each man his sword, and came in upon the city､ boldly,—and slew every male;

content: 26 Hamor also､ and Shechem his son slew they with the edge of the sword,—and took Dinah out of the house of Shechem､ and came forth.
content_old: 26 Hamor also､ and Shechem his son slew they with the edge of the sword,—and took Dinah out of the house of Shechem､ and came forth.

content: 27 The sons of Jacob came in upon the slain､ and plundered the city,—because they had defiled their sister:
content_old: 27 The sons of Jacob came in upon the slain､ and plundered the city,—because they had defiled their sister:

content: 28 their flocks､ and their herds､ and their asses,—and that which was in the city､ and that which was in the field they took;
content_old: 28 their flocks､ and their herds､ and their asses,—and that which was in the city､ and that which was in the field they took;

content: 29 and all their wealth､ and all their little ones and their women took they captive､ and seized as plunder,—even all that was in their houses.
content_old: 29 and all their wealth､ and all their little ones and their women took they captive､ and seized as plunder,—even all that was in their houses.

content: 30 Then said Jacob unto Simeon and unto Levi— Ye have troubled me､ by making me､ odious among them that dwell in the land, among the Canaanites､ and among the Perizzites,—I having only men that may be counted they will gather themselves together against me､ and smite me,—and I shall be destroyed､ both I and my house.
content_old: 30 Then said Jacob unto Simeon and unto Levi— Ye have troubled me､ by making me､ odious among them that dwell in the land, among the Canaanites､ and among the Perizzites,—I having only men that may be counted they will gather themselves together against me､ and smite me,—and I shall be destroyed､ both I and my house.

content: 1 Then said God unto Jacob, Arise､ go up to Beth-el､ and dwell there,—and make there an altar, to the GOD who appeared unto thee､ when thou fleddest from the face of Esau thy brother.
content_old: 1 Then said God unto Jacob, Arise､ go up to Beth-el､ and dwell there,—and make there an altar, to the GOD who appeared unto thee､ when thou fleddest from the face of Esau thy brother.

content: 2 And Jacob said unto his house, and unto all who were with him,— Put away the gods of the alien which are in your midst, and purify yourselves､ and change your garments;
content_old: 2 And Jacob said unto his house, and unto all who were with him,— Put away the gods of the alien which are in your midst, and purify yourselves､ and change your garments;

content: 3 And let us arise､ and go up to Beth-el,—that I may make there an altar､ to the GOD who answered me in the day of my distress, and was with me､ in the way that I went.
content_old: 3 And let us arise､ and go up to Beth-el,—that I may make there an altar､ to the GOD who answered me in the day of my distress, and was with me､ in the way that I went.

content: 4 So they gave unto Jacob all the gods of the alien which were in their hand, and the earrings which were in their ears,—and Jacob hid them under the oak､ which was by Shechem.
content_old: 4 So they gave unto Jacob all the gods of the alien which were in their hand, and the earrings which were in their ears,—and Jacob hid them under the oak､ which was by Shechem.

content: 5 And they brake up,—and it came to pass that the terror of God was on the cities which were round about them, so that they pursued not after the sons of Jacob.
content_old: 5 And they brake up,—and it came to pass that the terror of God was on the cities which were round about them, so that they pursued not after the sons of Jacob.

content: 6 And Jacob came in towards Luz､ which was in the land of Canaan, the same is Beth-el,—he and all the people who were with him.
content_old: 6 And Jacob came in towards Luz､ which was in the land of Canaan, the same is Beth-el,—he and all the people who were with him.

content: 7 And he built there an altar, and called the place El-Beth-el,—because there God revealed himself unto him, when he fled from the face of his brother.
content_old: 7 And he built there an altar, and called the place El-Beth-el,—because there God revealed himself unto him, when he fled from the face of his brother.

content: 8 And Deborah､ Rebekah’s nurse died, and was buried below Beth-el､ under the oak,—so the name thereof was called､ Allon-bacuth.
content_old: 8 And Deborah､ Rebekah’s nurse died, and was buried below Beth-el､ under the oak,—so the name thereof was called､ Allon-bacuth.

content: 9 And God appeared unto Jacob､ again when he came in from Padan-aram,—and blessed him.
content_old: 9 And God appeared unto Jacob､ again when he came in from Padan-aram,—and blessed him.

content: 10 And God said to him､ Thy name is Jacob,— Thy name shall no longer he called Jacob､ But Israel shall be thy name. So he called his name Israel.
content_old: 10 And God said to him､ Thy name is Jacob,— Thy name shall no longer he called Jacob､ But Israel shall be thy name. So he called his name Israel.

content: 11 And God said to him— I am GOD Almighty! Be fruitful and multiply, A nation､ and a multitude of nations shall spring from thee,— And kings from thy loins shall come forth;
content_old: 11 And God said to him— I am GOD Almighty! Be fruitful and multiply, A nation､ and a multitude of nations shall spring from thee,— And kings from thy loins shall come forth;

content: 12 And the land which I gave to Abraham and to Isaac To thee will I give it,— And to thy seed after thee will I give the land.
content_old: 12 And the land which I gave to Abraham and to Isaac To thee will I give it,— And to thy seed after thee will I give the land.

content: 13 And God went up from him､ at the place where he had spoken with him.
content_old: 13 And God went up from him､ at the place where he had spoken with him.

content: 14 And Jacob set up a pillar､ in the place where he had spoken with him､ a pillar of stone,—and he poured out thereon､ a drink-offering, and poured thereon､ oil.
content_old: 14 And Jacob set up a pillar､ in the place where he had spoken with him､ a pillar of stone,—and he poured out thereon､ a drink-offering, and poured thereon､ oil.

content: 15 And Jacob called the name of the place､ where God had spoken with him､ Beth-el.
content_old: 15 And Jacob called the name of the place､ where God had spoken with him､ Beth-el.

content: 16 Then brake they up from Beth-el, and it came to pass when there was yet a stretch of country､ to enter into Ephrath that Rachel was in child-birth､ and had hard-labour in her child-birth.
content_old: 16 Then brake they up from Beth-el, and it came to pass when there was yet a stretch of country､ to enter into Ephrath that Rachel was in child-birth､ and had hard-labour in her child-birth.

content: 17 So it came to pass when she was in hard-labour in her child-birth that the midwife said to her— Do not fear, for this also of thine､ is a son.
content_old: 17 So it came to pass when she was in hard-labour in her child-birth that the midwife said to her— Do not fear, for this also of thine､ is a son.

content: 18 And it came to pass when her soul was going forth—for she died that she called his name､ Ben-oni,—but his father called him､ Benjamin.
content_old: 18 And it came to pass when her soul was going forth—for she died that she called his name､ Ben-oni,—but his father called him､ Benjamin.

content: 19 So Rachel died,—and was buried on the way to Ephrath､ the same is Bethlehem.
content_old: 19 So Rachel died,—and was buried on the way to Ephrath､ the same is Bethlehem.

content: 20 And Jacob set up a pillar､ over her grave,—the same is—The Pillar of the Grave of Rachel､ until this day.
content_old: 20 And Jacob set up a pillar､ over her grave,—the same is—The Pillar of the Grave of Rachel､ until this day.

content: 21 Then Israel brake up,—and spread his tent at a distance from Migdal Eder.
content_old: 21 Then Israel brake up,—and spread his tent at a distance from Migdal Eder.

content: 22 And it came to pass while Israel inhabited that land that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his father’s concubine; and Israel heard of it. And so the Sons of Israel came to be Twelve.
content_old: 22 And it came to pass while Israel inhabited that land that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his father’s concubine; and Israel heard of it. And so the Sons of Israel came to be Twelve.

content: 23 The sons of Leah The firstborn of Jacob Reuben,— And Simeon､ and Levi and Judah, and Issachar and Zebulon:
content_old: 23 The sons of Leah The firstborn of Jacob Reuben,— And Simeon､ and Levi and Judah, and Issachar and Zebulon:

content: 24 The sons of Rachel Joseph､ and Benjamin:
content_old: 24 The sons of Rachel Joseph､ and Benjamin:

content: 25 And the sons of Bilhah､ handmaid of Rachel Dan､ and Naphtali:
content_old: 25 And the sons of Bilhah､ handmaid of Rachel Dan､ and Naphtali:

content: 26 And the sons of Zilpah､ handmaid of Leah Gad and Asher: These are the sons of Jacob, who were born to him､ in Padan-aram.
content_old: 26 And the sons of Zilpah､ handmaid of Leah Gad and Asher: These are the sons of Jacob, who were born to him､ in Padan-aram.

content: 27 Then came Jacob､ unto Isaac his father, to Mamre, the city of Arba,—the same is Hebron, where had sojourned Abraham and Isaac.
content_old: 27 Then came Jacob､ unto Isaac his father, to Mamre, the city of Arba,—the same is Hebron, where had sojourned Abraham and Isaac.

content: 28 And the days of Isaac came to be—a hundred and eighty years.
content_old: 28 And the days of Isaac came to be—a hundred and eighty years.

content: 1 Now these are the generations of Esau､ the same is Edom.
content_old: 1 Now these are the generations of Esau､ the same is Edom.

content: 2 Esau took his wives of the daughters of Canaan,— Even Adah, daughter of Elon､ the Hittite, And Oholibamah､ daughter of Anah, son of Zibeon､ the Hivite;
content_old: 2 Esau took his wives of the daughters of Canaan,— Even Adah, daughter of Elon､ the Hittite, And Oholibamah､ daughter of Anah, son of Zibeon､ the Hivite;

content: 3 And Basemath daughter of Ishmael､ sister of Nebaioth.
content_old: 3 And Basemath daughter of Ishmael､ sister of Nebaioth.

content: 4 So Adah bare to Esau､ Eliphaz, and Basemath bare Reuel;
content_old: 4 So Adah bare to Esau､ Eliphaz, and Basemath bare Reuel;

content: 5 and Oholibamah bare Jeush and Jalam and Korah. These are the sons of Esau､ who were born to him in the land of Canaan.
content_old: 5 and Oholibamah bare Jeush and Jalam and Korah. These are the sons of Esau､ who were born to him in the land of Canaan.

content: 6 Then took Esau his wives､ and his sons､ and his daughters､ and all the souls of his house, and his herds and all his beasts､ and all his possessions whatsoever he had gathered in the land of Canaan,—and went into a land, away from the face of Jacob his brother.
content_old: 6 Then took Esau his wives､ and his sons､ and his daughters､ and all the souls of his house, and his herds and all his beasts､ and all his possessions whatsoever he had gathered in the land of Canaan,—and went into a land, away from the face of Jacob his brother.

content: 7 For their substance had become too great､ for them to dwell together,—neither could the land of their sojournings sustain them, because of their herds.
content_old: 7 For their substance had become too great､ for them to dwell together,—neither could the land of their sojournings sustain them, because of their herds.

content: 8 So Esau dwelt in Mount Seir, Esau is Edom.
content_old: 8 So Esau dwelt in Mount Seir, Esau is Edom.

content: 9 And these are the generations of Esau､ father of Edom,—in Mount Seir.
content_old: 9 And these are the generations of Esau､ father of Edom,—in Mount Seir.

content: 10 These are the names of the sons of Esau,— Eliphaz､ son of Adah､ wife of Esau, Reuel､ son of Basemath､ wife of Esau.
content_old: 10 These are the names of the sons of Esau,— Eliphaz､ son of Adah､ wife of Esau, Reuel､ son of Basemath､ wife of Esau.

content: 11 Then came the sons of Eliphaz to be,— Teman､ Omar､ Zepho､ and Gatam､ and Kenaz.
content_old: 11 Then came the sons of Eliphaz to be,— Teman､ Omar､ Zepho､ and Gatam､ and Kenaz.

content: 12 Now Timna became the concubine of Eliphaz､ son of Esau, and she bare､ to Eliphaz､ Amalek. These are the sons of Adah､ wife of Esau.
content_old: 12 Now Timna became the concubine of Eliphaz､ son of Esau, and she bare､ to Eliphaz､ Amalek. These are the sons of Adah､ wife of Esau.

content: 13 And these are the sons of Reuel, Nahath and Zerah､ Shammah and Mizzah,— These were the sons of Basemath､ wife of Esau.
content_old: 13 And these are the sons of Reuel, Nahath and Zerah､ Shammah and Mizzah,— These were the sons of Basemath､ wife of Esau.

content: 14 And these were the sons of Oholibamah､ daughter of Anah､ son of Zibeon､ wife of Esau,—she bare to Esau Jeush, and Jalam, and Korah.
content_old: 14 And these were the sons of Oholibamah､ daughter of Anah､ son of Zibeon､ wife of Esau,—she bare to Esau Jeush, and Jalam, and Korah.

content: 15 These are the chiefs of the sons of Esau:— The sons of Eliphaz､ firstborn of Esau—Chief Teman､ chief Omar, chief Zepho､ chief Kenaz;
content_old: 15 These are the chiefs of the sons of Esau:— The sons of Eliphaz､ firstborn of Esau—Chief Teman､ chief Omar, chief Zepho､ chief Kenaz;

content: 16 chief Korah､ chief Gatam､ chief Amalek. These are the chiefs of Eliphaz､ in the land of Edom, these the sons of Adah.
content_old: 16 chief Korah､ chief Gatam､ chief Amalek. These are the chiefs of Eliphaz､ in the land of Edom, these the sons of Adah.

content: 17 And these are the sons of Reuel､ son of Esau—Chief Nahath､ chief Zerah､ chief Shammah､ chief Mizzah,— These are the chiefs of Reuel､ in the land of Edom, these the sons of Basemath､ wife of Esau.
content_old: 17 And these are the sons of Reuel､ son of Esau—Chief Nahath､ chief Zerah､ chief Shammah､ chief Mizzah,— These are the chiefs of Reuel､ in the land of Edom, these the sons of Basemath､ wife of Esau.

content: 18 And these are the sons of Oholibamah､ wife of Esau, Chief Jeush､ chief Jalam､ chief Korah,— These are the chiefs of Oholibamah､ daughter of Anah､ wife of Esau.
content_old: 18 And these are the sons of Oholibamah､ wife of Esau, Chief Jeush､ chief Jalam､ chief Korah,— These are the chiefs of Oholibamah､ daughter of Anah､ wife of Esau.

content: 19 These are the sons of Esau､ and these their chiefs､—the same is Edom.
content_old: 19 These are the sons of Esau､ and these their chiefs､—the same is Edom.

content: 20 These are the sons of Seir､ the Horite, who were dwelling in the land,— Lotan and Shobal､ and Zibeon and Anah;
content_old: 20 These are the sons of Seir､ the Horite, who were dwelling in the land,— Lotan and Shobal､ and Zibeon and Anah;

content: 21 and Dishon and Ezer､ and Dishan,— These are the chiefs of the Horites､ the sons of Seir, in the land of Edom.
content_old: 21 and Dishon and Ezer､ and Dishan,— These are the chiefs of the Horites､ the sons of Seir, in the land of Edom.

content: 22 Then came the sons of Lotan to be､ Hori and Hemam,— And the sister of Lotan was Timna.
content_old: 22 Then came the sons of Lotan to be､ Hori and Hemam,— And the sister of Lotan was Timna.

content: 23 And these are the sons of Shobal, Alvan and Manahath､ and Ebal,—Shepho､ and Onam.
content_old: 23 And these are the sons of Shobal, Alvan and Manahath､ and Ebal,—Shepho､ and Onam.

content: 24 And these are the sons of Zibeon: Both Aiah and Anah,— The same is the Anah that found the warm springs in the desert, as he fed the asses of Zibeon his father.
content_old: 24 And these are the sons of Zibeon: Both Aiah and Anah,— The same is the Anah that found the warm springs in the desert, as he fed the asses of Zibeon his father.

content: 25 And these are the sons of Anah､ Dishon,—and Oholibamah is daughter of Anah.
content_old: 25 And these are the sons of Anah､ Dishon,—and Oholibamah is daughter of Anah.

content: 26 And these are the sons of Dishon,— Hemdan and Eshban､ and Ithran and Cheran.
content_old: 26 And these are the sons of Dishon,— Hemdan and Eshban､ and Ithran and Cheran.

content: 27 These are the sons of Ezer,— Bilhan and Zaavan､ and Akan.
content_old: 27 These are the sons of Ezer,— Bilhan and Zaavan､ and Akan.

content: 28 These are the sons of Dishan,— Uz and Aran.
content_old: 28 These are the sons of Dishan,— Uz and Aran.

content: 29 These are the chiefs of the Horites,—Chief Lotan､ chief Shobal, chief Zibeon､ chief Anah;
content_old: 29 These are the chiefs of the Horites,—Chief Lotan､ chief Shobal, chief Zibeon､ chief Anah;

content: 30 chief Dishon､ chief Ezer chief Dishan. These are the chiefs of the Horites, after their chiefs､ in the land of Seir.
content_old: 30 chief Dishon､ chief Ezer chief Dishan. These are the chiefs of the Horites, after their chiefs､ in the land of Seir.

content: 31 And these are the kings, who reigned in the land of Edom,—before there reigned a king of the sons of Israel:
content_old: 31 And these are the kings, who reigned in the land of Edom,—before there reigned a king of the sons of Israel:

content: 32 There reigned in Edom, Bela､ son of Beor,—and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
content_old: 32 There reigned in Edom, Bela､ son of Beor,—and the name of his city was Dinhabah.

content: 33 Then died Bela,—and there reigned in his stead, Jobab son of Zerah､ from Bozrah.
content_old: 33 Then died Bela,—and there reigned in his stead, Jobab son of Zerah､ from Bozrah.

content: 34 Then died Jobab,—and there reigned in his stead, Husham､ from the land of the Temanites.
content_old: 34 Then died Jobab,—and there reigned in his stead, Husham､ from the land of the Temanites.

content: 35 Then died Husham,—and there reigned in his stead､ Hadad､ son of Bedad､ who smote Midian in the field of Moab, and the name of his city was Avith.
content_old: 35 Then died Husham,—and there reigned in his stead､ Hadad､ son of Bedad､ who smote Midian in the field of Moab, and the name of his city was Avith.

content: 36 Then died Hadad,—and there reigned in his stead, Samlah､ from Masrekah.
content_old: 36 Then died Hadad,—and there reigned in his stead, Samlah､ from Masrekah.

content: 37 Then died Samlah,—and there reigned in his stead, Shaul､ from Rohoboth of the River.
content_old: 37 Then died Samlah,—and there reigned in his stead, Shaul､ from Rohoboth of the River.

content: 38 Then died Shaul,—and there reigned in his stead, Baal-hanan､ son of Achbor.
content_old: 38 Then died Shaul,—and there reigned in his stead, Baal-hanan､ son of Achbor.

content: 39 Then died Baal-hanan son of Achbor, and there reigned in his stead､ Hadar, and the name of his city was Pau,—and the name of his wife Mehetabel､ daughter of Matred, daughter of Me-zahab.
content_old: 39 Then died Baal-hanan son of Achbor, and there reigned in his stead､ Hadar, and the name of his city was Pau,—and the name of his wife Mehetabel､ daughter of Matred, daughter of Me-zahab.

content: 40 These then are the names of the chiefs of Esau､ after their families, after their places､ by their names,— Chief Timnah､ chief Alvah､ chief Jetheth;
content_old: 40 These then are the names of the chiefs of Esau､ after their families, after their places､ by their names,— Chief Timnah､ chief Alvah､ chief Jetheth;

content: 41 chief Oholibamah､ chief Elah, chief Pinon;
content_old: 41 chief Oholibamah､ chief Elah, chief Pinon;

content: 42 chief Kenaz､ chief Teman､ chief Mibzar;
content_old: 42 chief Kenaz､ chief Teman､ chief Mibzar;

content: 1 So Jacob dwelt in the land of the sojournings of his father,—in the land of Canaan.
content_old: 1 So Jacob dwelt in the land of the sojournings of his father,—in the land of Canaan.

content: 2 These are the generations of Jacob—Joseph when seventeen years old was shepherding with his brethren among the flocks, and he being a youth was with the sons of Bilhah and with the sons of Zilpah､ wives of his father,—so then Joseph brought in the talk about them—something bad､ unto their father.
content_old: 2 These are the generations of Jacob—Joseph when seventeen years old was shepherding with his brethren among the flocks, and he being a youth was with the sons of Bilhah and with the sons of Zilpah､ wives of his father,—so then Joseph brought in the talk about them—something bad､ unto their father.

content: 3 Now Israel loved Joseph more than any of his sons, because he was to him the son of his old age,—and he had made him､ a long tunic.
content_old: 3 Now Israel loved Joseph more than any of his sons, because he was to him the son of his old age,—and he had made him､ a long tunic.

content: 4 So his brethren saw that their father loved him more than any of his brethren, and they hated him,—and could not bid him prosper.
content_old: 4 So his brethren saw that their father loved him more than any of his brethren, and they hated him,—and could not bid him prosper.

content: 5 And Joseph dreamed a dream, and told it to his brethren,—and they went on yet more to hate him.
content_old: 5 And Joseph dreamed a dream, and told it to his brethren,—and they went on yet more to hate him.

content: 6 And he said unto them,— Hear ye､ I pray you､ this dream which I have dreamed:
content_old: 6 And he said unto them,— Hear ye､ I pray you､ this dream which I have dreamed:

content: 7 Lo! then､ we were binding sheaves in the midst of the field, when lo! my sheaf rose up､ yea and took its stand,—and lo! round about came your sheaves, and bowed themselves down､ to my sheaf.
content_old: 7 Lo! then､ we were binding sheaves in the midst of the field, when lo! my sheaf rose up､ yea and took its stand,—and lo! round about came your sheaves, and bowed themselves down､ to my sheaf.

content: 8 And his brethren said to him, Shalt thou reign over us, shalt thou have dominion over us? So they went on yet more to hate him, because of his dreams､ and because of his words.
content_old: 8 And his brethren said to him, Shalt thou reign over us, shalt thou have dominion over us? So they went on yet more to hate him, because of his dreams､ and because of his words.

content: 9 Then dreamed he yet another dream, and related it to his brethren,—and said:— Lo! I have dreamed a dream yet again, Lo! then､ the sun and the moon､ and eleven stars were bowing themselves down to me.
content_old: 9 Then dreamed he yet another dream, and related it to his brethren,—and said:— Lo! I have dreamed a dream yet again, Lo! then､ the sun and the moon､ and eleven stars were bowing themselves down to me.

content: 10 So he related it unto his father､ and unto his brethren,—and his father rebuked him, and said unto him, What is this dream which thou hast dreamed? Shall we indeed come in I､ and thy mother and thy brethren to bow ourselves down to thee､ to the earth?
content_old: 10 So he related it unto his father､ and unto his brethren,—and his father rebuked him, and said unto him, What is this dream which thou hast dreamed? Shall we indeed come in I､ and thy mother and thy brethren to bow ourselves down to thee､ to the earth?

content: 11 Then were his brethren jealous of him,—but his father marked the word.
content_old: 11 Then were his brethren jealous of him,—but his father marked the word.

content: 12 Now his brethren went their way,—to feed their father’s flock in Shechem.
content_old: 12 Now his brethren went their way,—to feed their father’s flock in Shechem.

content: 13 So Israel said unto Joseph— Are not thy brethren feeding the flock in Shechem? Come on! and let me send thee unto them. And he said to him— Behold me!
content_old: 13 So Israel said unto Joseph— Are not thy brethren feeding the flock in Shechem? Come on! and let me send thee unto them. And he said to him— Behold me!

content: 14 So he said to him— Go､ I pray thee､ look after the welfare of thy brethren､ and the welfare of the flock, and bring me back､ word. And he sent him from the vale of Hebron, and he came in towards Shechem.
content_old: 14 So he said to him— Go､ I pray thee､ look after the welfare of thy brethren､ and the welfare of the flock, and bring me back､ word. And he sent him from the vale of Hebron, and he came in towards Shechem.

content: 15 And a man found him, and lo! he was wandering about､ in the field,—so the man asked him､ saying— What seekest thou?
content_old: 15 And a man found him, and lo! he was wandering about､ in the field,—so the man asked him､ saying— What seekest thou?

content: 16 And he said, My brethren am I seeking,—do tell me､ I pray thee､ where they are feeding their flock.
content_old: 16 And he said, My brethren am I seeking,—do tell me､ I pray thee､ where they are feeding their flock.

content: 17 And the man said, They have broken up from hence, for I heard them saying— Let us go our way towards Dothan. So Joseph went after his brethren, and found them､ in Dothan.
content_old: 17 And the man said, They have broken up from hence, for I heard them saying— Let us go our way towards Dothan. So Joseph went after his brethren, and found them､ in Dothan.

content: 18 And they saw him､ afar off,—and ere yet he drew near unto them they conspired against him､ to put him to death.
content_old: 18 And they saw him､ afar off,—and ere yet he drew near unto them they conspired against him､ to put him to death.

content: 19 And they said､ each man unto his brother,— Lo! that master of dreams yonder coming in!
content_old: 19 And they said､ each man unto his brother,— Lo! that master of dreams yonder coming in!

content: 20 Now therefore､ come! let us slay him､ and cast him into one of the pits, and we will say— A cruel beast hath devoured him,— And let us see what will become of his dreams.
content_old: 20 Now therefore､ come! let us slay him､ and cast him into one of the pits, and we will say— A cruel beast hath devoured him,— And let us see what will become of his dreams.

content: 21 And Reuben heard it, and rescued him out of their hand,—and said— Let us not smite him､ so as to take his life!
content_old: 21 And Reuben heard it, and rescued him out of their hand,—and said— Let us not smite him､ so as to take his life!

content: 22 And Reuben said unto them— Do not shed blood! Cast him into this pit､ which is in the wilderness, but put not forth a hand against him! that he might rescue him out of their hand, to restore him unto his father.
content_old: 22 And Reuben said unto them— Do not shed blood! Cast him into this pit､ which is in the wilderness, but put not forth a hand against him! that he might rescue him out of their hand, to restore him unto his father.

content: 23 So it came to pass when Joseph had come in unto his brethren that they stript Joseph of his tunic, the long tunic which was upon him,
content_old: 23 So it came to pass when Joseph had come in unto his brethren that they stript Joseph of his tunic, the long tunic which was upon him,

content: 24 and took him, and cast him into the pit,—but the pit was empty, there was in it no water.
content_old: 24 and took him, and cast him into the pit,—but the pit was empty, there was in it no water.

content: 25 And when they had sat down to eat bread they lifted up their eyes､ and looked, and lo! a caravan of Ishmaelites coming in from Gilead,—and their camels were bearing tragacanth gum､ and balsam and cistus-gum, they were going their way､ to take them down to Egypt.
content_old: 25 And when they had sat down to eat bread they lifted up their eyes､ and looked, and lo! a caravan of Ishmaelites coming in from Gilead,—and their camels were bearing tragacanth gum､ and balsam and cistus-gum, they were going their way､ to take them down to Egypt.

content: 26 So Judah said unto his brethren,— What profit､ that we slay our brother, and conceal his blood?
content_old: 26 So Judah said unto his brethren,— What profit､ that we slay our brother, and conceal his blood?

content: 27 Come､ and let us sell him to the Ishmaelites; but let not our own hand be upon him, for our own brother､ our own flesh is he And his brethren hearkened.
content_old: 27 Come､ and let us sell him to the Ishmaelites; but let not our own hand be upon him, for our own brother､ our own flesh is he And his brethren hearkened.

content: 28 And there passed by certain Midianites､ travelling merchants, so they drew forth and uplifted Joseph out of the pit, and sold Joseph to the Ishmaelites､ for twenty pieces of silver,—and they brought Joseph into Egypt.
content_old: 28 And there passed by certain Midianites､ travelling merchants, so they drew forth and uplifted Joseph out of the pit, and sold Joseph to the Ishmaelites､ for twenty pieces of silver,—and they brought Joseph into Egypt.

content: 29 And Reuben returned unto the pit, and lo! Joseph was not in the pit,—so he rent his clothes;
content_old: 29 And Reuben returned unto the pit, and lo! Joseph was not in the pit,—so he rent his clothes;

content: 30 and returned unto his brethren､ and said,— The lad is not! And I oh where can I go?
content_old: 30 and returned unto his brethren､ and said,— The lad is not! And I oh where can I go?

content: 31 And they took Joseph’s tunic,—and slaughtered a buck of the goats, and dipped the tunic in the blood;
content_old: 31 And they took Joseph’s tunic,—and slaughtered a buck of the goats, and dipped the tunic in the blood;

content: 32 and sent the long tunic and brought it in unto their father, and said— This have we found! Examine､ we pray thee､ whether it is the tunic of thy son､ or not!
content_old: 32 and sent the long tunic and brought it in unto their father, and said— This have we found! Examine､ we pray thee､ whether it is the tunic of thy son､ or not!

content: 33 So he examined it､ and said— The tunic of my son! A cruel beast hath devoured him,—torn in pieces—torn in pieces is Joseph!
content_old: 33 So he examined it､ and said— The tunic of my son! A cruel beast hath devoured him,—torn in pieces—torn in pieces is Joseph!

content: 34 And Jacob rent his garments, and put sack cloth upon his loins,—and mourned over his son many days.
content_old: 34 And Jacob rent his garments, and put sack cloth upon his loins,—and mourned over his son many days.

content: 35 And all his sons and all his daughters rose up to console him､ but he refused to be consoled, and said— Surely I will go down unto my son､ mourning､ to hades! And his father wept for him.
content_old: 35 And all his sons and all his daughters rose up to console him､ but he refused to be consoled, and said— Surely I will go down unto my son､ mourning､ to hades! And his father wept for him.

content: 1 And it came to pass at that time that Judah went down､ away from his brethren,—and turned aside unto a certain Adullamite､ whose name was Hirah.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass at that time that Judah went down､ away from his brethren,—and turned aside unto a certain Adullamite､ whose name was Hirah.

content: 2 And Judah saw there､ a daughter of a certain Canaanite､ whose name was Shua,—and he took her､ and went in unto her;
content_old: 2 And Judah saw there､ a daughter of a certain Canaanite､ whose name was Shua,—and he took her､ and went in unto her;

content: 3 and she conceived､ and bare a son,—and he called his name､ Er.
content_old: 3 and she conceived､ and bare a son,—and he called his name､ Er.

content: 4 And she conceived again､ and bare a son,—and she called his name Onan.
content_old: 4 And she conceived again､ and bare a son,—and she called his name Onan.

content: 5 And she yet again bare a son, and called his name､ Shelah,—and she was at Chezib､ when she bare him.
content_old: 5 And she yet again bare a son, and called his name､ Shelah,—and she was at Chezib､ when she bare him.

content: 6 And Judah took a wife､ for Er his firstborn,—and her name was Tamar.
content_old: 6 And Judah took a wife､ for Er his firstborn,—and her name was Tamar.

content: 7 And it came to pass that Er､ Judah’s firstborn､ was displeasing in the eyes of Yahweh,—so Yahweh put him to death.
content_old: 7 And it came to pass that Er､ Judah’s firstborn､ was displeasing in the eyes of Yahweh,—so Yahweh put him to death.

content: 8 Then said Judah to Onan, Go in unto thy brother’s wife､ and fulfil the duty of a brother-in-law unto her,—and raise up seed､ to thy brother.
content_old: 8 Then said Judah to Onan, Go in unto thy brother’s wife､ and fulfil the duty of a brother-in-law unto her,—and raise up seed､ to thy brother.

content: 9 And Onan knew that the seed would not be his,—and so although he did go in unto his brother’s wife yet made he waste upon the ground, so as not to give seed to his brother.
content_old: 9 And Onan knew that the seed would not be his,—and so although he did go in unto his brother’s wife yet made he waste upon the ground, so as not to give seed to his brother.

content: 10 And it was displeasing in the eyes of Yahweh､ what he had done,—so he put him also to death.
content_old: 10 And it was displeasing in the eyes of Yahweh､ what he had done,—so he put him also to death.

content: 11 Then said Judah to Tamar his daughter-in-law— Remain a widow in the house of thy father､ until Shelah my son grow up. For he said, Lest he also die､ like his brethren. So Tamar went her way, and remained in the house of her father.
content_old: 11 Then said Judah to Tamar his daughter-in-law— Remain a widow in the house of thy father､ until Shelah my son grow up. For he said, Lest he also die､ like his brethren. So Tamar went her way, and remained in the house of her father.

content: 12 And when the days were multiplied then died Shua’s daughter､ Judah’s wife,—and Judah consoled himself､ and went up unto his sheep-shearers he､ and Hirah his friend the Adullamite､ towards Timnah.
content_old: 12 And when the days were multiplied then died Shua’s daughter､ Judah’s wife,—and Judah consoled himself､ and went up unto his sheep-shearers he､ and Hirah his friend the Adullamite､ towards Timnah.

content: 13 And it was told Tamar､ saying,— Lo! thy father-in-law is going up towards Timnah､ to the shearing of his sheep.
content_old: 13 And it was told Tamar､ saying,— Lo! thy father-in-law is going up towards Timnah､ to the shearing of his sheep.

content: 14 So she put off from her the garments of her widowhood､ and covered herself with a veil､ and wrapped herself up, and sat down in the entrance of Enaim, which is by the way towards Timnah,—for she saw that Shelah had grown up, and she had not been given him to wife.
content_old: 14 So she put off from her the garments of her widowhood､ and covered herself with a veil､ and wrapped herself up, and sat down in the entrance of Enaim, which is by the way towards Timnah,—for she saw that Shelah had grown up, and she had not been given him to wife.

content: 15 And Judah､ seeing her､ reckoned her to be an unchaste woman,—for she had covered her face.
content_old: 15 And Judah､ seeing her､ reckoned her to be an unchaste woman,—for she had covered her face.

content: 16 So he turned aside unto her､ by the way､ and said､ Grant it! I pray thee､ let me come in unto thee! For he knew not that she was his daughter-in-law. And she said, What wilt thou give me, if thou shouldst come in unto me?
content_old: 16 So he turned aside unto her､ by the way､ and said､ Grant it! I pray thee､ let me come in unto thee! For he knew not that she was his daughter-in-law. And she said, What wilt thou give me, if thou shouldst come in unto me?

content: 17 And he said, I will send a kid of the goats､ from the flock. And she said, Wilt thou give a pledge､ until thou send it?
content_old: 17 And he said, I will send a kid of the goats､ from the flock. And she said, Wilt thou give a pledge､ until thou send it?

content: 18 And he said— What is the pledge that I shall give thee? And she said— Thy signet-ring､ and thy guard, and thy staff that is in thy hand. So he gave them to her､ and came in unto her､ and she conceived by him.
content_old: 18 And he said— What is the pledge that I shall give thee? And she said— Thy signet-ring､ and thy guard, and thy staff that is in thy hand. So he gave them to her､ and came in unto her､ and she conceived by him.

content: 19 Then she arose and went her way, and put off her veil from her,—and put on the garments of her widowhood.
content_old: 19 Then she arose and went her way, and put off her veil from her,—and put on the garments of her widowhood.

content: 20 And Judah sent the kid of the goats､ by the hand of his friend the Adullamite, to receive the pledge､ at the hand of the woman,—but he found her not.
content_old: 20 And Judah sent the kid of the goats､ by the hand of his friend the Adullamite, to receive the pledge､ at the hand of the woman,—but he found her not.

content: 21 So he asked the men of her place､ saying､ Where is the devotee､ she that was in Enaim､ by the way? And they said,— There hath been､ here､ no devotee.
content_old: 21 So he asked the men of her place､ saying､ Where is the devotee､ she that was in Enaim､ by the way? And they said,— There hath been､ here､ no devotee.

content: 22 Then returned he unto Judah, and said— I found her not,—moreover also､ the men of the place said, There hath been､ here､ no devotee.
