content_old: 22 Then returned he unto Judah, and said— I found her not,—moreover also､ the men of the place said, There hath been､ here､ no devotee.

content: 23 And Judah said: Thou must take it to her, lest we become a contempt,—lo! I sent this kid, and thou hast not found her.
content_old: 23 And Judah said: Thou must take it to her, lest we become a contempt,—lo! I sent this kid, and thou hast not found her.

content: 24 And it came to pass that about three months after it was told Judah､ saying— Tamar thy daughter-in-law hath been guilty of unchastity, moreover also lo! she hath conceived by unchastity. Then said Judah, Bring her forth､ and let her be burnt.
content_old: 24 And it came to pass that about three months after it was told Judah､ saying— Tamar thy daughter-in-law hath been guilty of unchastity, moreover also lo! she hath conceived by unchastity. Then said Judah, Bring her forth､ and let her be burnt.

content: 25 When she was about to be brought forth then she herself sent unto her father-in-law､ saying, By the man to whom these belong have I conceived! And she said— Examine､ I pray thee､ to whom belong the signet-ring､ and the guard､ and the staff—these!
content_old: 25 When she was about to be brought forth then she herself sent unto her father-in-law､ saying, By the man to whom these belong have I conceived! And she said— Examine､ I pray thee､ to whom belong the signet-ring､ and the guard､ and the staff—these!

content: 26 So Judah examined them and said— More righteous than I! forasmuch as I had not given her to Shelah my son. And he knew her again no more.
content_old: 26 So Judah examined them and said— More righteous than I! forasmuch as I had not given her to Shelah my son. And he knew her again no more.

content: 27 And it came to pass at the time of her travail that lo! twins were in her womb.
content_old: 27 And it came to pass at the time of her travail that lo! twins were in her womb.

content: 28 And it came to pass when she was in travail that one put forth a hand,—so the midwife took and bound upon his hand a crimson thread､ saying— This came first!
content_old: 28 And it came to pass when she was in travail that one put forth a hand,—so the midwife took and bound upon his hand a crimson thread､ saying— This came first!

content: 29 And so it was that no sooner had he withdrawn his hand than lo! his brother had come. And she said, Wherefore hast thou made for thyself a breach? So his name was called Perez.
content_old: 29 And so it was that no sooner had he withdrawn his hand than lo! his brother had come. And she said, Wherefore hast thou made for thyself a breach? So his name was called Perez.

content: 1 Now Joseph was taken down to Egypt,—and Potiphar､ courtier of Pharaoh､ chief of the royal executioners､ an Egyptian､ bought him, at the hand of the Ishmaelites, who had brought him down thither.
content_old: 1 Now Joseph was taken down to Egypt,—and Potiphar､ courtier of Pharaoh､ chief of the royal executioners､ an Egyptian､ bought him, at the hand of the Ishmaelites, who had brought him down thither.

content: 2 And it came to pass that Yahweh was with Joseph, so that he became a prosperous man,—and was in the house of his lord the Egyptian.
content_old: 2 And it came to pass that Yahweh was with Joseph, so that he became a prosperous man,—and was in the house of his lord the Egyptian.

content: 3 And his lord saw, that Yahweh was with him､—and that whatsoever he was doing Yahweh was causing to prosper in his hand.
content_old: 3 And his lord saw, that Yahweh was with him､—and that whatsoever he was doing Yahweh was causing to prosper in his hand.

content: 4 So Joseph found favour in his eyes､ and waited upon him,—and he made him overseer over his house, and all that he had gave he into his hand.
content_old: 4 So Joseph found favour in his eyes､ and waited upon him,—and he made him overseer over his house, and all that he had gave he into his hand.

content: 5 And it came to pass from the time that he made him overseer in his house､ and over all that he had that Yahweh blessed the house of the Egyptian､ for Joseph’s sake,—yea it came to pass､ that the blessing of Yahweh was with all that he had, in the house､ and in the field;
content_old: 5 And it came to pass from the time that he made him overseer in his house､ and over all that he had that Yahweh blessed the house of the Egyptian､ for Joseph’s sake,—yea it came to pass､ that the blessing of Yahweh was with all that he had, in the house､ and in the field;

content: 6 so that he left all that he had in the hand of Joseph, and took note with him of nothing , save only the bread which he himself was eating. And so it was､ that Joseph was comely in form and comely in countenance.
content_old: 6 so that he left all that he had in the hand of Joseph, and took note with him of nothing , save only the bread which he himself was eating. And so it was､ that Joseph was comely in form and comely in countenance.

content: 7 And it came to pass after these things that his lord’s wife lifted up her eyes unto Joseph,—and she said— Come! lie with me.
content_old: 7 And it came to pass after these things that his lord’s wife lifted up her eyes unto Joseph,—and she said— Come! lie with me.

content: 8 And he refused､ and said unto his lord’s wife, Lo! my lord taketh no note with me､ as to what is in the house,—but all that pertaineth to him hath he delivered into my hand:
content_old: 8 And he refused､ and said unto his lord’s wife, Lo! my lord taketh no note with me､ as to what is in the house,—but all that pertaineth to him hath he delivered into my hand:

content: 9 There is no one greater in this house than I, neither hath he withheld from me､ anything, save only thyself､ in that thou art his wife,—how､ then､ could I do this great wickedness, and sin against God?
content_old: 9 There is no one greater in this house than I, neither hath he withheld from me､ anything, save only thyself､ in that thou art his wife,—how､ then､ could I do this great wickedness, and sin against God?

content: 10 And it came to pass, that although she spake unto Joseph day after day yet hearkened he not unto her､ to lie beside her､ to be with her.
content_old: 10 And it came to pass, that although she spake unto Joseph day after day yet hearkened he not unto her､ to lie beside her､ to be with her.

content: 11 And it came to pass, when, on a certain day, he went into the house to attend to his business,—and there was no man､ of the household､ there､ in the house
content_old: 11 And it came to pass, when, on a certain day, he went into the house to attend to his business,—and there was no man､ of the household､ there､ in the house

content: 12 that she caught him by his garment､ saying— Come! lie with me. Then left he his garment in her hand, and fled､ and gat forth outside.
content_old: 12 that she caught him by his garment､ saying— Come! lie with me. Then left he his garment in her hand, and fled､ and gat forth outside.

content: 13 And it came to pass when she saw that he had left his garment in her hand,—and fled forth outside
content_old: 13 And it came to pass when she saw that he had left his garment in her hand,—and fled forth outside

content: 14 that she cried out to the men of her house､ and spake to them saying, Look ye! he hath brought in to us､ a Hebrew man to insult us,— He came in unto me､ to lie with me, so I cried out with a loud voice.
content_old: 14 that she cried out to the men of her house､ and spake to them saying, Look ye! he hath brought in to us､ a Hebrew man to insult us,— He came in unto me､ to lie with me, so I cried out with a loud voice.

content: 15 And it came to pass when he heard that I lifted high my voice､ and cried out then left he his garment beside me, and fled､ and gat forth outside.
content_old: 15 And it came to pass when he heard that I lifted high my voice､ and cried out then left he his garment beside me, and fled､ and gat forth outside.

content: 16 So she laid by his garment､ beside her,—until his lord should come into his house.
content_old: 16 So she laid by his garment､ beside her,—until his lord should come into his house.

content: 17 Then spake she unto him, according to these words､ saying,— He hath been in unto me—the Hebrew servant whom thou didst bring in to us—to insult me.
content_old: 17 Then spake she unto him, according to these words､ saying,— He hath been in unto me—the Hebrew servant whom thou didst bring in to us—to insult me.

content: 18 And it came to pass when I lifted high my voice､ and cried out then left he his garment beside me､ and fled outside.
content_old: 18 And it came to pass when I lifted high my voice､ and cried out then left he his garment beside me､ and fled outside.

content: 19 And it came to pass when his lord heard the words of his wife､ which she spake unto him､ saying, According to these words hath thy servant done to me Then was kindled his anger.
content_old: 19 And it came to pass when his lord heard the words of his wife､ which she spake unto him､ saying, According to these words hath thy servant done to me Then was kindled his anger.

content: 20 So Joseph’s lord took him､ and delivered him up to the prison, the place where the prisoners of the king were imprisoned,—so he was there､ in the prison.
content_old: 20 So Joseph’s lord took him､ and delivered him up to the prison, the place where the prisoners of the king were imprisoned,—so he was there､ in the prison.

content: 21 And it came to pass､ that Yahweh was with Joseph, and extended unto him lovingkindness,—and gave him his favour in the eyes of the chief of the prison.
content_old: 21 And it came to pass､ that Yahweh was with Joseph, and extended unto him lovingkindness,—and gave him his favour in the eyes of the chief of the prison.

content: 22 So the chief of the prison delivered up､ into Joseph’s hand､ all the prisoners who were in the prison,—and of all that was doing there he was the doer.
content_old: 22 So the chief of the prison delivered up､ into Joseph’s hand､ all the prisoners who were in the prison,—and of all that was doing there he was the doer.

content: 1 And it came to pass after these things that the butler of the king of Egypt､ and the baker､ had sinned against their lord､ the king of Egypt.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass after these things that the butler of the king of Egypt､ and the baker､ had sinned against their lord､ the king of Egypt.

content: 2 Then fell the wroth of Pharaoh upon his two courtiers,—upon the chief of the butlers, and upon the chief of the bakers;
content_old: 2 Then fell the wroth of Pharaoh upon his two courtiers,—upon the chief of the butlers, and upon the chief of the bakers;

content: 3 so he delivered them up into the ward of the house of the chief of the royal executioners､ into the prison,—the place where Joseph was imprisoned.
content_old: 3 so he delivered them up into the ward of the house of the chief of the royal executioners､ into the prison,—the place where Joseph was imprisoned.

content: 4 And the chief of the royal executioners charged Joseph with them､ and he waited upon them,—and they were some days in ward.
content_old: 4 And the chief of the royal executioners charged Joseph with them､ and he waited upon them,—and they were some days in ward.

content: 5 And they dreamed a dream—they two､ each man his dream､ in one night, each man according to the interpretation of his dream,—the butler and the baker､ who belonged to the king of Egypt, who were imprisoned in the prison.
content_old: 5 And they dreamed a dream—they two､ each man his dream､ in one night, each man according to the interpretation of his dream,—the butler and the baker､ who belonged to the king of Egypt, who were imprisoned in the prison.

content: 6 And Joseph came in unto them､ in the morning,—and looked at them, and lo! they were sad.
content_old: 6 And Joseph came in unto them､ in the morning,—and looked at them, and lo! they were sad.

content: 7 So he asked Pharaoh’s courtiers､ who were with him in the ward of his lord’s house､ saying,— Why are your faces troubled to-day?
content_old: 7 So he asked Pharaoh’s courtiers､ who were with him in the ward of his lord’s house､ saying,— Why are your faces troubled to-day?

content: 8 And they said unto him, A dream have we dreamed, but there is none to interpret it. Then said Joseph unto them— Is it not unto God that interpretations belong? Relate it､ I pray you､ to me.
content_old: 8 And they said unto him, A dream have we dreamed, but there is none to interpret it. Then said Joseph unto them— Is it not unto God that interpretations belong? Relate it､ I pray you､ to me.

content: 9 And the chief of the butlers related his dream to Joseph,—and said to him, In my dream then lo! a vine before me;
content_old: 9 And the chief of the butlers related his dream to Joseph,—and said to him, In my dream then lo! a vine before me;

content: 10 and in the vine three shoots,—and the same､ at sprouting time had shot up her blossom, and her clusters had brought to perfection ripe grapes.
content_old: 10 and in the vine three shoots,—and the same､ at sprouting time had shot up her blossom, and her clusters had brought to perfection ripe grapes.

content: 11 Now the cup of Pharaoh being in my hand I took the ripe grapes､ and pressed them out into the cup of Pharaoh, and set the cup upon Pharaoh’s palm.
content_old: 11 Now the cup of Pharaoh being in my hand I took the ripe grapes､ and pressed them out into the cup of Pharaoh, and set the cup upon Pharaoh’s palm.

content: 12 And Joseph said to him, This is the interpretation thereof,— The three shoots are three days:
content_old: 12 And Joseph said to him, This is the interpretation thereof,— The three shoots are three days:

content: 13 In three days more will Pharaoh lift up thy head, and restore thee to thine office, and thou shalt set the cup of Pharaoh in his hand, according to the former custom､ when thou wast his butler.
content_old: 13 In three days more will Pharaoh lift up thy head, and restore thee to thine office, and thou shalt set the cup of Pharaoh in his hand, according to the former custom､ when thou wast his butler.

content: 14 But if thou remember how I was with thee､ when it shall go well with thee then wilt thou､ I pray thee､ do me a loving-kindness,—and make mention of me unto Pharaoh, and bring me forth out of this house;
content_old: 14 But if thou remember how I was with thee､ when it shall go well with thee then wilt thou､ I pray thee､ do me a loving-kindness,—and make mention of me unto Pharaoh, and bring me forth out of this house;

content: 15 For I was stolen out of the land of the Hebrews,—and even here had I done nothing､ that they should have put me in the dungeon.
content_old: 15 For I was stolen out of the land of the Hebrews,—and even here had I done nothing､ that they should have put me in the dungeon.

content: 16 Then the chief of the bakers､ seeing that he had well interpreted､ said unto Joseph, I too was in my dream, when lo! three wicker baskets of fine bread were on my head;
content_old: 16 Then the chief of the bakers､ seeing that he had well interpreted､ said unto Joseph, I too was in my dream, when lo! three wicker baskets of fine bread were on my head;

content: 17 and in the uppermost basket was some of every kind of food for Pharaoh､ that a baker could make,—but the birds kept eating them out of the basket from off my head.
content_old: 17 and in the uppermost basket was some of every kind of food for Pharaoh､ that a baker could make,—but the birds kept eating them out of the basket from off my head.

content: 18 And Joseph responded､ and said, This is the interpretation thereof,— The three baskets are threedays:
content_old: 18 And Joseph responded､ and said, This is the interpretation thereof,— The three baskets are threedays:

content: 19 In three days more will Pharaoh lift up thy head from off thee, and hang thee upon a tree,—and the birds shall eat thy flesh from off thee.
content_old: 19 In three days more will Pharaoh lift up thy head from off thee, and hang thee upon a tree,—and the birds shall eat thy flesh from off thee.

content: 20 And it came to pass on the third day—the birthday of Pharaoh that he made a banquet for all his servants,—and uplifted the head of the chief of the butlers､ and the head of the chief of the bakers､ in the midst of his servants;
content_old: 20 And it came to pass on the third day—the birthday of Pharaoh that he made a banquet for all his servants,—and uplifted the head of the chief of the butlers､ and the head of the chief of the bakers､ in the midst of his servants;

content: 21 and restored the chief of the butlers to his butlership,—so that he set the cup upon the palm of Pharaoh;
content_old: 21 and restored the chief of the butlers to his butlership,—so that he set the cup upon the palm of Pharaoh;

content: 22 but the chief of the bakers he hanged,—as Joseph had interpreted unto them.
content_old: 22 but the chief of the bakers he hanged,—as Joseph had interpreted unto them.

content: 1 And it came to pass at the end of two years of days that Pharaoh was dreaming, when lo! he was standing by the river (Nile);
content_old: 1 And it came to pass at the end of two years of days that Pharaoh was dreaming, when lo! he was standing by the river (Nile);

content: 2 and lo! from the river were coming up seven heifers, comely in appearance､ and fat in flesh,—and they fed among the rushes.
content_old: 2 and lo! from the river were coming up seven heifers, comely in appearance､ and fat in flesh,—and they fed among the rushes.

content: 3 And lo! seven heifers more coming up after them､ out of the river, uncomely in appearance､ and lean in flesh,—and they came and stood beside the heifers､ by the lip of the river.
content_old: 3 And lo! seven heifers more coming up after them､ out of the river, uncomely in appearance､ and lean in flesh,—and they came and stood beside the heifers､ by the lip of the river.

content: 4 Then did the heifers that were uncomely in appearance､ and lean in flesh eat up the seven heifers that were comely in appearance､ and fat. So Pharaoh awoke.
content_old: 4 Then did the heifers that were uncomely in appearance､ and lean in flesh eat up the seven heifers that were comely in appearance､ and fat. So Pharaoh awoke.

content: 5 And he fell asleep, and dreamed a second time,—when lo! seven ears coming up on one stalk､ fat and good;
content_old: 5 And he fell asleep, and dreamed a second time,—when lo! seven ears coming up on one stalk､ fat and good;

content: 6 and lo! seven ears､ lean and shrivelled by an east wind､ coming up after them.
content_old: 6 and lo! seven ears､ lean and shrivelled by an east wind､ coming up after them.

content: 7 Then did the lean ears swallow up the seven fat and full ears. So Pharaoh awoke､ and lo! it was a dream.
content_old: 7 Then did the lean ears swallow up the seven fat and full ears. So Pharaoh awoke､ and lo! it was a dream.

content: 8 And it came to pass in the morning that his spirit became restless, so he sent and called for all the sacred scribes of Egypt､ and all her wise men,—and Pharaoh related to them his dreams, but there was no one that could interpret them､ to Pharaoh.
content_old: 8 And it came to pass in the morning that his spirit became restless, so he sent and called for all the sacred scribes of Egypt､ and all her wise men,—and Pharaoh related to them his dreams, but there was no one that could interpret them､ to Pharaoh.

content: 9 Then spake the chief of the butlers with Pharaoh､ saying,— My faults would I mention this day.
content_old: 9 Then spake the chief of the butlers with Pharaoh､ saying,— My faults would I mention this day.

content: 10 Pharaoh was wroth with his servants,—and put them in the ward of the house of the chief of the royal executioners, me, and the chief of the bakers.
content_old: 10 Pharaoh was wroth with his servants,—and put them in the ward of the house of the chief of the royal executioners, me, and the chief of the bakers.

content: 11 Then must we needs dream､ a dream in one night､ I and he,—each man according to the interpretation of his dream, did we dream.
content_old: 11 Then must we needs dream､ a dream in one night､ I and he,—each man according to the interpretation of his dream, did we dream.

content: 12 And there with us､ was a young man､ a Hebrew､ servant to the chief of the royal executioners, and we related to him､ and he interpreted to us､ our dreams,—to each man—according to his dream did he interpret.
content_old: 12 And there with us､ was a young man､ a Hebrew､ servant to the chief of the royal executioners, and we related to him､ and he interpreted to us､ our dreams,—to each man—according to his dream did he interpret.

content: 13 And it came to pass as he interpreted to us so it happened,—､ me he restored to mine office､ but him he hanged.
content_old: 13 And it came to pass as he interpreted to us so it happened,—､ me he restored to mine office､ but him he hanged.

content: 14 Then sent Pharaoh and summoned Joseph, and they hastened him out of the dungeon,—so he shaved himself､ and changed his garments, and came in unto Pharaoh.
content_old: 14 Then sent Pharaoh and summoned Joseph, and they hastened him out of the dungeon,—so he shaved himself､ and changed his garments, and came in unto Pharaoh.

content: 15 And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, A dream have I dreamed, but none can interpret it,—but I have heard say concerning thee, that on hearing a dream thou canst interpret it.
content_old: 15 And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, A dream have I dreamed, but none can interpret it,—but I have heard say concerning thee, that on hearing a dream thou canst interpret it.

content: 16 And Joseph answered Pharaoh､ saying, Not to me doth it pertain! May God grant in answer､ the prosperity of Pharaoh!
content_old: 16 And Joseph answered Pharaoh､ saying, Not to me doth it pertain! May God grant in answer､ the prosperity of Pharaoh!

content: 17 Then spake Pharaoh unto Joseph,— In my dream there was I standing on the lip of the river;
content_old: 17 Then spake Pharaoh unto Joseph,— In my dream there was I standing on the lip of the river;

content: 18 When lo! out of the river were coming up seven heifers, fat in flesh､ and comely in form,—and they fed among the rushes.
content_old: 18 When lo! out of the river were coming up seven heifers, fat in flesh､ and comely in form,—and they fed among the rushes.

content: 19 And lo! seven other heifers coming up after them, poor､ and very uncomely in form､ and lean in flesh,—I had never seen such､ in all the land of Egypt､ for uncomeliness.
content_old: 19 And lo! seven other heifers coming up after them, poor､ and very uncomely in form､ and lean in flesh,—I had never seen such､ in all the land of Egypt､ for uncomeliness.

content: 20 Then did the lean and uncomely heifers eat up the first seven､ fat heifers;
content_old: 20 Then did the lean and uncomely heifers eat up the first seven､ fat heifers;

content: 21 and they passed into their stomach､ yet could it not be known that they had passed into them, their appearance being uncomely､ as at the beginning. So I awoke.
content_old: 21 and they passed into their stomach､ yet could it not be known that they had passed into them, their appearance being uncomely､ as at the beginning. So I awoke.

content: 22 Then looked I in my dream,— And lo! seven ears coming up on one stalk､ full and good;
content_old: 22 Then looked I in my dream,— And lo! seven ears coming up on one stalk､ full and good;

content: 23 And lo! seven ears, withered､ lean､ shrivelled by an east wind growing up after them.
content_old: 23 And lo! seven ears, withered､ lean､ shrivelled by an east wind growing up after them.

content: 24 Then did the lean ears swallow up the seven good ears. So I told these things unto the sacred scribes, but there was none that could explain them to me.
content_old: 24 Then did the lean ears swallow up the seven good ears. So I told these things unto the sacred scribes, but there was none that could explain them to me.

content: 25 Then said Joseph unto Pharaoh, The dream of Pharaoh is one. What God is about to do hath he announced to Pharaoh.
content_old: 25 Then said Joseph unto Pharaoh, The dream of Pharaoh is one. What God is about to do hath he announced to Pharaoh.

content: 26 The seven good heifers are seven years, and the seven good ears are seven years,—the dream is one.
content_old: 26 The seven good heifers are seven years, and the seven good ears are seven years,—the dream is one.

content: 27 And the seven lean and uncomely heifers that were coming up after them are seven years, and the seven lean ears, shrivelled by an east wind, will turn out to be—seven years of famine.
content_old: 27 And the seven lean and uncomely heifers that were coming up after them are seven years, and the seven lean ears, shrivelled by an east wind, will turn out to be—seven years of famine.

content: 28 The very word that I spake unto Pharaoh what God is about to do hath he showed unto Pharaoh.
content_old: 28 The very word that I spake unto Pharaoh what God is about to do hath he showed unto Pharaoh.

content: 29 Lo! seven years coming in,—of great plenty､ in all the land of Egypt.
content_old: 29 Lo! seven years coming in,—of great plenty､ in all the land of Egypt.

content: 30 Then shall arise seven years of famine､ after them, so shall be forgotten all the plenty in the land of Egypt,—and the famine shall consume the land;
content_old: 30 Then shall arise seven years of famine､ after them, so shall be forgotten all the plenty in the land of Egypt,—and the famine shall consume the land;

content: 31 neither shall the plenty in the land be discernible, because of that famine coming after,—for it shall be very severe.
content_old: 31 neither shall the plenty in the land be discernible, because of that famine coming after,—for it shall be very severe.

content: 32 And for that there was a repeating of the dream unto Pharaoh twice it is because the thing is established from God, and God is hastening to do it.
content_old: 32 And for that there was a repeating of the dream unto Pharaoh twice it is because the thing is established from God, and God is hastening to do it.

content: 33 Now､ therefore､ let Pharaoh look out a man､ discreet and wise,—and set him over the land of Egypt.
content_old: 33 Now､ therefore､ let Pharaoh look out a man､ discreet and wise,—and set him over the land of Egypt.

content: 34 Let Pharaoh do this, that he may appoint overseers over the land,—so shall he take up a fifth of the land of Egypt, during the seven years of plenty.
content_old: 34 Let Pharaoh do this, that he may appoint overseers over the land,—so shall he take up a fifth of the land of Egypt, during the seven years of plenty.

content: 35 And let them gather up all the food of these seven good years that are coming in,—and let them heap up corn under the hand of Pharaoh､ as food in cities､ so shall they keep it.
content_old: 35 And let them gather up all the food of these seven good years that are coming in,—and let them heap up corn under the hand of Pharaoh､ as food in cities､ so shall they keep it.

content: 36 So shall the food become a store for the land, for the seven years of famine��� which shall come about in the land of Egypt,— and the land shall not be cut off in the famine.
content_old: 36 So shall the food become a store for the land, for the seven years of famine��� which shall come about in the land of Egypt,— and the land shall not be cut off in the famine.

content: 37 And the thing was good in the eyes of Pharaoh,—and in the eyes of all his servants;
content_old: 37 And the thing was good in the eyes of Pharaoh,—and in the eyes of all his servants;

content: 38 and Pharaoh said unto his servants,— Can we find such a one, a man in whom is the Spirit of God?
content_old: 38 and Pharaoh said unto his servants,— Can we find such a one, a man in whom is the Spirit of God?

content: 39 So Pharaoh said unto Joseph, After God hath made known unto thee all this there is no one discreet and wise like thee.
content_old: 39 So Pharaoh said unto Joseph, After God hath made known unto thee all this there is no one discreet and wise like thee.

content: 40 Thou shalt be over my house, and on thy mouth shall all my people kiss,—only as to the throne will I be greater than thou.
content_old: 40 Thou shalt be over my house, and on thy mouth shall all my people kiss,—only as to the throne will I be greater than thou.

content: 41 And Pharaoh said unto Joseph,— See､ I have set thee over all the land of Egypt.
content_old: 41 And Pharaoh said unto Joseph,— See､ I have set thee over all the land of Egypt.

content: 42 So Pharaoh took his ring from off his hand, and put it upon Joseph’s hand,—and clothed him in garments of fine linen, and put the chain of gold upon his neck;
content_old: 42 So Pharaoh took his ring from off his hand, and put it upon Joseph’s hand,—and clothed him in garments of fine linen, and put the chain of gold upon his neck;

content: 43 and made him ride in the second chariot which belonged to him, and they cried out before him､ Bow the knee! thus setting him over all the land of Egypt.
content_old: 43 and made him ride in the second chariot which belonged to him, and they cried out before him､ Bow the knee! thus setting him over all the land of Egypt.

content: 44 And Pharaoh said unto Joseph､ I am Pharaoh, Without thee therefore､ shall no man raise his hand or his foot､ in all the land of Egypt.
content_old: 44 And Pharaoh said unto Joseph､ I am Pharaoh, Without thee therefore､ shall no man raise his hand or his foot､ in all the land of Egypt.

content: 45 And Pharaoh called Joseph’s name Zaphenath-paneah, and gave him Asenath､ daughter of Poti-phera priest of On､ to wife,—and Joseph went forth over the land of Egypt.
content_old: 45 And Pharaoh called Joseph’s name Zaphenath-paneah, and gave him Asenath､ daughter of Poti-phera priest of On､ to wife,—and Joseph went forth over the land of Egypt.

content: 46 Now Joseph was thirty years old, when he took his station､ before Pharaoh king of Egypt. So Joseph went forth from before Pharaoh, and passed along through all the land of Egypt.
content_old: 46 Now Joseph was thirty years old, when he took his station､ before Pharaoh king of Egypt. So Joseph went forth from before Pharaoh, and passed along through all the land of Egypt.

content: 47 And the land produced, in the seven years of plenty by handfuls.
content_old: 47 And the land produced, in the seven years of plenty by handfuls.

content: 48 And he gathered up all the food of the seven years in which there was plenty in the land of Egypt, and laid up food in cities,—the food of the fields of the city､ which were round about it laid he up within it.
content_old: 48 And he gathered up all the food of the seven years in which there was plenty in the land of Egypt, and laid up food in cities,—the food of the fields of the city､ which were round about it laid he up within it.

content: 49 Thus did Joseph heap up corn like the sand of the sea､ making it exceeding abundant,—until one hath left off reckoning､ because it cannot be reckoned.
content_old: 49 Thus did Joseph heap up corn like the sand of the sea､ making it exceeding abundant,—until one hath left off reckoning､ because it cannot be reckoned.

content: 50 Now to Joseph were born､ two sons, ere yet came in the year of famine,—whom Asenath､ daughter of Poti-phera priest of On､ bare to him.
content_old: 50 Now to Joseph were born､ two sons, ere yet came in the year of famine,—whom Asenath､ daughter of Poti-phera priest of On､ bare to him.

content: 51 And Joseph called the name of the firstborn Manasseh,— For God hath made me forget all my trouble, and all the house of my father.
content_old: 51 And Joseph called the name of the firstborn Manasseh,— For God hath made me forget all my trouble, and all the house of my father.

content: 52 And the name of the second called he､ Ephraim,— For God hath made me fruitful in the land of my humiliation.
content_old: 52 And the name of the second called he､ Ephraim,— For God hath made me fruitful in the land of my humiliation.

content: 53 Then came to an end the seven years of the plenty,—which was in the land of Egypt;
content_old: 53 Then came to an end the seven years of the plenty,—which was in the land of Egypt;

content: 54 and the seven years of famine began to come in, according as Joseph had said,—and it came to pass that there was a famine in all the lands, but in all the land of Egypt there was bread.
content_old: 54 and the seven years of famine began to come in, according as Joseph had said,—and it came to pass that there was a famine in all the lands, but in all the land of Egypt there was bread.

content: 55 Yet was famine felt in all the land of Egypt, and the people made outcry unto Pharaoh､ for bread,—and Pharaoh said to all Egypt,— Go ye unto Joseph, that which he saith to you shall ye do.
content_old: 55 Yet was famine felt in all the land of Egypt, and the people made outcry unto Pharaoh､ for bread,—and Pharaoh said to all Egypt,— Go ye unto Joseph, that which he saith to you shall ye do.

content: 56 Now the famine was over all the face of the land,—so Joseph opened all places wherein it was､ and sold corn to the Egyptians, and the famine laid fast hold of the land of Egypt.
content_old: 56 Now the famine was over all the face of the land,—so Joseph opened all places wherein it was､ and sold corn to the Egyptians, and the famine laid fast hold of the land of Egypt.

content: 1 Then saw Jacob that there was corn､ in Egypt,—and Jacob said to his sons, Wherefore look ye one at another?
content_old: 1 Then saw Jacob that there was corn､ in Egypt,—and Jacob said to his sons, Wherefore look ye one at another?

content: 2 And he said, Lo! I have heard that there is corn､ in Egypt,— Go down thither､ and buy corn for us from thence, that we may live､ and not die.
content_old: 2 And he said, Lo! I have heard that there is corn､ in Egypt,— Go down thither､ and buy corn for us from thence, that we may live､ and not die.

content: 3 So Joseph’s ten brethren went down,—to buy corn from the Egyptians;
content_old: 3 So Joseph’s ten brethren went down,—to buy corn from the Egyptians;

content: 4 but Benjamin､ Joseph’s own brother Jacob sent not with his brethren,—for he said, Lest there befall him any mischief.
content_old: 4 but Benjamin､ Joseph’s own brother Jacob sent not with his brethren,—for he said, Lest there befall him any mischief.

content: 5 Thus came in the sons of Israel, to buy corn､ in the midst of them that came,—for the famine was in the land of Canaan.
content_old: 5 Thus came in the sons of Israel, to buy corn､ in the midst of them that came,—for the famine was in the land of Canaan.

content: 6 Now Joseph—he it was､ that was in power over the land, he it was､ that was selling corn to all the people of the land,—so Joseph’s brethren came in, and bowed themselves down to him､ with their faces to the earth.
content_old: 6 Now Joseph—he it was､ that was in power over the land, he it was､ that was selling corn to all the people of the land,—so Joseph’s brethren came in, and bowed themselves down to him､ with their faces to the earth.

content: 7 And Joseph beheld his brethren､ and recognised them,—and made himself a stranger unto them､ and spake with them harsh things､ and said unto them— Whence have ye come in? And they said, From the land of Canaan､ to buy food.
content_old: 7 And Joseph beheld his brethren､ and recognised them,—and made himself a stranger unto them､ and spake with them harsh things､ and said unto them— Whence have ye come in? And they said, From the land of Canaan､ to buy food.

content: 8 And Joseph recognised his brethren,—whereas they recognised him not.
content_old: 8 And Joseph recognised his brethren,—whereas they recognised him not.

content: 9 And Joseph remembered the dreams which he had dreamed regarding them,—so he said unto them— Spies are ye! to see the nakedness of the land have ye come in!
content_old: 9 And Joseph remembered the dreams which he had dreamed regarding them,—so he said unto them— Spies are ye! to see the nakedness of the land have ye come in!

content: 10 And they said unto him､ Nay､ my lord,—but thy servants are come to buy food.
content_old: 10 And they said unto him､ Nay､ my lord,—but thy servants are come to buy food.

content: 11 All of us are sons of one man,—honest men are we: thy servants are not spies.
content_old: 11 All of us are sons of one man,—honest men are we: thy servants are not spies.

content: 12 And he said unto him,— Nay! but the nakedness of the land are ye come in to see.
content_old: 12 And he said unto him,— Nay! but the nakedness of the land are ye come in to see.

content: 13 And they said: We thy twelve servants are brethren､ sons of one man､ in the land of Canaan,—and lo! the youngest is with our father､ this day, and the one is not!
content_old: 13 And they said: We thy twelve servants are brethren､ sons of one man､ in the land of Canaan,—and lo! the youngest is with our father､ this day, and the one is not!

content: 14 And Joseph said unto them,— The very thing that I spake unto you､ saying—Spies are ye.
content_old: 14 And Joseph said unto them,— The very thing that I spake unto you､ saying—Spies are ye.

content: 15 Hereby shall ye be proved,— By the life of Pharaoh ye shall not go forth from hence, save only by the coming in of your youngest brother､ hither.
content_old: 15 Hereby shall ye be proved,— By the life of Pharaoh ye shall not go forth from hence, save only by the coming in of your youngest brother､ hither.

content: 16 Send—from among you—one､ that he may fetch your brother, but be ye held as prisoners, that your words may be proved､ whether truth is with you,—and if not by the life of Pharaoh surely spies ye are.
content_old: 16 Send—from among you—one､ that he may fetch your brother, but be ye held as prisoners, that your words may be proved､ whether truth is with you,—and if not by the life of Pharaoh surely spies ye are.

content: 17 So he drew them all together into ward, for three days.
content_old: 17 So he drew them all together into ward, for three days.

content: 18 And Joseph said unto them､ on the third day, This do､ and live,—God himself do I revere.
content_old: 18 And Joseph said unto them､ on the third day, This do､ and live,—God himself do I revere.

content: 19 If ye are honest men one brother of you shall be kept as a prisoner in your house of ward,—but ye､ go､ take in corn for the famine of your houses;
content_old: 19 If ye are honest men one brother of you shall be kept as a prisoner in your house of ward,—but ye､ go､ take in corn for the famine of your houses;

content: 20 and your youngest brother shall ye bring in unto me, that your words may be confirmed､ and ye die not. And they did so.
content_old: 20 and your youngest brother shall ye bring in unto me, that your words may be confirmed､ and ye die not. And they did so.

content: 21 And they said､ each man unto his brother— Verily guilty we are､ respecting our brother, in that we saw the distress of his soul､ when he appealed unto us for favour､ and we hearkened not,—therefore hath come in unto us this distress.
content_old: 21 And they said､ each man unto his brother— Verily guilty we are､ respecting our brother, in that we saw the distress of his soul､ when he appealed unto us for favour､ and we hearkened not,—therefore hath come in unto us this distress.

content: 22 And Reuben responded to them､ saying— Spake I not unto you､ saying, Do not sin against the child! And ye hearkened not? His very blood therefore､ lo! it is required.
content_old: 22 And Reuben responded to them､ saying— Spake I not unto you､ saying, Do not sin against the child! And ye hearkened not? His very blood therefore､ lo! it is required.

content: 23 But they knew not､ that Joseph was hearkening,—for the interpreter was between them.
content_old: 23 But they knew not､ that Joseph was hearkening,—for the interpreter was between them.

content: 24 So he turned away from them､ and wept,—then came back unto them､ and spake unto them, and took away from them､ Simeon, and bound him prisoner before their eyes.
content_old: 24 So he turned away from them､ and wept,—then came back unto them､ and spake unto them, and took away from them､ Simeon, and bound him prisoner before their eyes.

content: 25 Then commanded Joseph that their bags should be filled with corn, and their silver be returned､ each man’s into his sack, and provision be given､ for the journey,—and it was done to them thus.
content_old: 25 Then commanded Joseph that their bags should be filled with corn, and their silver be returned､ each man’s into his sack, and provision be given､ for the journey,—and it was done to them thus.

content: 26 So they lifted up their corn on their asses,—and went their way､ from thence.
content_old: 26 So they lifted up their corn on their asses,—and went their way､ from thence.

content: 27 And the first opened his sack､ to give fodder to his ass､ at the inn,—and beheld his silver, yea there it was､ in the mouth of his sack!
content_old: 27 And the first opened his sack､ to give fodder to his ass､ at the inn,—and beheld his silver, yea there it was､ in the mouth of his sack!

content: 28 So he said unto his brethren､ My silver hath been returned, yea verily､ there it is､ in my sack! Then went forth their heart､ and they turned trembling—each man unto his brother､ saying, What is this that God hath done to us?
content_old: 28 So he said unto his brethren､ My silver hath been returned, yea verily､ there it is､ in my sack! Then went forth their heart､ and they turned trembling—each man unto his brother､ saying, What is this that God hath done to us?

content: 29 So they came in unto Jacob their father､ to the land of Canaan,—and told him all that had befallen them､ saying:
content_old: 29 So they came in unto Jacob their father､ to the land of Canaan,—and told him all that had befallen them､ saying:

content: 30 The man that is lord of the land､ spake unto us harsh things,—and then delivered us up､ as spies of the land.
content_old: 30 The man that is lord of the land､ spake unto us harsh things,—and then delivered us up､ as spies of the land.

content: 31 And we said unto him､ Honest men are we,—we are not spies!
content_old: 31 And we said unto him､ Honest men are we,—we are not spies!

content: 32 Twelve brethren are we､ sons of our father,—the one is not, and the youngest is this day with our father､ in the land of Canaan.
content_old: 32 Twelve brethren are we､ sons of our father,—the one is not, and the youngest is this day with our father､ in the land of Canaan.

content: 33 Then said the man､ the lord of the land､ unto us, Hereby shall I get to know that honest men ye are,— One brother of you leave ye remaining with me, and corn for the famine of your houses take ye and go your way;
content_old: 33 Then said the man､ the lord of the land､ unto us, Hereby shall I get to know that honest men ye are,— One brother of you leave ye remaining with me, and corn for the famine of your houses take ye and go your way;

content: 34 And bring ye in your youngest brother unto me, So must I get to know that ye are not spies､ but are honest men: Your brother will I give up to you, and with the land shall ye traffic.
content_old: 34 And bring ye in your youngest brother unto me, So must I get to know that ye are not spies､ but are honest men: Your brother will I give up to you, and with the land shall ye traffic.

content: 35 And it came to pass when they were emptying their sacks､ then lo! each man’s bundle of silver was in his sack,—and when they beheld their bundles of silver—they and their father they were afraid.
content_old: 35 And it came to pass when they were emptying their sacks､ then lo! each man’s bundle of silver was in his sack,—and when they beheld their bundles of silver—they and their father they were afraid.

content: 36 And Jacob their father said unto them, Me have ye bereaved,— Joseph is not､ and Simeon is not, and Benjamin ye would take! Against me have happened all these things.
content_old: 36 And Jacob their father said unto them, Me have ye bereaved,— Joseph is not､ and Simeon is not, and Benjamin ye would take! Against me have happened all these things.

content: 37 Then spake Reuben unto his father､ saying, My two sons shalt thou put to death, if I bring him not unto thee,— Come､ give him up upon my hand, and I will restore him unto thee.
content_old: 37 Then spake Reuben unto his father､ saying, My two sons shalt thou put to death, if I bring him not unto thee,— Come､ give him up upon my hand, and I will restore him unto thee.

content: 1 But the famine was severe in the land.
content_old: 1 But the famine was severe in the land.

content: 2 So it came to pass when they had made an end of eating the corn which they had brought in out of Egypt that their father said unto them,— Return､ buy for us a little food.
content_old: 2 So it came to pass when they had made an end of eating the corn which they had brought in out of Egypt that their father said unto them,— Return､ buy for us a little food.

content: 3 Then spake Judah unto him､ saying,— The man did protest to us､ saying— Ye shall not see my face, except your brother is with you.
content_old: 3 Then spake Judah unto him､ saying,— The man did protest to us､ saying— Ye shall not see my face, except your brother is with you.

content: 4 If thou art sending our brother with us we will certainly go down､ and buy for thee food;
content_old: 4 If thou art sending our brother with us we will certainly go down､ and buy for thee food;

content: 5 but if thou art not sending him we will not go down, for the man said unto us､ Ye shall not see my face, except your brother is with you.
content_old: 5 but if thou art not sending him we will not go down, for the man said unto us､ Ye shall not see my face, except your brother is with you.

content: 6 And Israel said, Wherefore did ye ill to me,—to tell the man, there yet remained to you､ a brother?
content_old: 6 And Israel said, Wherefore did ye ill to me,—to tell the man, there yet remained to you､ a brother?

content: 7 And they said, The man did ask concerning ourselves and concerning our kindred､ saying— Is your father yet alive? Have ye a brother? So we told him according to the tenor of these words. Could we at all know that he would say, Bring down your brother?
content_old: 7 And they said, The man did ask concerning ourselves and concerning our kindred､ saying— Is your father yet alive? Have ye a brother? So we told him according to the tenor of these words. Could we at all know that he would say, Bring down your brother?

content: 8 Then said Judah unto Israel his father— Come! send thou down the young man with me､ that we may arise and go our way,—and live and not die, both we and thou､ and our little ones.
content_old: 8 Then said Judah unto Israel his father— Come! send thou down the young man with me､ that we may arise and go our way,—and live and not die, both we and thou､ and our little ones.

content: 9 I will be surety for him, at my hand shalt thou require him,—as surely as I bring him not in unto thee､ and set him down before thee so surely will I be counted a sinner against thee､ all the days,
content_old: 9 I will be surety for him, at my hand shalt thou require him,—as surely as I bring him not in unto thee､ and set him down before thee so surely will I be counted a sinner against thee､ all the days,

content: 10 For if we had not lingered surely now had we come back here a second time.
content_old: 10 For if we had not lingered surely now had we come back here a second time.

content: 11 Then Israel their father said unto them— If so then do this,— Take of the song of the land in your vessels, and carry down to the man､ a present,— A little balsam､ and a little honey, tragacanth gum and cistus gum, pistachio nuts､ and almonds.
content_old: 11 Then Israel their father said unto them— If so then do this,— Take of the song of the land in your vessels, and carry down to the man､ a present,— A little balsam､ and a little honey, tragacanth gum and cistus gum, pistachio nuts､ and almonds.

content: 12 And double silver take in your hand,—also the silver that was put back in the mouth of your sacks carry ye back in your hand, peradventure it was an error
content_old: 12 And double silver take in your hand,—also the silver that was put back in the mouth of your sacks carry ye back in your hand, peradventure it was an error

content: 13 Your brother also take ye,—and arise､ go again unto the man.
content_old: 13 Your brother also take ye,—and arise､ go again unto the man.

content: 14 And GOD Almighty give you compassion before the man, so shall he send with you､ your other brother､ and Benjamin. But as for me when I am bereaved I am bereaved!
content_old: 14 And GOD Almighty give you compassion before the man, so shall he send with you､ your other brother､ and Benjamin. But as for me when I am bereaved I am bereaved!

content: 15 So the men took this present, double silver also took they in their hand､ and Benjamin,—and arose､ and went down into Egypt, and stood before Joseph.
content_old: 15 So the men took this present, double silver also took they in their hand､ and Benjamin,—and arose､ and went down into Egypt, and stood before Joseph.

content: 16 And Joseph saw—with them—Benjamin, so he said to him that was over his house､ Bring the men into the house,—and slay meat､ and make ready, for with me shall the men eat､ at noon.
content_old: 16 And Joseph saw—with them—Benjamin, so he said to him that was over his house､ Bring the men into the house,—and slay meat､ and make ready, for with me shall the men eat､ at noon.

content: 17 So the men did､ as Joseph had said, and the man brought the men into Joseph’s house.
content_old: 17 So the men did､ as Joseph had said, and the man brought the men into Joseph’s house.

content: 18 Then were the men afraid､ because they had been brought into the house of Joseph, and they said— For the matter of the silver that came back in our sacks at the beginning have we been brought in,—that he may turn round upon us and fall upon us, and take us for servants､ and our asses.
content_old: 18 Then were the men afraid､ because they had been brought into the house of Joseph, and they said— For the matter of the silver that came back in our sacks at the beginning have we been brought in,—that he may turn round upon us and fall upon us, and take us for servants､ and our asses.

content: 19 So they drew near unto the man that was over Joseph’s house,—and spake unto him､ at the entrance of the house;
content_old: 19 So they drew near unto the man that was over Joseph’s house,—and spake unto him､ at the entrance of the house;

content: 20 and said､ May it please my lord! We did indeed come down at the beginning to buy food.
content_old: 20 and said､ May it please my lord! We did indeed come down at the beginning to buy food.

content: 21 And it came to pass when we had entered into the inn that we opened our sacks, and lo! the silver of each man in the mouth of his sack,—our silver in its full weight,—so we have bought it back in our hand!
content_old: 21 And it came to pass when we had entered into the inn that we opened our sacks, and lo! the silver of each man in the mouth of his sack,—our silver in its full weight,—so we have bought it back in our hand!

content: 22 And more silver have we brought down in our hand､ to buy food,—we know not who put our silver in our sacks.
content_old: 22 And more silver have we brought down in our hand､ to buy food,—we know not who put our silver in our sacks.

content: 23 And he said— Peace to you､ do not fear! Your God､ and the God of your father hath given you secret treasure､ in your sacks, as for your silver it came in unto me. And he brought forth unto them､ Simeon.
content_old: 23 And he said— Peace to you､ do not fear! Your God､ and the God of your father hath given you secret treasure､ in your sacks, as for your silver it came in unto me. And he brought forth unto them､ Simeon.

content: 24 So the man brought the men into Joseph’s house,—and gave them water､ and they bathed their feet, and he gave them provender for their asses.
content_old: 24 So the man brought the men into Joseph’s house,—and gave them water､ and they bathed their feet, and he gave them provender for their asses.

content: 25 And they made ready the present, against the coming in of Joseph､ at noon,—for they heard that it was there they should eat bread.
content_old: 25 And they made ready the present, against the coming in of Joseph､ at noon,—for they heard that it was there they should eat bread.

content: 26 So when Joseph came into the house they brought in to him the present which was in their hand､ into the house,—and bowed themselves down to him to the earth.
content_old: 26 So when Joseph came into the house they brought in to him the present which was in their hand､ into the house,—and bowed themselves down to him to the earth.

content: 27 Then asked he after their welfare, and said— Is it well with your aged father, of whom ye spake? Is he yet alive?
content_old: 27 Then asked he after their welfare, and said— Is it well with your aged father, of whom ye spake? Is he yet alive?

content: 28 And they said— It is well with thy servant our father､ he is yet alive. And they bent their heads､ and bowed themselves down.
content_old: 28 And they said— It is well with thy servant our father､ he is yet alive. And they bent their heads､ and bowed themselves down.

content: 29 Then lifted he up his eyes､ and saw Benjamin his brother､ son of his mother, and said— Is this your youngest brother, of whom ye spake unto me? And he said, God grant thee favour､ my son!
content_old: 29 Then lifted he up his eyes､ and saw Benjamin his brother､ son of his mother, and said— Is this your youngest brother, of whom ye spake unto me? And he said, God grant thee favour､ my son!

content: 30 And Joseph made haste､ for his compassions towards his brother were pent up, and he sought to weep,—so he went into the inner chamber､ and wept there.
content_old: 30 And Joseph made haste､ for his compassions towards his brother were pent up, and he sought to weep,—so he went into the inner chamber､ and wept there.

content: 31 Then bathed he his face､ and came forth,—and restrained himself, and said､ Set on bread!
content_old: 31 Then bathed he his face､ and came forth,—and restrained himself, and said､ Set on bread!

content: 32 So they set on､ for him—by himself､ and for them—by themselves,—and for the Egyptians that were eating with him—by themselves, for the Egyptians might not eat bread with the Hebrews､ for an abomination had that been to Egyptians.
content_old: 32 So they set on､ for him—by himself､ and for them—by themselves,—and for the Egyptians that were eating with him—by themselves, for the Egyptians might not eat bread with the Hebrews､ for an abomination had that been to Egyptians.

content: 33 So they took their seats before him, the firstborn according to his birthright､ and the youngest according to his youth,—and the men looked with amazement､ each one at his companion.
content_old: 33 So they took their seats before him, the firstborn according to his birthright､ and the youngest according to his youth,—and the men looked with amazement､ each one at his companion.

content: 1 Then commanded he him who was over his house saying— Fill the sacks of the men､ with food, as much as they can carry,—and put each man’s silver in the mouth of his sack;
content_old: 1 Then commanded he him who was over his house saying— Fill the sacks of the men､ with food, as much as they can carry,—and put each man’s silver in the mouth of his sack;

content: 2 and my cup—the cup of silver shalt thou put in the mouth of the sack of the youngest, with his corn-silver. So he did, according to the word of Joseph､ which he had spoken.
content_old: 2 and my cup—the cup of silver shalt thou put in the mouth of the sack of the youngest, with his corn-silver. So he did, according to the word of Joseph､ which he had spoken.

content: 3 By the time the morning was light the men had been sent away､ they､ and their asses.
content_old: 3 By the time the morning was light the men had been sent away､ they､ and their asses.

content: 4 They themselves had gone out of the city—they had not gone far, when Joseph said to him who was over his house, Rise､ chase after the men,—so shalt thou overtake them､ and shalt say unto them, Wherefore have ye requited evil for good?
content_old: 4 They themselves had gone out of the city—they had not gone far, when Joseph said to him who was over his house, Rise､ chase after the men,—so shalt thou overtake them､ and shalt say unto them, Wherefore have ye requited evil for good?

content: 5 Is not this that in which my lord drinketh, and whereby he himself doth divine? Ye have done evil､ in what ye have done.
content_old: 5 Is not this that in which my lord drinketh, and whereby he himself doth divine? Ye have done evil､ in what ye have done.

content: 6 So he overtook them,—and spake unto them these words.
content_old: 6 So he overtook them,—and spake unto them these words.

content: 7 And they said unto him, Wherefore should my lord speak such words as these? Far be thy servants, from doing such a thing as this!
content_old: 7 And they said unto him, Wherefore should my lord speak such words as these? Far be thy servants, from doing such a thing as this!

content: 8 Lo! the silver that we found in the mouth of our sacks we brought back unto thee､ out of the land of Canaan,—how then could we steal､ out of the house of thy lord, silver or gold?
content_old: 8 Lo! the silver that we found in the mouth of our sacks we brought back unto thee､ out of the land of Canaan,—how then could we steal､ out of the house of thy lord, silver or gold?

content: 9 With whomsoever of thy servants it can be found he shall die,—and we also will become my lord’s servants.
content_old: 9 With whomsoever of thy servants it can be found he shall die,—and we also will become my lord’s servants.

content: 10 And he said､ Yea､ now､ according to your words so let it be,—he with whom it is found shall be my servant, Ye however､ shall be clear.
content_old: 10 And he said､ Yea､ now､ according to your words so let it be,—he with whom it is found shall be my servant, Ye however､ shall be clear.

content: 11 So they hastened and took down､ each man his sack to the ground,—and opened､ each man his sack.
content_old: 11 So they hastened and took down､ each man his sack to the ground,—and opened､ each man his sack.

content: 12 Then made he thorough search, with the eldest he began, and with the youngest he ended,—and the cup was found in the sack of Benjamin!
content_old: 12 Then made he thorough search, with the eldest he began, and with the youngest he ended,—and the cup was found in the sack of Benjamin!

content: 13 And they rent their mantles,—and laded each man his ass, and returned to the city.
content_old: 13 And they rent their mantles,—and laded each man his ass, and returned to the city.

content: 14 And Judah and his brethren came into the house of Joseph, he yet being there,—and fell down before him､ to the earth.
content_old: 14 And Judah and his brethren came into the house of Joseph, he yet being there,—and fell down before him､ to the earth.

content: 15 And Joseph said to them, What is this deed which ye have done? Know ye not that such a man as I can even divine?
content_old: 15 And Joseph said to them, What is this deed which ye have done? Know ye not that such a man as I can even divine?

content: 16 Then said Judah— What shall we say to my lord, how shall we speak､ and how shall we justify ourselves,—when God himself hath found out the iniquity of thy servants? Behold us! my lord’s servants, both we､ and he in whose hand the cup hath been found.
content_old: 16 Then said Judah— What shall we say to my lord, how shall we speak､ and how shall we justify ourselves,—when God himself hath found out the iniquity of thy servants? Behold us! my lord’s servants, both we､ and he in whose hand the cup hath been found.

content: 17 And he said, Far be it from me､ to do this thing! The man in whose hand the cup hath been found he shall be my servant, but as for you go ye up in peace､ unto your father.
content_old: 17 And he said, Far be it from me､ to do this thing! The man in whose hand the cup hath been found he shall be my servant, but as for you go ye up in peace､ unto your father.

content: 18 Then Judah drew near unto him､ and said— Pardon､ my lord! Pray let thy servant speak a word in the ears of my lord, and do not let thine anger be kindled against thy servant,—for thus art thou､ as Pharaoh!
content_old: 18 Then Judah drew near unto him､ and said— Pardon､ my lord! Pray let thy servant speak a word in the ears of my lord, and do not let thine anger be kindled against thy servant,—for thus art thou､ as Pharaoh!

content: 19 It was my lord who asked his servants, saying,— Have ye a father､ or a brother?
content_old: 19 It was my lord who asked his servants, saying,— Have ye a father､ or a brother?

content: 20 So we said unto my lord, We have an aged father, and the child of his old age､ a youth,—his brother being dead he alone is left of his mother､ and his father loveth him.
content_old: 20 So we said unto my lord, We have an aged father, and the child of his old age､ a youth,—his brother being dead he alone is left of his mother､ and his father loveth him.

content: 21 So then thou saidst unto thy servants, Bring him down unto me,—that I may set mine eyes upon him.
content_old: 21 So then thou saidst unto thy servants, Bring him down unto me,—that I may set mine eyes upon him.

content: 22 And we said unto my lord, The lad cannot leave his father,—as surely as he leaveth his father so surely will he die.
content_old: 22 And we said unto my lord, The lad cannot leave his father,—as surely as he leaveth his father so surely will he die.

content: 23 And thou saidst unto thy servants, Except your youngest brother do come down with you ye shall not again behold my face.
content_old: 23 And thou saidst unto thy servants, Except your youngest brother do come down with you ye shall not again behold my face.

content: 24 So it came to pass､when we had gone up unto thy servant､ my fathers､ that we told him the words of my lord.
content_old: 24 So it came to pass､when we had gone up unto thy servant､ my fathers､ that we told him the words of my lord.

content: 25 Then said our father,— Go again､ buy us a little food.
content_old: 25 Then said our father,— Go again､ buy us a little food.

content: 26 And we said, We cannot go down,— If our youngest brother be with us then will we go down､ for we cannot see the face of the man､ if our youngest brother is not with us.
content_old: 26 And we said, We cannot go down,— If our youngest brother be with us then will we go down､ for we cannot see the face of the man､ if our youngest brother is not with us.

content: 27 Then said thy servant my father､ unto us,— Ye yourselves know, that two did my wife bear to me,
content_old: 27 Then said thy servant my father､ unto us,— Ye yourselves know, that two did my wife bear to me,

content: 28 and the one went forth from me, and I said— Certainly he hath been torn in pieces,— And I have never seen him since.
content_old: 28 and the one went forth from me, and I said— Certainly he hath been torn in pieces,— And I have never seen him since.

content: 29 As surely as ye take this one also away from before my face､ and there befall him any mischief, so surely shall ye bring down my grey hairs､ with misfortune､ to hades.
content_old: 29 As surely as ye take this one also away from before my face､ and there befall him any mischief, so surely shall ye bring down my grey hairs､ with misfortune､ to hades.

content: 30 Now therefore､as surely as I go in unto thy servant my father, and the lad is not with us,—seeing that his soul is bound up with the lad’s soul
content_old: 30 Now therefore､as surely as I go in unto thy servant my father, and the lad is not with us,—seeing that his soul is bound up with the lad’s soul

content: 31 so surely shall it come to pass that when he seeth that the lad is not with us, then will he die. So shall thy servants bring down the grey hairs of thy servant our father､ with sorrow､ to hades.
content_old: 31 so surely shall it come to pass that when he seeth that the lad is not with us, then will he die. So shall thy servants bring down the grey hairs of thy servant our father､ with sorrow､ to hades.

content: 32 For thy servant became surety for the lad, while away from my father､ saying,— If I bring him not unto thee then will I count myself a sinner against my father all the days.
content_old: 32 For thy servant became surety for the lad, while away from my father､ saying,— If I bring him not unto thee then will I count myself a sinner against my father all the days.

content: 33 Now therefore､ I pray thee､ let thy servant remain instead of the lad, as servant to my lord,—but as for the lad let him go up with his brethren.
content_old: 33 Now therefore､ I pray thee､ let thy servant remain instead of the lad, as servant to my lord,—but as for the lad let him go up with his brethren.

content: 1 And Joseph could not restrain himself､ before all who were stationed near him, so he cried out— Have forth every man from me! And there stood no man with him, when Joseph made himself known unto his brethren.
content_old: 1 And Joseph could not restrain himself､ before all who were stationed near him, so he cried out— Have forth every man from me! And there stood no man with him, when Joseph made himself known unto his brethren.

content: 2 Then gave he forth his voice､ in weeping,—and the Egyptians heard, and the house of Pharaoh heard.
content_old: 2 Then gave he forth his voice､ in weeping,—and the Egyptians heard, and the house of Pharaoh heard.

content: 3 Then said Joseph unto his brethren: I am Joseph, is my father yet alive? But his brethren could not answer him, for they were terrified because of him.
content_old: 3 Then said Joseph unto his brethren: I am Joseph, is my father yet alive? But his brethren could not answer him, for they were terrified because of him.

content: 4 Then said Joseph unto his brethren— Draw near､ I pray you､ unto me. And they drew near. And he said— I am Joseph your brother, whom ye sold into Egypt.
content_old: 4 Then said Joseph unto his brethren— Draw near､ I pray you､ unto me. And they drew near. And he said— I am Joseph your brother, whom ye sold into Egypt.

content: 5 But now do not grieve､ neither let it be vexing in your eyes, that ye sold me hither,—for to save life did God send me before you.
content_old: 5 But now do not grieve､ neither let it be vexing in your eyes, that ye sold me hither,—for to save life did God send me before you.

content: 6 For these two years hath the famine been in the midst of the land,—and yet five years are there, in which there shall be neither ploughing､ nor harvest.
content_old: 6 For these two years hath the famine been in the midst of the land,—and yet five years are there, in which there shall be neither ploughing､ nor harvest.

content: 7 So then God sent me before you, to plant for you a remainder､ in the earth,—and to save you alive, by a great deliverance.
content_old: 7 So then God sent me before you, to plant for you a remainder､ in the earth,—and to save you alive, by a great deliverance.

content: 8 Now therefore､ it was not ye who sent me hither, but God himself,—who also appointed me to be a father to Pharaoh､ and a lord to all his house, and a ruler､ over all the land of Egypt.
content_old: 8 Now therefore､ it was not ye who sent me hither, but God himself,—who also appointed me to be a father to Pharaoh､ and a lord to all his house, and a ruler､ over all the land of Egypt.

content: 9 Haste ye､ and go up unto my father, then shall ye say unto him —Thus saith thy son Joseph, God hath appointed me lord to all Egypt,—come down unto me､ do not delay;
content_old: 9 Haste ye､ and go up unto my father, then shall ye say unto him —Thus saith thy son Joseph, God hath appointed me lord to all Egypt,—come down unto me､ do not delay;

content: 10 so shalt thou dwell in the land of Goshen､ and shalt be near unto me, thou､ and thy sons､ and thy sons’ sons,—and thy flocks and thy herds､ and all that is thine;
content_old: 10 so shalt thou dwell in the land of Goshen､ and shalt be near unto me, thou､ and thy sons､ and thy sons’ sons,—and thy flocks and thy herds､ and all that is thine;

content: 11 so will I sustain thee､ there, for there are yet five years､ of famine,—lest thou come to poverty—thou､ and thy house､ and all who are thine.
content_old: 11 so will I sustain thee､ there, for there are yet five years､ of famine,—lest thou come to poverty—thou､ and thy house､ and all who are thine.

content: 12 Now lo! your own eyes do see, and the eyes of my brother Benjamin,—that it is my own mouth that doth speak unto you.
content_old: 12 Now lo! your own eyes do see, and the eyes of my brother Benjamin,—that it is my own mouth that doth speak unto you.

content: 13 As soon as ye have told my father all my honour in Egypt, and all that ye have seen so soon shall ye hasten､ and bring down my father､ hither.
content_old: 13 As soon as ye have told my father all my honour in Egypt, and all that ye have seen so soon shall ye hasten､ and bring down my father､ hither.

content: 14 Then fell he upon the neck of Benjamin his brother､ and wept,—and Benjamin wept on his neck.
content_old: 14 Then fell he upon the neck of Benjamin his brother､ and wept,—and Benjamin wept on his neck.

content: 15 Then kissed he all his brethren､ and wept upon them,—and thereafter his brethren spake with him.
content_old: 15 Then kissed he all his brethren､ and wept upon them,—and thereafter his brethren spake with him.

content: 16 Now the report was heard by the house of Pharaoh､ saying, The brethren of Joseph have come in. And it was good in the eyes of Pharaoh, and in the eyes of all his servants.
content_old: 16 Now the report was heard by the house of Pharaoh､ saying, The brethren of Joseph have come in. And it was good in the eyes of Pharaoh, and in the eyes of all his servants.

content: 17 So then Pharaoh said unto Joseph— Say unto thy brethren､ This do,—lade your asses, and go､ enter into the land of Canaan;
content_old: 17 So then Pharaoh said unto Joseph— Say unto thy brethren､ This do,—lade your asses, and go､ enter into the land of Canaan;

content: 18 and fetch your father and your households､ and come in unto me,—that I may give you the best of the land of Egypt, and eat ye the fat of the land.
content_old: 18 and fetch your father and your households､ and come in unto me,—that I may give you the best of the land of Egypt, and eat ye the fat of the land.

content: 19 Thou therefore､ command them､ This do ye,— Take you､ out of the land of Egypt､ waggons for your little ones､ and for your wives, so shall ye bring your father､ and come in.
content_old: 19 Thou therefore､ command them､ This do ye,— Take you､ out of the land of Egypt､ waggons for your little ones､ and for your wives, so shall ye bring your father､ and come in.

content: 20 Your eye､ moreover､ let it not look with pity upon your goods,—for the best of all the land of Egypt is yours.
content_old: 20 Your eye､ moreover､ let it not look with pity upon your goods,—for the best of all the land of Egypt is yours.

content: 21 And the sons of Israel did so, and Joseph gave them waggons､ at the bidding of Pharaoh,—and gave them provisions for the way:
content_old: 21 And the sons of Israel did so, and Joseph gave them waggons､ at the bidding of Pharaoh,—and gave them provisions for the way:

content: 22 to all of them gave he､ to each man､ changes of raiment,—but to Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver, and five changes of raiment.
content_old: 22 to all of them gave he､ to each man､ changes of raiment,—but to Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver, and five changes of raiment.

content: 23 Moreover to his father sent he as followeth—ten he-asses, laden from the best of Egypt,—and ten she-asses､ laden with corn and bread and nourishing food for his father､ for the way.
content_old: 23 Moreover to his father sent he as followeth—ten he-asses, laden from the best of Egypt,—and ten she-asses､ laden with corn and bread and nourishing food for his father､ for the way.

content: 24 Thus sent he forth his brethren､ and they departed,—and he said unto them, Do not fall out､ by the way.
content_old: 24 Thus sent he forth his brethren､ and they departed,—and he said unto them, Do not fall out､ by the way.

content: 25 And they went up out of Egypt,—and came into the land of Canaan, unto Jacob their father.
content_old: 25 And they went up out of Egypt,—and came into the land of Canaan, unto Jacob their father.

content: 26 And they told him､ saying— Joseph is yet alive, yea､ indeed he is ruler in all the land of Egypt. And his heart became faint, for he believed them not.
content_old: 26 And they told him､ saying— Joseph is yet alive, yea､ indeed he is ruler in all the land of Egypt. And his heart became faint, for he believed them not.

content: 27 So they spake unto him all the words of Joseph､ which he had spoken unto them, then saw he the waggons､ which Joseph had sent to carry him,—and the spirit of Jacob their father revived.
content_old: 27 So they spake unto him all the words of Joseph､ which he had spoken unto them, then saw he the waggons､ which Joseph had sent to carry him,—and the spirit of Jacob their father revived.

content: 1 So Israel brake up､ with all that he had, and came in to Beer-sheba,—and offered sacrifices to the God of his father Isaac.
content_old: 1 So Israel brake up､ with all that he had, and came in to Beer-sheba,—and offered sacrifices to the God of his father Isaac.

content: 2 And God said to Israel､ in the visions of the night, and he said— Jacob! Jacob! And he said— Behold me!
content_old: 2 And God said to Israel､ in the visions of the night, and he said— Jacob! Jacob! And he said— Behold me!

content: 3 And he said: I am GOD himself, the God of thy father,— Be not afraid of going down to Egypt, seeing that for a great nation will I plant thee there.
content_old: 3 And he said: I am GOD himself, the God of thy father,— Be not afraid of going down to Egypt, seeing that for a great nation will I plant thee there.

content: 4 I will go down with thee､ to Egypt, and I will bring thee up, yea wholly up,—and Joseph shall lay his own hand､ upon thine eyes.
content_old: 4 I will go down with thee､ to Egypt, and I will bring thee up, yea wholly up,—and Joseph shall lay his own hand､ upon thine eyes.

content: 5 So Jacob rose up from Beer-sheba,—and the sons of Israel brought Jacob their father､ and their little ones､ and their wives, in the waggons which Pharaoh had sent to bring him;
content_old: 5 So Jacob rose up from Beer-sheba,—and the sons of Israel brought Jacob their father､ and their little ones､ and their wives, in the waggons which Pharaoh had sent to bring him;

content: 6 and they took their cattle､ and the gains which they had gained､ in the land of Canaan, and came into Egypt,—Jacob､ and all his seed with him:
content_old: 6 and they took their cattle､ and the gains which they had gained､ in the land of Canaan, and came into Egypt,—Jacob､ and all his seed with him:

content: 7 his sons､ and his sons’ sons with him, his daughters､ and his son’s daughters､ and all his seed brought he with him､ into Egypt.
content_old: 7 his sons､ and his sons’ sons with him, his daughters､ and his son’s daughters､ and all his seed brought he with him､ into Egypt.

content: 8 Now these are the names of the sons of Israel､ who came into Egypt—Jacob and his sons,— The firstborn of Jacob Reuben:
content_old: 8 Now these are the names of the sons of Israel､ who came into Egypt—Jacob and his sons,— The firstborn of Jacob Reuben:

content: 9 And the sons of Reuben,— Hanoch and Pallu､ and Hezron and Carmi;
content_old: 9 And the sons of Reuben,— Hanoch and Pallu､ and Hezron and Carmi;

content: 10 And the sons of Simeon,— Jemuel and Jamin and Ohad､ and Jachin and Zohar,—and Shaul､ son of the Canaanitess;
content_old: 10 And the sons of Simeon,— Jemuel and Jamin and Ohad､ and Jachin and Zohar,—and Shaul､ son of the Canaanitess;

content: 11 And the sons of Levi,— Gershon､ Kohath､ and Merari;
content_old: 11 And the sons of Levi,— Gershon､ Kohath､ and Merari;

content: 12 And the sons of Judah,— Er and Onan and Shelah､ and Perez and Zerah,—but Er and Onan died､ in the land of Canaan, and the sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul;
content_old: 12 And the sons of Judah,— Er and Onan and Shelah､ and Perez and Zerah,—but Er and Onan died､ in the land of Canaan, and the sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul;

content: 13 And the sons of Issachar,— Tola and Puvah､ and lob and Shimron;
content_old: 13 And the sons of Issachar,— Tola and Puvah､ and lob and Shimron;

content: 14 And the sons of Zebulon,— Sered and Elon､ and Jahleel.
content_old: 14 And the sons of Zebulon,— Sered and Elon､ and Jahleel.

content: 15 These are the sons of Leah､ whom she bare to Jacob､ in Padan-aram, with Dinah also his daughter,—All the souls of his sons and of his daughters were thirty-three.
content_old: 15 These are the sons of Leah､ whom she bare to Jacob､ in Padan-aram, with Dinah also his daughter,—All the souls of his sons and of his daughters were thirty-three.

content: 16 And the sons of Gad,— Zaphon and Haggi､ Shuni and Ezbon,—Eri and Arodi､ and Areli;
content_old: 16 And the sons of Gad,— Zaphon and Haggi､ Shuni and Ezbon,—Eri and Arodi､ and Areli;

content: 17 And the sons of Asher,— Imnah and Ishvah and Ishvi and Beriah､ and Serah their sister,—and the sons of Beriah Heber and Malchiel.
content_old: 17 And the sons of Asher,— Imnah and Ishvah and Ishvi and Beriah､ and Serah their sister,—and the sons of Beriah Heber and Malchiel.

content: 18 These are the sons of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to Leah his daughter,—so she bare these to Jacob,—sixteen souls.
content_old: 18 These are the sons of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to Leah his daughter,—so she bare these to Jacob,—sixteen souls.

content: 19 The sons of Rachel､ Jacob’s wife,— Joseph､ and Benjamin;
content_old: 19 The sons of Rachel､ Jacob’s wife,— Joseph､ and Benjamin;

content: 20 And there were born to Joseph in the land of Egypt, whom Asenath､ daughter of Poti-phera､ priest of On､ bare to him: Manasseh､ and Ephraim;
content_old: 20 And there were born to Joseph in the land of Egypt, whom Asenath､ daughter of Poti-phera､ priest of On､ bare to him: Manasseh､ and Ephraim;

content: 21 And the sons of Benjamin— Bela and Becher､ and Ashbel, Gera and Naaman､ Ehi and Rosh,—Muppim and Huppim､ and Ard.
content_old: 21 And the sons of Benjamin— Bela and Becher､ and Ashbel, Gera and Naaman､ Ehi and Rosh,—Muppim and Huppim､ and Ard.

content: 22 These are the sons of Rachel, who were born to Jacob,—all the souls were fourteen.
content_old: 22 These are the sons of Rachel, who were born to Jacob,—all the souls were fourteen.

content: 23 And the sons of Dan,— Hushim;
content_old: 23 And the sons of Dan,— Hushim;

content: 24 And the sons of Naphtali,— Jahzeel and Guni､ and Jezer and Shillem.
content_old: 24 And the sons of Naphtali,— Jahzeel and Guni､ and Jezer and Shillem.
