content: 25 These are the sons of Bilhah, whom Laban gave to Rachel his daughter,—so she bare these to Jacob,—all the souls were seven.
content_old: 25 These are the sons of Bilhah, whom Laban gave to Rachel his daughter,—so she bare these to Jacob,—all the souls were seven.

content: 26 All the souls that came in with Jacob to Egypt､ that had come forth of his loins, besides Jacob’s sons’ wives,—all the souls were sixty-six;
content_old: 26 All the souls that came in with Jacob to Egypt､ that had come forth of his loins, besides Jacob’s sons’ wives,—all the souls were sixty-six;

content: 27 and the sons of Joseph who were born to him in Egypt were two souls: All the souls of the house of Jacob that came into Egypt were seventy.
content_old: 27 and the sons of Joseph who were born to him in Egypt were two souls: All the souls of the house of Jacob that came into Egypt were seventy.

content: 28 And he sent Judah before him､ unto Joseph, to direct his face to Goshen,—so they came in towards the land of Goshen.
content_old: 28 And he sent Judah before him､ unto Joseph, to direct his face to Goshen,—so they came in towards the land of Goshen.

content: 29 Then yoked Joseph his chariot, and went up to meet Israel his father､ towards Goshen,—and he appeared unto him､ and fell upon his neck, and wept upon his neck､ a good while.
content_old: 29 Then yoked Joseph his chariot, and went up to meet Israel his father､ towards Goshen,—and he appeared unto him､ and fell upon his neck, and wept upon his neck､ a good while.

content: 30 Then said Israel unto Joseph､ I am ready to die at last,—now that I have seen thy face, in that thou art yet alive.
content_old: 30 Then said Israel unto Joseph､ I am ready to die at last,—now that I have seen thy face, in that thou art yet alive.

content: 31 Then said Joseph unto his brethren､ and unto the house of his father, I must go up､ and must tell Pharaoh,—and must say unto him, My brethren､ and the house of my father, who were in the land of Canaan have come in unto me.
content_old: 31 Then said Joseph unto his brethren､ and unto the house of his father, I must go up､ and must tell Pharaoh,—and must say unto him, My brethren､ and the house of my father, who were in the land of Canaan have come in unto me.

content: 32 Now the men are feeders of flocks, for men of cattle they are,—and their flocks､ and their herds､ and all that they have have they brought in.
content_old: 32 Now the men are feeders of flocks, for men of cattle they are,—and their flocks､ and their herds､ and all that they have have they brought in.

content: 33 So shall it come to pass when Pharaoh shall call for you,—and shall say— What is your occupation?
content_old: 33 So shall it come to pass when Pharaoh shall call for you,—and shall say— What is your occupation?

content: 1 So then Joseph went in､ and told Pharaoh､ and said— My father and my brethren､ and their flocks and their herds and all that they have are come in､ from the land of Canaan,—and here they are in the land of Goshen.
content_old: 1 So then Joseph went in､ and told Pharaoh､ and said— My father and my brethren､ and their flocks and their herds and all that they have are come in､ from the land of Canaan,—and here they are in the land of Goshen.

content: 2 Moreover out of the whole number of his brethren he took with him five men,—and set them before Pharaoh.
content_old: 2 Moreover out of the whole number of his brethren he took with him five men,—and set them before Pharaoh.

content: 3 And Pharaoh said unto the brethren of Joseph— What is your occupation? And they said unto Pharaoh— Feeders of flocks are thy servants, both we and our fathers.
content_old: 3 And Pharaoh said unto the brethren of Joseph— What is your occupation? And they said unto Pharaoh— Feeders of flocks are thy servants, both we and our fathers.

content: 4 And they said unto Pharaoh— To sojourn in the land are we come in, for there is no pasture for the flocks which pertain to thy servants, for severe is the famine､ in the land of Canaan. Now therefore､ let thy servants dwell､ we pray thee､ in the land of Goshen.
content_old: 4 And they said unto Pharaoh— To sojourn in the land are we come in, for there is no pasture for the flocks which pertain to thy servants, for severe is the famine､ in the land of Canaan. Now therefore､ let thy servants dwell､ we pray thee､ in the land of Goshen.

content: 5 Then spake Pharaoh unto Joseph､ saying,— Thy father and thy brethren are come in unto thee.
content_old: 5 Then spake Pharaoh unto Joseph､ saying,— Thy father and thy brethren are come in unto thee.

content: 6 The land of Egypt is before thee, in the best of the land cause thou thy father and thy brethren to dwell,—let them dwell in the land of Goshen, And if thou knowest that there are among them､ men of ability then shalt thou set them as chieftains of cattle､ over mine.
content_old: 6 The land of Egypt is before thee, in the best of the land cause thou thy father and thy brethren to dwell,—let them dwell in the land of Goshen, And if thou knowest that there are among them､ men of ability then shalt thou set them as chieftains of cattle､ over mine.

content: 7 So Joseph brought in Jacob his father, and caused him to stand before Pharaoh,— and Jacob blessed Pharaoh.
content_old: 7 So Joseph brought in Jacob his father, and caused him to stand before Pharaoh,— and Jacob blessed Pharaoh.

content: 8 And Pharaoh said unto Jacob: About how many have been the days of the years of thy life?
content_old: 8 And Pharaoh said unto Jacob: About how many have been the days of the years of thy life?

content: 9 And Jacob said unto Pharaoh, The days of the years of my sojournings have been a hundred and thirty years,— Few and evil have been the days of the years of my life, neither have they attained unto the days of the years of the lives of my fathers, in the days of their sojournings.
content_old: 9 And Jacob said unto Pharaoh, The days of the years of my sojournings have been a hundred and thirty years,— Few and evil have been the days of the years of my life, neither have they attained unto the days of the years of the lives of my fathers, in the days of their sojournings.

content: 10 And Jacob blessed Pharaoh,—and came forth from the presence of Pharaoh.
content_old: 10 And Jacob blessed Pharaoh,—and came forth from the presence of Pharaoh.

content: 11 So then Joseph fixed the dwelling of his father and his brethren, and gave them a possession in the land of Egypt､ in the best of the land､ in the land of Rameses,—as Pharaoh had commanded.
content_old: 11 So then Joseph fixed the dwelling of his father and his brethren, and gave them a possession in the land of Egypt､ in the best of the land､ in the land of Rameses,—as Pharaoh had commanded.

content: 12 And Joseph nourished his father and his brethren, and all his father’s house,—with bread､ according to the need of their little ones.
content_old: 12 And Joseph nourished his father and his brethren, and all his father’s house,—with bread､ according to the need of their little ones.

content: 13 But bread was there none､ in all the land,—for the famine was very severe,—so that the land of Egypt and the land of Canaan､ fainted by reason of the famine.
content_old: 13 But bread was there none､ in all the land,—for the famine was very severe,—so that the land of Egypt and the land of Canaan､ fainted by reason of the famine.

content: 14 So Joseph gathered up all the silver that was found in the land of Egypt､ and in the land of Canaan, for the corn which they were buying,—and Joseph brought the silver into the house of Pharaoh.
content_old: 14 So Joseph gathered up all the silver that was found in the land of Egypt､ and in the land of Canaan, for the corn which they were buying,—and Joseph brought the silver into the house of Pharaoh.

content: 15 And the silver was spent out of the land of Egypt､ and out of the land of Canaan, so all the Egyptians came in unto Joseph､ saying— Do give us bread, for why should we die before thee, although silver hath failed?
content_old: 15 And the silver was spent out of the land of Egypt､ and out of the land of Canaan, so all the Egyptians came in unto Joseph､ saying— Do give us bread, for why should we die before thee, although silver hath failed?

content: 16 Then said Joseph: Give your cattle, and I will give you for your cattle,—if silver hath failed.
content_old: 16 Then said Joseph: Give your cattle, and I will give you for your cattle,—if silver hath failed.

content: 17 So they brought in their cattle unto Joseph, and Joseph gave them bread in exchange for the horses､ and for the cattle of the flock､ and for the cattle of the herd, and for the asses,—and he provided them with bread､ for all their cattle, throughout that year.
content_old: 17 So they brought in their cattle unto Joseph, and Joseph gave them bread in exchange for the horses､ and for the cattle of the flock､ and for the cattle of the herd, and for the asses,—and he provided them with bread､ for all their cattle, throughout that year.

content: 18 When that year was ended, then came they unto him､ in the second year､ and said to him— We will not hide from my lord, how that the silver､ and the herds of beasts for my lord､ are come to an end,—there is nothing left before my lord, save only our bodies､ and our ground:
content_old: 18 When that year was ended, then came they unto him､ in the second year､ and said to him— We will not hide from my lord, how that the silver､ and the herds of beasts for my lord､ are come to an end,—there is nothing left before my lord, save only our bodies､ and our ground:

content: 19 Wherefore should we die before thine eyes both we､ and our ground? Buy thou､ us and our ground､ for bread,—and we and our ground will become servants to Pharaoh, and give seed, that we may live､ and not die, and the ground not lie waste.
content_old: 19 Wherefore should we die before thine eyes both we､ and our ground? Buy thou､ us and our ground､ for bread,—and we and our ground will become servants to Pharaoh, and give seed, that we may live､ and not die, and the ground not lie waste.

content: 20 So Joseph bought all the ground of the Egyptians for Pharaoh, for the Egyptians sold every man his field, because the famine had laid fast hold upon them,—so the land became Pharaoh’s.
content_old: 20 So Joseph bought all the ground of the Egyptians for Pharaoh, for the Egyptians sold every man his field, because the famine had laid fast hold upon them,—so the land became Pharaoh’s.

content: 21 And as for the people he brought them into bondage as servants,—from one end of the boundary of Egypt unto the other end thereof.
content_old: 21 And as for the people he brought them into bondage as servants,—from one end of the boundary of Egypt unto the other end thereof.

content: 22 Only the ground of the priests bought he not,—for the priests had a statutory-portion from Pharaoh､ and they had been eating their statutory-portion､ which Pharaoh had given them, for which cause they had not sold their ground.
content_old: 22 Only the ground of the priests bought he not,—for the priests had a statutory-portion from Pharaoh､ and they had been eating their statutory-portion､ which Pharaoh had given them, for which cause they had not sold their ground.

content: 23 And Joseph said unto the people, Lo! I have bought you this day､ and your ground､ for Pharaoh,—see, here is seed for you, so shall ye sow the ground;
content_old: 23 And Joseph said unto the people, Lo! I have bought you this day､ and your ground､ for Pharaoh,—see, here is seed for you, so shall ye sow the ground;

content: 24 and it shall come to pass that, of the yield ye shall give a fifth､ to Pharaoh,—but the four parts shall be your own—for seed for the field､ and for your food､ and for them who are in your households､ and for food for your little ones.
content_old: 24 and it shall come to pass that, of the yield ye shall give a fifth､ to Pharaoh,—but the four parts shall be your own—for seed for the field､ and for your food､ and for them who are in your households､ and for food for your little ones.

content: 25 And they said— Thou hast saved our lives! let us find favour in the eyes of my lord, so will we become Pharaoh’s servants.
content_old: 25 And they said— Thou hast saved our lives! let us find favour in the eyes of my lord, so will we become Pharaoh’s servants.

content: 26 And Joseph appointed it for a statute—until this day､ regarding the ground of Egypt, that Pharaoh should take a fifth,—only the ground of the priests was theirs alone, it had not become Pharaoh’s.
content_old: 26 And Joseph appointed it for a statute—until this day､ regarding the ground of Egypt, that Pharaoh should take a fifth,—only the ground of the priests was theirs alone, it had not become Pharaoh’s.

content: 27 Thus Israel dwelt in the land of Egypt､ in the land of Goshen,—and gained possessions therein, and became fruitful and multiplied､ exceedingly.
content_old: 27 Thus Israel dwelt in the land of Egypt､ in the land of Goshen,—and gained possessions therein, and became fruitful and multiplied､ exceedingly.

content: 28 And Jacob lived in the land of Egypt､ seventeen years,—so it came to pass that the days of Jacob､ the years of his life, were a hundred and forty-seven years.
content_old: 28 And Jacob lived in the land of Egypt､ seventeen years,—so it came to pass that the days of Jacob､ the years of his life, were a hundred and forty-seven years.

content: 29 And the days of Israel drew near that he must die, so he called for his son､ for Joseph､ and said to him— If､ I pray thee I have found favour in thine eyes place､ I pray thee､ thy hand under my thigh,—so shalt thou deal with me in lovingkindness and faithfulness— Do not､ I pray thee､ bury me in Egypt.
content_old: 29 And the days of Israel drew near that he must die, so he called for his son､ for Joseph､ and said to him— If､ I pray thee I have found favour in thine eyes place､ I pray thee､ thy hand under my thigh,—so shalt thou deal with me in lovingkindness and faithfulness— Do not､ I pray thee､ bury me in Egypt.

content: 30 When I shall lie down with my fathers then shalt thou carry me out of Egypt, and bury me in their buryingplace. And he said: I will do according to thy word.
content_old: 30 When I shall lie down with my fathers then shalt thou carry me out of Egypt, and bury me in their buryingplace. And he said: I will do according to thy word.

content: 1 And it came to pass after these things that one said to Joseph, Lo! thy father is sick. So he took his two sons with him, Manasseh and Ephraim.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass after these things that one said to Joseph, Lo! thy father is sick. So he took his two sons with him, Manasseh and Ephraim.

content: 2 And one told Jacob, and said— Lo! thy son Joseph coming in unto thee. So Israel strengthened himself, and sat up on the couch.
content_old: 2 And one told Jacob, and said— Lo! thy son Joseph coming in unto thee. So Israel strengthened himself, and sat up on the couch.

content: 3 Then said Jacob､ unto Joseph, GOD Almighty appeared unto me in Luz､ in the land of Canaan,—and blessed me;
content_old: 3 Then said Jacob､ unto Joseph, GOD Almighty appeared unto me in Luz､ in the land of Canaan,—and blessed me;

content: 4 and said unto me— Behold me! about to make thee fruitful, so will I multiply thee､ and give thee to become a multitude of peoples,—so will I give this land to thy seed after thee､ as an age-abiding possession.
content_old: 4 and said unto me— Behold me! about to make thee fruitful, so will I multiply thee､ and give thee to become a multitude of peoples,—so will I give this land to thy seed after thee､ as an age-abiding possession.

content: 5 Now therefore､thy two sons who were born to thee in the land of Egypt, before I came in unto thee in Egypt are mine! Ephraim and Manasseh like Reuben and Simeon, shall be mine!
content_old: 5 Now therefore､thy two sons who were born to thee in the land of Egypt, before I came in unto thee in Egypt are mine! Ephraim and Manasseh like Reuben and Simeon, shall be mine!

content: 6 But thine offspring which thou hast begotten after them thine own shall they be,—after the name of their brethren shall they be called､ in their inheritance.
content_old: 6 But thine offspring which thou hast begotten after them thine own shall they be,—after the name of their brethren shall they be called､ in their inheritance.

content: 7 But as for me when I came in from Padan Rachel died by me､ in the land of Canaan､ in the way, while yet there was a stretch of country to come into Ephrath,—so I buried her there､ in the way to Ephrath, the same is Bethlehem.
content_old: 7 But as for me when I came in from Padan Rachel died by me､ in the land of Canaan､ in the way, while yet there was a stretch of country to come into Ephrath,—so I buried her there､ in the way to Ephrath, the same is Bethlehem.

content: 8 Then Israel saw Joseph’s sons,—and said— Who are these?
content_old: 8 Then Israel saw Joseph’s sons,—and said— Who are these?

content: 9 And Joseph said unto his father, My sons they are, whom God hath given me､ in this place. And he said— Bring them､ I pray thee､ unto me､ that I may bless them.
content_old: 9 And Joseph said unto his father, My sons they are, whom God hath given me､ in this place. And he said— Bring them､ I pray thee､ unto me､ that I may bless them.

content: 10 Now the eyes of Israel had become dim from old age,—he could not see,—so he drew them near unto him, and kissed them､ and embraced them.
content_old: 10 Now the eyes of Israel had become dim from old age,—he could not see,—so he drew them near unto him, and kissed them､ and embraced them.

content: 11 And Israel said unto Joseph, To see thine own face had I not thought,—and lo! God hath caused me to see even thy seed !
content_old: 11 And Israel said unto Joseph, To see thine own face had I not thought,—and lo! God hath caused me to see even thy seed !

content: 12 And Joseph brought them out from beside his knees, and bowed himself down with his face towards the earth.
content_old: 12 And Joseph brought them out from beside his knees, and bowed himself down with his face towards the earth.

content: 13 And Joseph took them both,—Ephraim in his right hand､ on Israel’s left hand, and Manasseh in his left hand��� on Israel’s right hand,—and drew them near unto him.
content_old: 13 And Joseph took them both,—Ephraim in his right hand､ on Israel’s left hand, and Manasseh in his left hand��� on Israel’s right hand,—and drew them near unto him.

content: 14 Then Israel put forth his right hand､ and laid it upon the head of Ephraim, though he was the younger, and his left hand､ upon the head of Manasseh,—crossing his hands, although Manasseh was the first-born.
content_old: 14 Then Israel put forth his right hand､ and laid it upon the head of Ephraim, though he was the younger, and his left hand､ upon the head of Manasseh,—crossing his hands, although Manasseh was the first-born.

content: 15 Thus blessed he Joseph､ and said,— God himself—before whom walked my fathers､ Abraham and Isaac, God himself—who hath been my shepherd, since I came into being until this day;—
content_old: 15 Thus blessed he Joseph､ and said,— God himself—before whom walked my fathers､ Abraham and Isaac, God himself—who hath been my shepherd, since I came into being until this day;—

content: 16 The Messenger—who hath been my redeemer from all evil—bless the lads! And may there be called upon them､ my name, and the name of my fathers､ Abraham and Isaac; And may they swarm into a multitude in the midst of the earth!
content_old: 16 The Messenger—who hath been my redeemer from all evil—bless the lads! And may there be called upon them､ my name, and the name of my fathers､ Abraham and Isaac; And may they swarm into a multitude in the midst of the earth!

content: 17 And Joseph saw that his father had laid his right hand on the head of Ephraim､ and it was displeasing in his eyes,—so he took hold of his father’s hand､ to remove it from off the head of Ephraim､ on to the head of Manasseh.
content_old: 17 And Joseph saw that his father had laid his right hand on the head of Ephraim､ and it was displeasing in his eyes,—so he took hold of his father’s hand､ to remove it from off the head of Ephraim､ on to the head of Manasseh.

content: 18 And Joseph said unto his father— Not so､ my father! for this is the firstborn, lay thy right hand upon his head.
content_old: 18 And Joseph said unto his father— Not so､ my father! for this is the firstborn, lay thy right hand upon his head.

content: 19 And his father refused､ and said— I know—my son､ I know! He also shall become a people､ and he also shall become great,—but nevertheless､ his younger brother shall become greater than he and his seed shall become a filling up of the nations.
content_old: 19 And his father refused､ and said— I know—my son､ I know! He also shall become a people､ and he also shall become great,—but nevertheless､ his younger brother shall become greater than he and his seed shall become a filling up of the nations.

content: 20 And he blessed them on that day, saying— In thee let Israel bless himself､ saying, God set thee as Ephraim､ and as Manasseh! So he set Ephraim before Manasseh.
content_old: 20 And he blessed them on that day, saying— In thee let Israel bless himself､ saying, God set thee as Ephraim､ and as Manasseh! So he set Ephraim before Manasseh.

content: 21 And Israel said unto Joseph: Lo! I am about to die,—but it shall come to pass that God will be with you, and will take you back into the land of your fathers.
content_old: 21 And Israel said unto Joseph: Lo! I am about to die,—but it shall come to pass that God will be with you, and will take you back into the land of your fathers.

content: 1 Then called Jacob unto his sons,—and said— Gather yourselves together､ and let me tell you, that which shall befall you in the afterpart of the days.
content_old: 1 Then called Jacob unto his sons,—and said— Gather yourselves together､ and let me tell you, that which shall befall you in the afterpart of the days.

content: 2 Assemble yourselves and hear､ ye sons of Jacob,— And hearken､ unto Israel your father!
content_old: 2 Assemble yourselves and hear､ ye sons of Jacob,— And hearken､ unto Israel your father!

content: 3 Reuben my first-born thou, My vigour､ and the first-fruit of my strength,— Pre-eminence of elevation､ and pre-eminence of power:
content_old: 3 Reuben my first-born thou, My vigour､ and the first-fruit of my strength,— Pre-eminence of elevation､ and pre-eminence of power:

content: 4 Boiling over like water､ thou mayest not have pre-eminence, Because thou didst mount the bed of thy father,— Then wast thou profane— My marriage-bed he mounted!
content_old: 4 Boiling over like water､ thou mayest not have pre-eminence, Because thou didst mount the bed of thy father,— Then wast thou profane— My marriage-bed he mounted!

content: 5 Simeon and Levi are brethren,— Instruments of violence are their agreements:
content_old: 5 Simeon and Levi are brethren,— Instruments of violence are their agreements:

content: 6 Into their circle do not thou enter､ my soul! In their convocation do not thou join､ mine honour! For in their anger they slew brave men, And in their wantonness､ they ham-strung oxen.
content_old: 6 Into their circle do not thou enter､ my soul! In their convocation do not thou join､ mine honour! For in their anger they slew brave men, And in their wantonness､ they ham-strung oxen.

content: 7 Accursed be their anger､ because fierce, And their wrath､ because cruel,— I divide them in Jacob, And I disperse them in Israel.
content_old: 7 Accursed be their anger､ because fierce, And their wrath､ because cruel,— I divide them in Jacob, And I disperse them in Israel.

content: 8 Judah as for thee thy brethren shall praise thee when thy hand is on the neck of thy foes,— The sons of thy father shall bow themselves down to thee:
content_old: 8 Judah as for thee thy brethren shall praise thee when thy hand is on the neck of thy foes,— The sons of thy father shall bow themselves down to thee:

content: 9 A lion’s whelp is Judah, From the prey､ my son､ hast thou come up! He hath stooped—hath crouched､ As a lion—or as a lioness､ Who shall rouse him?
content_old: 9 A lion’s whelp is Judah, From the prey､ my son､ hast thou come up! He hath stooped—hath crouched､ As a lion—or as a lioness､ Who shall rouse him?

content: 10 The sceptre shall not depart from Judah, Nor the commander’s staff from between his feet,— Until that he come in as a Shiloh, And his be the obedience of the peoples:
content_old: 10 The sceptre shall not depart from Judah, Nor the commander’s staff from between his feet,— Until that he come in as a Shiloh, And his be the obedience of the peoples:

content: 11 Binding､ to the vine､ his ass, And､ to the choice vine､ his ass’s colt, He hath washed､ in wine､ his raiment, And､ in the blood of grapes､ his mantle:
content_old: 11 Binding､ to the vine､ his ass, And､ to the choice vine､ his ass’s colt, He hath washed､ in wine､ his raiment, And､ in the blood of grapes､ his mantle:

content: 12 Darker—his eyes､ than wine,— Whiter—his teeth､ than milk!
content_old: 12 Darker—his eyes､ than wine,— Whiter—his teeth､ than milk!

content: 13 Zebulon by a haven of seas shall he settle down,— Even he by a haven of ships, With his utmost part､ upon Zidon.
content_old: 13 Zebulon by a haven of seas shall he settle down,— Even he by a haven of ships, With his utmost part､ upon Zidon.

content: 14 Issachar an ass of strength,—couching between the pens;
content_old: 14 Issachar an ass of strength,—couching between the pens;

content: 15 Then beholdeth he rest､ that it is good, And the ground､ that it is pleasant,— So he bendeth his shoulder､ to bear, And becometh a tributary servant.
content_old: 15 Then beholdeth he rest､ that it is good, And the ground､ that it is pleasant,— So he bendeth his shoulder､ to bear, And becometh a tributary servant.

content: 16 Dan shall vindicate his people,—as one of the tribes of Israel;
content_old: 16 Dan shall vindicate his people,—as one of the tribes of Israel;

content: 17 It cometh to pass that Dan is a serpent upon the way, A horned viper､ upon the path,— That biteth the heels of the horse, And his rider falleth backwards:—
content_old: 17 It cometh to pass that Dan is a serpent upon the way, A horned viper､ upon the path,— That biteth the heels of the horse, And his rider falleth backwards:—

content: 18 For thy salvation have I waited､ O Yahweh!
content_old: 18 For thy salvation have I waited､ O Yahweh!

content: 19 Gad a troop shall troop on him,—But he shall troop on the rear.
content_old: 19 Gad a troop shall troop on him,—But he shall troop on the rear.

content: 20 Out of Asher fatness､ is his food,— So he setteth forth dainties for a king.
content_old: 20 Out of Asher fatness､ is his food,— So he setteth forth dainties for a king.

content: 21 Naphtali is a slender hind,— That putteth forth antlers of beauty.
content_old: 21 Naphtali is a slender hind,— That putteth forth antlers of beauty.

content: 22 A fruitful bough is Joseph, A fruitful bough､ over a fountain,— Branches､ creeping over a wall.
content_old: 22 A fruitful bough is Joseph, A fruitful bough､ over a fountain,— Branches､ creeping over a wall.

content: 23 So they attack him､ and have shot,— So they enclose him､ do the masters of arrows.
content_old: 23 So they attack him､ and have shot,— So they enclose him､ do the masters of arrows.

content: 24 But abideth､ as an enduring one､ his bow, And supple are the arms of his hands,— From the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob, From thence is the Shepherd､ the Stone of Israel:
content_old: 24 But abideth､ as an enduring one､ his bow, And supple are the arms of his hands,— From the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob, From thence is the Shepherd､ the Stone of Israel:

content: 25 From the GOD of thy father､ who doth help thee､ And GOD Almighty､ who doth bless thee, Blessings of the heavens､ above, Blessings of the abyss､ couching beneath,— Blessings of breasts and womb:
content_old: 25 From the GOD of thy father､ who doth help thee､ And GOD Almighty､ who doth bless thee, Blessings of the heavens､ above, Blessings of the abyss､ couching beneath,— Blessings of breasts and womb:

content: 26 The blessings of thy father have prevailed Over the blessings of the perpetual mountains, The charm of the age-abiding hills,— They turn out to be､ for the head of Joseph, And for the crown of the head､ of him who was set apart from his brethren.
content_old: 26 The blessings of thy father have prevailed Over the blessings of the perpetual mountains, The charm of the age-abiding hills,— They turn out to be､ for the head of Joseph, And for the crown of the head､ of him who was set apart from his brethren.

content: 27 Benjamin a wolf that teareth in pieces, In the morning he eateth prey, And at eventide he divideth spoil.
content_old: 27 Benjamin a wolf that teareth in pieces, In the morning he eateth prey, And at eventide he divideth spoil.

content: 28 All these are the twelve tribes of Israel,— And this is that which their father spake to them､ when he blessed them, Each man severally according to the blessing wherewith he blessed them.
content_old: 28 All these are the twelve tribes of Israel,— And this is that which their father spake to them､ when he blessed them, Each man severally according to the blessing wherewith he blessed them.

content: 29 Then commanded he them､ and said unto them— I am about to be gathered unto my people, Bury me among my fathers,—within the cave, that is in the field of Ephron the Hittite:
content_old: 29 Then commanded he them､ and said unto them— I am about to be gathered unto my people, Bury me among my fathers,—within the cave, that is in the field of Ephron the Hittite:

content: 30 in the cave､ that is in the field of Machpelah､ which is over against Mamre､ in the land of Canaan,—which Abraham bought､ along with the field､ from Ephron the Hittite､ for a possession of a burying-place:—
content_old: 30 in the cave､ that is in the field of Machpelah､ which is over against Mamre､ in the land of Canaan,—which Abraham bought､ along with the field､ from Ephron the Hittite､ for a possession of a burying-place:—

content: 31 There buried they Abraham､ and Sarah his wife, There buried they Isaac､ and Rebekah his wife,— And there buried I Leah:—
content_old: 31 There buried they Abraham､ and Sarah his wife, There buried they Isaac､ and Rebekah his wife,— And there buried I Leah:—

content: 32 buying the field､ and the cave that is therein､ from the sons of Heth.
content_old: 32 buying the field､ and the cave that is therein､ from the sons of Heth.

content: 1 And Joseph fell upon the face of his father, and wept upon him､ and kissed him.
content_old: 1 And Joseph fell upon the face of his father, and wept upon him､ and kissed him.

content: 2 Then Joseph commanded his servants､ the physicians, to embalm his father,—so the physicians embalmed Israel.
content_old: 2 Then Joseph commanded his servants､ the physicians, to embalm his father,—so the physicians embalmed Israel.

content: 3 And they fulfilled for him forty days, for so are they wont to fulfil the days of the embalmed,—and the Egyptians wept for him seventy days.
content_old: 3 And they fulfilled for him forty days, for so are they wont to fulfil the days of the embalmed,—and the Egyptians wept for him seventy days.

content: 4 And when the days of weeping for him were passed Joseph spake unto the house of Pharaoh､ saying,— If､ I pray you､ I have found favour in your eyes speak ye､ I pray you､ in the ears of Pharaoh､ saying:
content_old: 4 And when the days of weeping for him were passed Joseph spake unto the house of Pharaoh､ saying,— If､ I pray you､ I have found favour in your eyes speak ye､ I pray you､ in the ears of Pharaoh､ saying:

content: 5 My father made me swear､ saying,— Lo! I am about to die,—in my grave which I digged for myself､ in the land of Canaan there shalt thou bury me. Now therefore､ let me go up､ I pray thee､ and bury my father､ and return.
content_old: 5 My father made me swear､ saying,— Lo! I am about to die,—in my grave which I digged for myself､ in the land of Canaan there shalt thou bury me. Now therefore､ let me go up､ I pray thee､ and bury my father､ and return.

content: 6 And Pharaoh said,— Go up､ and bury thy father､ according as he made thee swear.
content_old: 6 And Pharaoh said,— Go up､ and bury thy father､ according as he made thee swear.

content: 7 So Joseph went up､ to bury his father,—and there went up with him all the servants of Pharaoh､ the elders of his house, and all the elders of the land of Egypt;
content_old: 7 So Joseph went up､ to bury his father,—and there went up with him all the servants of Pharaoh､ the elders of his house, and all the elders of the land of Egypt;

content: 8 and all the house of Joseph, and his brethren､ and the house of his father,—only their little ones and their flocks and their herds left they､ in the land of Goshen.
content_old: 8 and all the house of Joseph, and his brethren､ and the house of his father,—only their little ones and their flocks and their herds left they､ in the land of Goshen.

content: 9 And there went up with him, both chariots､ and horsemen,—so it came to pass that the company was exceeding great.
content_old: 9 And there went up with him, both chariots､ and horsemen,—so it came to pass that the company was exceeding great.

content: 10 And they came in､ as far as the threshing-floor of the Buckthorn､ which is beyond the Jordan, then wailed they there—an exceeding great and grievous wailing,—and he made for his father a mourning､ of seven days.
content_old: 10 And they came in､ as far as the threshing-floor of the Buckthorn､ which is beyond the Jordan, then wailed they there—an exceeding great and grievous wailing,—and he made for his father a mourning､ of seven days.

content: 11 And when the dwellers in the land—the Canaanites—saw the mourning in the threshing-floor of the Buckthorn they said,— A grievous mourning this! for the Egyptians. For this cause was the name thereof called､ Abel Mizraim, which is beyond the Jordan.
content_old: 11 And when the dwellers in the land—the Canaanites—saw the mourning in the threshing-floor of the Buckthorn they said,— A grievous mourning this! for the Egyptians. For this cause was the name thereof called､ Abel Mizraim, which is beyond the Jordan.

content: 12 And his sons did for him thus､ as he had commanded them;
content_old: 12 And his sons did for him thus､ as he had commanded them;

content: 13 so his sons carried him to the land of Canaan, and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah,—which Abraham bought—with the field—for a possession of a buryingplace､ from Ephron the Hittite､ over against Mamre.
content_old: 13 so his sons carried him to the land of Canaan, and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah,—which Abraham bought—with the field—for a possession of a buryingplace､ from Ephron the Hittite､ over against Mamre.

content: 14 Then Joseph returned to Egypt､ he､ and his brethren､ and all who had been up with him to bury his father—after he had buried his father.
content_old: 14 Then Joseph returned to Egypt､ he､ and his brethren､ and all who had been up with him to bury his father—after he had buried his father.

content: 15 Now when the brethren of Joseph saw that their father was dead they said— Oh! if Joseph should lie in wait for us,—and should return to us､ all the evil wherewith we requited him!
content_old: 15 Now when the brethren of Joseph saw that their father was dead they said— Oh! if Joseph should lie in wait for us,—and should return to us､ all the evil wherewith we requited him!

content: 16 So they sent in charge unto Joseph､ saying,— Thy father gave command､ before he died､ saying:
content_old: 16 So they sent in charge unto Joseph､ saying,— Thy father gave command､ before he died､ saying:

content: 17 Thus shall ye say to Joseph— Ah now! do forgive､ we pray thee､ the transgression of thy brethren and their sin､ in that with evil they requited thee. Now therefore､ grant forgiveness､ we pray thee､ for the transgression of the servants of the God of thy father! And Joseph wept､ when they spake unto him.
content_old: 17 Thus shall ye say to Joseph— Ah now! do forgive､ we pray thee､ the transgression of thy brethren and their sin､ in that with evil they requited thee. Now therefore､ grant forgiveness､ we pray thee､ for the transgression of the servants of the God of thy father! And Joseph wept､ when they spake unto him.

content: 18 Then went his brethren also, and fell down before him,—and said, Behold us! thine､ for servants.
content_old: 18 Then went his brethren also, and fell down before him,—and said, Behold us! thine､ for servants.

content: 19 And Joseph said unto them— Do not fear,—although in place of God I am.
content_old: 19 And Joseph said unto them— Do not fear,—although in place of God I am.

content: 20 Ye indeed､ planned against me evil,—God planned it for good, for the sake of doing､ as at this day､ to save alive much people.
content_old: 20 Ye indeed､ planned against me evil,—God planned it for good, for the sake of doing､ as at this day､ to save alive much people.

content: 21 Now therefore､ do not fear! I will nourish you､ and your little ones. Thus he consoled them, and spake unto their heart.
content_old: 21 Now therefore､ do not fear! I will nourish you､ and your little ones. Thus he consoled them, and spake unto their heart.

content: 22 And Joseph abode in Egypt, he､ and his father’s house,—and Joseph lived､ a hundred and ten years.
content_old: 22 And Joseph abode in Egypt, he､ and his father’s house,—and Joseph lived､ a hundred and ten years.

content: 23 And Joseph saw Ephraim’s sons of three generations,—moreover the sons of Machir､ son of Manasseh were born upon Joseph’s knees.
content_old: 23 And Joseph saw Ephraim’s sons of three generations,—moreover the sons of Machir､ son of Manasseh were born upon Joseph’s knees.

content: 24 Then said Joseph unto his brethren, I am about to die,—but God will surely concern himself for you､ so will he take you up out of this land､ into the land､ which he sware to Abraham､ to Isaac､ and to Jacob.
content_old: 24 Then said Joseph unto his brethren, I am about to die,—but God will surely concern himself for you､ so will he take you up out of this land､ into the land､ which he sware to Abraham､ to Isaac､ and to Jacob.

content: 25 Then Joseph made the sons of Israel swear､ saying,— God will surely concern himself for you, So shall ye carry up my bones､ from hence.
content_old: 25 Then Joseph made the sons of Israel swear､ saying,— God will surely concern himself for you, So shall ye carry up my bones､ from hence.
